60 namespace {
61  struct CBlockIndexWorkComparator
62  {
63  bool operator()(const CBlockIndex *pa, const CBlockIndex *pb) const {
64  // First sort by most total work, ...
65  if (pa->nChainWork > pb->nChainWork) return false;
66  if (pa->nChainWork < pb->nChainWork) return true;
67 
68  // ... then by earliest time received, ...
69  if (pa->nSequenceId < pb->nSequenceId) return false;
70  if (pa->nSequenceId > pb->nSequenceId) return true;
71 
72  // Use pointer address as tie breaker (should only happen with blocks
73  // loaded from disk, as those all have id 0).
74  if (pa < pb) return false;
75  if (pa > pb) return true;
76 
77  // Identical blocks.
78  return false;
79  }
80  };
81 } // anon namespace

277 CBlockIndex* FindForkInGlobalIndex(const CChain& chain, const CBlockLocator& locator)
278 {
279  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
280 
281  // Find the latest block common to locator and chain - we expect that
282  // locator.vHave is sorted descending by height.
283  for (const uint256& hash : locator.vHave) {
284  CBlockIndex* pindex = LookupBlockIndex(hash);
285  if (pindex) {
286  if (chain.Contains(pindex))
287  return pindex;
288  if (pindex->GetAncestor(chain.Height()) == chain.Tip()) {
289  return chain.Tip();
290  }
291  }
292  }
293  return chain.Genesis();
294 }

314 bool CheckFinalTx(const CTransaction &tx, int flags)
315 {
316  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
317 
318  // By convention a negative value for flags indicates that the
319  // current network-enforced consensus rules should be used. In
320  // a future soft-fork scenario that would mean checking which
321  // rules would be enforced for the next block and setting the
322  // appropriate flags. At the present time no soft-forks are
323  // scheduled, so no flags are set.
324  flags = std::max(flags, 0);
325 
326  // CheckFinalTx() uses chainActive.Height()+1 to evaluate
327  // nLockTime because when IsFinalTx() is called within
328  // CBlock::AcceptBlock(), the height of the block *being*
329  // evaluated is what is used. Thus if we want to know if a
330  // transaction can be part of the *next* block, we need to call
331  // IsFinalTx() with one more than chainActive.Height().
332  const int nBlockHeight = chainActive.Height() + 1;
333 
334  // BIP113 requires that time-locked transactions have nLockTime set to
335  // less than the median time of the previous block they're contained in.
336  // When the next block is created its previous block will be the current
337  // chain tip, so we use that to calculate the median time passed to
338  // IsFinalTx() if LOCKTIME_MEDIAN_TIME_PAST is set.
339  const int64_t nBlockTime = (flags & LOCKTIME_MEDIAN_TIME_PAST)
340  ? chainActive.Tip()->GetMedianTimePast()
341  : GetAdjustedTime();
342 
343  return IsFinalTx(tx, nBlockHeight, nBlockTime);
344 }
345 
346 bool TestLockPointValidity(const LockPoints* lp)
347 {
348  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
349  assert(lp);
350  // If there are relative lock times then the maxInputBlock will be set
351  // If there are no relative lock times, the LockPoints don't depend on the chain
352  if (lp->maxInputBlock) {
353  // Check whether chainActive is an extension of the block at which the LockPoints
354  // calculation was valid. If not LockPoints are no longer valid
355  if (!chainActive.Contains(lp->maxInputBlock)) {
356  return false;
357  }
358  }
359 
360  // LockPoints still valid
361  return true;
362 }
363 
364 bool CheckSequenceLocks(const CTransaction &tx, int flags, LockPoints* lp, bool useExistingLockPoints)
365 {
366  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
367  AssertLockHeld(mempool.cs);
368 
369  CBlockIndex* tip = chainActive.Tip();
370  assert(tip != nullptr);
371 
372  CBlockIndex index;
373  index.pprev = tip;
374  // CheckSequenceLocks() uses chainActive.Height()+1 to evaluate
375  // height based locks because when SequenceLocks() is called within
376  // ConnectBlock(), the height of the block *being*
377  // evaluated is what is used.
378  // Thus if we want to know if a transaction can be part of the
379  // *next* block, we need to use one more than chainActive.Height()
380  index.nHeight = tip->nHeight + 1;
381 
382  std::pair<int, int64_t> lockPair;
383  if (useExistingLockPoints) {
384  assert(lp);
385  lockPair.first = lp->height;
386  lockPair.second = lp->time;
387  }
388  else {
389  // pcoinsTip contains the UTXO set for chainActive.Tip()
390  CCoinsViewMemPool viewMemPool(pcoinsTip.get(), mempool);
391  std::vector<int> prevheights;
392  prevheights.resize(tx.vin.size());
393  for (size_t txinIndex = 0; txinIndex < tx.vin.size(); txinIndex++) {
394  const CTxIn& txin = tx.vin[txinIndex];
395  Coin coin;
396  if (!viewMemPool.GetCoin(txin.prevout, coin)) {
397  return error("%s: Missing input", __func__);
398  }
399  if (coin.nHeight == MEMPOOL_HEIGHT) {
400  // Assume all mempool transaction confirm in the next block
401  prevheights[txinIndex] = tip->nHeight + 1;
402  } else {
403  prevheights[txinIndex] = coin.nHeight;
404  }
405  }
406  lockPair = CalculateSequenceLocks(tx, flags, &prevheights, index);
407  if (lp) {
408  lp->height = lockPair.first;
409  lp->time = lockPair.second;
410  // Also store the hash of the block with the highest height of
411  // all the blocks which have sequence locked prevouts.
412  // This hash needs to still be on the chain
413  // for these LockPoint calculations to be valid
414  // Note: It is impossible to correctly calculate a maxInputBlock
415  // if any of the sequence locked inputs depend on unconfirmed txs,
416  // except in the special case where the relative lock time/height
417  // is 0, which is equivalent to no sequence lock. Since we assume
418  // input height of tip+1 for mempool txs and test the resulting
419  // lockPair from CalculateSequenceLocks against tip+1. We know
420  // EvaluateSequenceLocks will fail if there was a non-zero sequence
421  // lock on a mempool input, so we can use the return value of
422  // CheckSequenceLocks to indicate the LockPoints validity
423  int maxInputHeight = 0;
424  for (int height : prevheights) {
425  // Can ignore mempool inputs since we'll fail if they had non-zero locks
426  if (height != tip->nHeight+1) {
427  maxInputHeight = std::max(maxInputHeight, height);
428  }
429  }
430  lp->maxInputBlock = tip->GetAncestor(maxInputHeight);
431  }
432  }
433  return EvaluateSequenceLocks(index, lockPair);
434 }

439 static void LimitMempoolSize(CTxMemPool& pool, size_t limit, unsigned long age) {
440  int expired = pool.Expire(GetTime() - age);
441  if (expired != 0) {
442  LogPrint(BCLog::MEMPOOL, "Expired %i transactions from the memory pool\n", expired);
443  }
444 
445  std::vector<COutPoint> vNoSpendsRemaining;
446  pool.TrimToSize(limit, &vNoSpendsRemaining);
447  for (const COutPoint& removed : vNoSpendsRemaining)
448  pcoinsTip->Uncache(removed);
449 }

460 static bool IsCurrentForFeeEstimation() EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)
461 {
462  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
463  if (IsInitialBlockDownload())
464  return false;
465  if (chainActive.Tip()->GetBlockTime() < (GetTime() - MAX_FEE_ESTIMATION_TIP_AGE))
466  return false;
467  if (chainActive.Height() < pindexBestHeader->nHeight - 1)
468  return false;
469  return true;
470 }
471 
472 /* Make mempool consistent after a reorg, by re-adding or recursively erasing
473  * disconnected block transactions from the mempool, and also removing any
474  * other transactions from the mempool that are no longer valid given the new
475  * tip/height.
476  *
477  * Note: we assume that disconnectpool only contains transactions that are NOT
478  * confirmed in the current chain nor already in the mempool (otherwise,
479  * in-mempool descendants of such transactions would be removed).
480  *
481  * Passing fAddToMempool=false will skip trying to add the transactions back,
482  * and instead just erase from the mempool as needed.
483  */
484 
485 static void UpdateMempoolForReorg(DisconnectedBlockTransactions &disconnectpool, bool fAddToMempool) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)
486 {
487  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
488  std::vector<uint256> vHashUpdate;
489  // disconnectpool's insertion_order index sorts the entries from
490  // oldest to newest, but the oldest entry will be the last tx from the
491  // latest mined block that was disconnected.
492  // Iterate disconnectpool in reverse, so that we add transactions
493  // back to the mempool starting with the earliest transaction that had
494  // been previously seen in a block.
495  auto it = disconnectpool.queuedTx.get<insertion_order>().rbegin();
496  while (it != disconnectpool.queuedTx.get<insertion_order>().rend()) {
497  // ignore validation errors in resurrected transactions
498  CValidationState stateDummy;
499  if (!fAddToMempool || (*it)->IsCoinBase() ||
500  !AcceptToMemoryPool(mempool, stateDummy, *it, nullptr /* pfMissingInputs */,
501  nullptr /* plTxnReplaced */, true /* bypass_limits */, 0 /* nAbsurdFee */)) {
502  // If the transaction doesn't make it in to the mempool, remove any
503  // transactions that depend on it (which would now be orphans).
504  mempool.removeRecursive(**it, MemPoolRemovalReason::REORG);
505  } else if (mempool.exists((*it)->GetHash())) {
506  vHashUpdate.push_back((*it)->GetHash());
507  }
508  ++it;
509  }
510  disconnectpool.queuedTx.clear();
511  // AcceptToMemoryPool/addUnchecked all assume that new mempool entries have
512  // no in-mempool children, which is generally not true when adding
513  // previously-confirmed transactions back to the mempool.
514  // UpdateTransactionsFromBlock finds descendants of any transactions in
515  // the disconnectpool that were added back and cleans up the mempool state.
516  mempool.UpdateTransactionsFromBlock(vHashUpdate);
517 
518  // We also need to remove any now-immature transactions
519  mempool.removeForReorg(pcoinsTip.get(), chainActive.Tip()->nHeight + 1, STANDARD_LOCKTIME_VERIFY_FLAGS);
520  // Re-limit mempool size, in case we added any transactions
521  LimitMempoolSize(mempool, gArgs.GetArg("-maxmempool", DEFAULT_MAX_MEMPOOL_SIZE) * 1000000, gArgs.GetArg("-mempoolexpiry", DEFAULT_MEMPOOL_EXPIRY) * 60 * 60);
522 }
523 
524 // Used to avoid mempool polluting consensus critical paths if CCoinsViewMempool
525 // were somehow broken and returning the wrong scriptPubKeys
526 static bool CheckInputsFromMempoolAndCache(const CTransaction& tx, CValidationState& state, const CCoinsViewCache& view, const CTxMemPool& pool,
527  unsigned int flags, bool cacheSigStore, PrecomputedTransactionData& txdata) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main) {
528  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
529 
530  // pool.cs should be locked already, but go ahead and re-take the lock here
531  // to enforce that mempool doesn't change between when we check the view
532  // and when we actually call through to CheckInputs
533  LOCK(pool.cs);
534 
535  assert(!tx.IsCoinBase());
536  for (const CTxIn& txin : tx.vin) {
537  const Coin& coin = view.AccessCoin(txin.prevout);
538 
539  // At this point we haven't actually checked if the coins are all
540  // available (or shouldn't assume we have, since CheckInputs does).
541  // So we just return failure if the inputs are not available here,
542  // and then only have to check equivalence for available inputs.
543  if (coin.IsSpent()) return false;
544 
545  const CTransactionRef& txFrom = pool.get(txin.prevout.hash);
546  if (txFrom) {
547  assert(txFrom->GetHash() == txin.prevout.hash);
548  assert(txFrom->vout.size() > txin.prevout.n);
549  assert(txFrom->vout[txin.prevout.n] == coin.out);
550  } else {
551  const Coin& coinFromDisk = pcoinsTip->AccessCoin(txin.prevout);
552  assert(!coinFromDisk.IsSpent());
553  assert(coinFromDisk.out == coin.out);
554  }
555  }
556 
557  return CheckInputs(tx, state, view, true, flags, cacheSigStore, true, txdata);
558 }
559 
560 static bool AcceptToMemoryPoolWorker(const CChainParams& chainparams, CTxMemPool& pool, CValidationState& state, const CTransactionRef& ptx,
561  bool* pfMissingInputs, int64_t nAcceptTime, std::list<CTransactionRef>* plTxnReplaced,
562  bool bypass_limits, const CAmount& nAbsurdFee, std::vector<COutPoint>& coins_to_uncache, bool test_accept) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)
563 {
564  const CTransaction& tx = *ptx;
565  const uint256 hash = tx.GetHash();
566  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
567  LOCK(pool.cs); // mempool "read lock" (held through GetMainSignals().TransactionAddedToMempool())
568  if (pfMissingInputs) {
569  *pfMissingInputs = false;
570  }
571 
572  if (!CheckTransaction(tx, state))
573  return false; // state filled in by CheckTransaction
574 
575  // Coinbase is only valid in a block, not as a loose transaction
576  if (tx.IsCoinBase())
577  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "coinbase");
578 
579  // Rather not work on nonstandard transactions (unless -testnet/-regtest)
580  std::string reason;
581  if (fRequireStandard && !IsStandardTx(tx, reason))
582  return state.DoS(0, false, REJECT_NONSTANDARD, reason);
583 
584  // Do not work on transactions that are too small.
585  // A transaction with 1 segwit input and 1 P2WPHK output has non-witness size of 82 bytes.
586  // Transactions smaller than this are not relayed to reduce unnecessary malloc overhead.
587  if (::GetSerializeSize(tx, SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION | SERIALIZE_TRANSACTION_NO_WITNESS) < MIN_STANDARD_TX_NONWITNESS_SIZE)
588  return state.DoS(0, false, REJECT_NONSTANDARD, "tx-size-small");
589 
590  // Only accept nLockTime-using transactions that can be mined in the next
591  // block; we don't want our mempool filled up with transactions that can't
592  // be mined yet.
593  if (!CheckFinalTx(tx, STANDARD_LOCKTIME_VERIFY_FLAGS))
594  return state.DoS(0, false, REJECT_NONSTANDARD, "non-final");
595 
596  // is it already in the memory pool?
597  if (pool.exists(hash)) {
598  return state.Invalid(false, REJECT_DUPLICATE, "txn-already-in-mempool");
599  }
600 
601  // Check for conflicts with in-memory transactions
602  std::set<uint256> setConflicts;
603  for (const CTxIn &txin : tx.vin)
604  {
605  auto itConflicting = pool.mapNextTx.find(txin.prevout);
606  if (itConflicting != pool.mapNextTx.end())
607  {
608  const CTransaction *ptxConflicting = itConflicting->second;
609  if (!setConflicts.count(ptxConflicting->GetHash()))
610  {
611  // Allow opt-out of transaction replacement by setting
612  // nSequence > MAX_BIP125_RBF_SEQUENCE (SEQUENCE_FINAL-2) on all inputs.
613  //
614  // SEQUENCE_FINAL-1 is picked to still allow use of nLockTime by
615  // non-replaceable transactions. All inputs rather than just one
616  // is for the sake of multi-party protocols, where we don't
617  // want a single party to be able to disable replacement.
618  //
619  // The opt-out ignores descendants as anyone relying on
620  // first-seen mempool behavior should be checking all
621  // unconfirmed ancestors anyway; doing otherwise is hopelessly
622  // insecure.
623  bool fReplacementOptOut = true;
624  if (fEnableReplacement)
625  {
626  for (const CTxIn &_txin : ptxConflicting->vin)
627  {
628  if (_txin.nSequence <= MAX_BIP125_RBF_SEQUENCE)
629  {
630  fReplacementOptOut = false;
631  break;
632  }
633  }
634  }
635  if (fReplacementOptOut) {
636  return state.Invalid(false, REJECT_DUPLICATE, "txn-mempool-conflict");
637  }
638 
639  setConflicts.insert(ptxConflicting->GetHash());
640  }
641  }
642  }
643 
644  {
645  CCoinsView dummy;
646  CCoinsViewCache view(&dummy);
647 
648  LockPoints lp;
649  CCoinsViewMemPool viewMemPool(pcoinsTip.get(), pool);
650  view.SetBackend(viewMemPool);
651 
652  // do all inputs exist?
653  for (const CTxIn& txin : tx.vin) {
654  if (!pcoinsTip->HaveCoinInCache(txin.prevout)) {
655  coins_to_uncache.push_back(txin.prevout);
656  }
657  if (!view.HaveCoin(txin.prevout)) {
658  // Are inputs missing because we already have the tx?
659  for (size_t out = 0; out < tx.vout.size(); out++) {
660  // Optimistically just do efficient check of cache for outputs
661  if (pcoinsTip->HaveCoinInCache(COutPoint(hash, out))) {
662  return state.Invalid(false, REJECT_DUPLICATE, "txn-already-known");
663  }
664  }
665  // Otherwise assume this might be an orphan tx for which we just haven't seen parents yet
666  if (pfMissingInputs) {
667  *pfMissingInputs = true;
668  }
669  return false; // fMissingInputs and !state.IsInvalid() is used to detect this condition, don't set state.Invalid()
670  }
671  }
672 
673  // Bring the best block into scope
674  view.GetBestBlock();
675 
676  // we have all inputs cached now, so switch back to dummy, so we don't need to keep lock on mempool
677  view.SetBackend(dummy);
678 
679  // Only accept BIP68 sequence locked transactions that can be mined in the next
680  // block; we don't want our mempool filled up with transactions that can't
681  // be mined yet.
682  // Must keep pool.cs for this unless we change CheckSequenceLocks to take a
683  // CoinsViewCache instead of create its own
684  if (!CheckSequenceLocks(tx, STANDARD_LOCKTIME_VERIFY_FLAGS, &lp))
685  return state.DoS(0, false, REJECT_NONSTANDARD, "non-BIP68-final");
686 
687  CAmount nFees = 0;
688  if (!Consensus::CheckTxInputs(tx, state, view, GetSpendHeight(view), nFees)) {
689  return error("%s: Consensus::CheckTxInputs: %s, %s", __func__, tx.GetHash().ToString(), FormatStateMessage(state));
690  }
691 
692  // Check for non-standard pay-to-script-hash in inputs
693  if (fRequireStandard && !AreInputsStandard(tx, view))
694  return state.Invalid(false, REJECT_NONSTANDARD, "bad-txns-nonstandard-inputs");
695 
696  // Check for non-standard witness in P2WSH
697  if (tx.HasWitness() && fRequireStandard && !IsWitnessStandard(tx, view))
698  return state.DoS(0, false, REJECT_NONSTANDARD, "bad-witness-nonstandard", true);
699 
700  int64_t nSigOpsCost = GetTransactionSigOpCost(tx, view, STANDARD_SCRIPT_VERIFY_FLAGS);
701 
702  // nModifiedFees includes any fee deltas from PrioritiseTransaction
703  CAmount nModifiedFees = nFees;
704  pool.ApplyDelta(hash, nModifiedFees);
705 
706  // Keep track of transactions that spend a coinbase, which we re-scan
707  // during reorgs to ensure COINBASE_MATURITY is still met.
708  bool fSpendsCoinbase = false;
709  for (const CTxIn &txin : tx.vin) {
710  const Coin &coin = view.AccessCoin(txin.prevout);
711  if (coin.IsCoinBase()) {
712  fSpendsCoinbase = true;
713  break;
714  }
715  }
716 
717  CTxMemPoolEntry entry(ptx, nFees, nAcceptTime, chainActive.Height(),
718  fSpendsCoinbase, nSigOpsCost, lp);
719  unsigned int nSize = entry.GetTxSize();
720 
721  // Check that the transaction doesn't have an excessive number of
722  // sigops, making it impossible to mine. Since the coinbase transaction
723  // itself can contain sigops MAX_STANDARD_TX_SIGOPS is less than
724  // MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS; we still consider this an invalid rather than
725  // merely non-standard transaction.
726  if (nSigOpsCost > MAX_STANDARD_TX_SIGOPS_COST)
727  return state.DoS(0, false, REJECT_NONSTANDARD, "bad-txns-too-many-sigops", false,
728  strprintf("%d", nSigOpsCost));
729 
730  CAmount mempoolRejectFee = pool.GetMinFee(gArgs.GetArg("-maxmempool", DEFAULT_MAX_MEMPOOL_SIZE) * 1000000).GetFee(nSize);
731  if (!bypass_limits && mempoolRejectFee > 0 && nModifiedFees < mempoolRejectFee) {
732  return state.DoS(0, false, REJECT_INSUFFICIENTFEE, "mempool min fee not met", false, strprintf("%d < %d", nModifiedFees, mempoolRejectFee));
733  }
734 
735  // No transactions are allowed below minRelayTxFee except from disconnected blocks
736  if (!bypass_limits && nModifiedFees < ::minRelayTxFee.GetFee(nSize)) {
737  return state.DoS(0, false, REJECT_INSUFFICIENTFEE, "min relay fee not met", false, strprintf("%d < %d", nModifiedFees, ::minRelayTxFee.GetFee(nSize)));
738  }
739 
740  if (nAbsurdFee && nFees > nAbsurdFee)
741  return state.Invalid(false,
742  REJECT_HIGHFEE, "absurdly-high-fee",
743  strprintf("%d > %d", nFees, nAbsurdFee));
744 
745  // Calculate in-mempool ancestors, up to a limit.
746  CTxMemPool::setEntries setAncestors;
747  size_t nLimitAncestors = gArgs.GetArg("-limitancestorcount", DEFAULT_ANCESTOR_LIMIT);
748  size_t nLimitAncestorSize = gArgs.GetArg("-limitancestorsize", DEFAULT_ANCESTOR_SIZE_LIMIT)*1000;
749  size_t nLimitDescendants = gArgs.GetArg("-limitdescendantcount", DEFAULT_DESCENDANT_LIMIT);
750  size_t nLimitDescendantSize = gArgs.GetArg("-limitdescendantsize", DEFAULT_DESCENDANT_SIZE_LIMIT)*1000;
751  std::string errString;
752  if (!pool.CalculateMemPoolAncestors(entry, setAncestors, nLimitAncestors, nLimitAncestorSize, nLimitDescendants, nLimitDescendantSize, errString)) {
753  return state.DoS(0, false, REJECT_NONSTANDARD, "too-long-mempool-chain", false, errString);
754  }
755 
756  // A transaction that spends outputs that would be replaced by it is invalid. Now
757  // that we have the set of all ancestors we can detect this
758  // pathological case by making sure setConflicts and setAncestors don't
759  // intersect.
760  for (CTxMemPool::txiter ancestorIt : setAncestors)
761  {
762  const uint256 &hashAncestor = ancestorIt->GetTx().GetHash();
763  if (setConflicts.count(hashAncestor))
764  {
765  return state.DoS(10, false,
766  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-spends-conflicting-tx", false,
767  strprintf("%s spends conflicting transaction %s",
768  hash.ToString(),
769  hashAncestor.ToString()));
770  }
771  }
772 
773  // Check if it's economically rational to mine this transaction rather
774  // than the ones it replaces.
775  CAmount nConflictingFees = 0;
776  size_t nConflictingSize = 0;
777  uint64_t nConflictingCount = 0;
778  CTxMemPool::setEntries allConflicting;
779 
780  // If we don't hold the lock allConflicting might be incomplete; the
781  // subsequent RemoveStaged() and addUnchecked() calls don't guarantee
782  // mempool consistency for us.
783  const bool fReplacementTransaction = setConflicts.size();
784  if (fReplacementTransaction)
785  {
786  CFeeRate newFeeRate(nModifiedFees, nSize);
787  std::set<uint256> setConflictsParents;
788  const int maxDescendantsToVisit = 100;
789  CTxMemPool::setEntries setIterConflicting;
790  for (const uint256 &hashConflicting : setConflicts)
791  {
792  CTxMemPool::txiter mi = pool.mapTx.find(hashConflicting);
793  if (mi == pool.mapTx.end())
794  continue;
795 
796  // Save these to avoid repeated lookups
797  setIterConflicting.insert(mi);
798 
799  // Don't allow the replacement to reduce the feerate of the
800  // mempool.
801  //
802  // We usually don't want to accept replacements with lower
803  // feerates than what they replaced as that would lower the
804  // feerate of the next block. Requiring that the feerate always
805  // be increased is also an easy-to-reason about way to prevent
806  // DoS attacks via replacements.
807  //
808  // We only consider the feerates of transactions being directly
809  // replaced, not their indirect descendants. While that does
810  // mean high feerate children are ignored when deciding whether
811  // or not to replace, we do require the replacement to pay more
812  // overall fees too, mitigating most cases.
813  CFeeRate oldFeeRate(mi->GetModifiedFee(), mi->GetTxSize());
814  if (newFeeRate <= oldFeeRate)
815  {
816  return state.DoS(0, false,
817  REJECT_INSUFFICIENTFEE, "insufficient fee", false,
818  strprintf("rejecting replacement %s; new feerate %s <= old feerate %s",
819  hash.ToString(),
820  newFeeRate.ToString(),
821  oldFeeRate.ToString()));
822  }
823 
824  for (const CTxIn &txin : mi->GetTx().vin)
825  {
826  setConflictsParents.insert(txin.prevout.hash);
827  }
828 
829  nConflictingCount += mi->GetCountWithDescendants();
830  }
831  // This potentially overestimates the number of actual descendants
832  // but we just want to be conservative to avoid doing too much
833  // work.
834  if (nConflictingCount <= maxDescendantsToVisit) {
835  // If not too many to replace, then calculate the set of
836  // transactions that would have to be evicted
837  for (CTxMemPool::txiter it : setIterConflicting) {
838  pool.CalculateDescendants(it, allConflicting);
839  }
840  for (CTxMemPool::txiter it : allConflicting) {
841  nConflictingFees += it->GetModifiedFee();
842  nConflictingSize += it->GetTxSize();
843  }
844  } else {
845  return state.DoS(0, false,
846  REJECT_NONSTANDARD, "too many potential replacements", false,
847  strprintf("rejecting replacement %s; too many potential replacements (%d > %d)\n",
848  hash.ToString(),
849  nConflictingCount,
850  maxDescendantsToVisit));
851  }
852 
853  for (unsigned int j = 0; j < tx.vin.size(); j++)
854  {
855  // We don't want to accept replacements that require low
856  // feerate junk to be mined first. Ideally we'd keep track of
857  // the ancestor feerates and make the decision based on that,
858  // but for now requiring all new inputs to be confirmed works.
859  if (!setConflictsParents.count(tx.vin[j].prevout.hash))
860  {
861  // Rather than check the UTXO set - potentially expensive -
862  // it's cheaper to just check if the new input refers to a
863  // tx that's in the mempool.
864  if (pool.mapTx.find(tx.vin[j].prevout.hash) != pool.mapTx.end())
865  return state.DoS(0, false,
866  REJECT_NONSTANDARD, "replacement-adds-unconfirmed", false,
867  strprintf("replacement %s adds unconfirmed input, idx %d",
868  hash.ToString(), j));
869  }
870  }
871 
872  // The replacement must pay greater fees than the transactions it
873  // replaces - if we did the bandwidth used by those conflicting
874  // transactions would not be paid for.
875  if (nModifiedFees < nConflictingFees)
876  {
877  return state.DoS(0, false,
878  REJECT_INSUFFICIENTFEE, "insufficient fee", false,
879  strprintf("rejecting replacement %s, less fees than conflicting txs; %s < %s",
880  hash.ToString(), FormatMoney(nModifiedFees), FormatMoney(nConflictingFees)));
881  }
882 
883  // Finally in addition to paying more fees than the conflicts the
884  // new transaction must pay for its own bandwidth.
885  CAmount nDeltaFees = nModifiedFees - nConflictingFees;
886  if (nDeltaFees < ::incrementalRelayFee.GetFee(nSize))
887  {
888  return state.DoS(0, false,
889  REJECT_INSUFFICIENTFEE, "insufficient fee", false,
890  strprintf("rejecting replacement %s, not enough additional fees to relay; %s < %s",
891  hash.ToString(),
892  FormatMoney(nDeltaFees),
893  FormatMoney(::incrementalRelayFee.GetFee(nSize))));
894  }
895  }
896 
897  constexpr unsigned int scriptVerifyFlags = STANDARD_SCRIPT_VERIFY_FLAGS;
898 
899  // Check against previous transactions
900  // This is done last to help prevent CPU exhaustion denial-of-service attacks.
901  PrecomputedTransactionData txdata(tx);
902  if (!CheckInputs(tx, state, view, true, scriptVerifyFlags, true, false, txdata)) {
903  // SCRIPT_VERIFY_CLEANSTACK requires SCRIPT_VERIFY_WITNESS, so we
904  // need to turn both off, and compare against just turning off CLEANSTACK
905  // to see if the failure is specifically due to witness validation.
906  CValidationState stateDummy; // Want reported failures to be from first CheckInputs
907  if (!tx.HasWitness() && CheckInputs(tx, stateDummy, view, true, scriptVerifyFlags & ~(SCRIPT_VERIFY_WITNESS | SCRIPT_VERIFY_CLEANSTACK), true, false, txdata) &&
908  !CheckInputs(tx, stateDummy, view, true, scriptVerifyFlags & ~SCRIPT_VERIFY_CLEANSTACK, true, false, txdata)) {
909  // Only the witness is missing, so the transaction itself may be fine.
910  state.SetCorruptionPossible();
911  }
912  return false; // state filled in by CheckInputs
913  }
914 
915  // Check again against the current block tip's script verification
916  // flags to cache our script execution flags. This is, of course,
917  // useless if the next block has different script flags from the
918  // previous one, but because the cache tracks script flags for us it
919  // will auto-invalidate and we'll just have a few blocks of extra
920  // misses on soft-fork activation.
921  //
922  // This is also useful in case of bugs in the standard flags that cause
923  // transactions to pass as valid when they're actually invalid. For
924  // instance the STRICTENC flag was incorrectly allowing certain
925  // CHECKSIG NOT scripts to pass, even though they were invalid.
926  //
927  // There is a similar check in CreateNewBlock() to prevent creating
928  // invalid blocks (using TestBlockValidity), however allowing such
929  // transactions into the mempool can be exploited as a DoS attack.
930  unsigned int currentBlockScriptVerifyFlags = GetBlockScriptFlags(chainActive.Tip(), Params().GetConsensus());
931  if (!CheckInputsFromMempoolAndCache(tx, state, view, pool, currentBlockScriptVerifyFlags, true, txdata)) {
932  return error("%s: BUG! PLEASE REPORT THIS! CheckInputs failed against latest-block but not STANDARD flags %s, %s",
933  __func__, hash.ToString(), FormatStateMessage(state));
934  }
935 
936  if (test_accept) {
937  // Tx was accepted, but not added
938  return true;
939  }
940 
941  // Remove conflicting transactions from the mempool
942  for (CTxMemPool::txiter it : allConflicting)
943  {
944  LogPrint(BCLog::MEMPOOL, "replacing tx %s with %s for %s BTC additional fees, %d delta bytes\n",
945  it->GetTx().GetHash().ToString(),
946  hash.ToString(),
947  FormatMoney(nModifiedFees - nConflictingFees),
948  (int)nSize - (int)nConflictingSize);
949  if (plTxnReplaced)
950  plTxnReplaced->push_back(it->GetSharedTx());
951  }
952  pool.RemoveStaged(allConflicting, false, MemPoolRemovalReason::REPLACED);
953 
954  // This transaction should only count for fee estimation if:
955  // - it isn't a BIP 125 replacement transaction (may not be widely supported)
956  // - it's not being re-added during a reorg which bypasses typical mempool fee limits
957  // - the node is not behind
958  // - the transaction is not dependent on any other transactions in the mempool
959  bool validForFeeEstimation = !fReplacementTransaction && !bypass_limits && IsCurrentForFeeEstimation() && pool.HasNoInputsOf(tx);
960 
961  // Store transaction in memory
962  pool.addUnchecked(hash, entry, setAncestors, validForFeeEstimation);
963 
964  // trim mempool and check if tx was trimmed
965  if (!bypass_limits) {
966  LimitMempoolSize(pool, gArgs.GetArg("-maxmempool", DEFAULT_MAX_MEMPOOL_SIZE) * 1000000, gArgs.GetArg("-mempoolexpiry", DEFAULT_MEMPOOL_EXPIRY) * 60 * 60);
967  if (!pool.exists(hash))
968  return state.DoS(0, false, REJECT_INSUFFICIENTFEE, "mempool full");
969  }
970  }
971 
972  GetMainSignals().TransactionAddedToMempool(ptx);
973 
974  return true;
975 }
976 
978 static bool AcceptToMemoryPoolWithTime(const CChainParams& chainparams, CTxMemPool& pool, CValidationState &state, const CTransactionRef &tx,
979  bool* pfMissingInputs, int64_t nAcceptTime, std::list<CTransactionRef>* plTxnReplaced,
980  bool bypass_limits, const CAmount nAbsurdFee, bool test_accept) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)
981 {
982  std::vector<COutPoint> coins_to_uncache;
983  bool res = AcceptToMemoryPoolWorker(chainparams, pool, state, tx, pfMissingInputs, nAcceptTime, plTxnReplaced, bypass_limits, nAbsurdFee, coins_to_uncache, test_accept);
984  if (!res) {
985  for (const COutPoint& hashTx : coins_to_uncache)
986  pcoinsTip->Uncache(hashTx);
987  }
988  // After we've (potentially) uncached entries, ensure our coins cache is still within its size limits
989  CValidationState stateDummy;
990  FlushStateToDisk(chainparams, stateDummy, FlushStateMode::PERIODIC);
991  return res;
992 }
993 
994 bool AcceptToMemoryPool(CTxMemPool& pool, CValidationState &state, const CTransactionRef &tx,
995  bool* pfMissingInputs, std::list<CTransactionRef>* plTxnReplaced,
996  bool bypass_limits, const CAmount nAbsurdFee, bool test_accept)
997 {
998  const CChainParams& chainparams = Params();
999  return AcceptToMemoryPoolWithTime(chainparams, pool, state, tx, pfMissingInputs, GetTime(), plTxnReplaced, bypass_limits, nAbsurdFee, test_accept);
1000 }

1006 bool GetTransaction(const uint256& hash, CTransactionRef& txOut, const Consensus::Params& consensusParams, uint256& hashBlock, bool fAllowSlow, CBlockIndex* blockIndex)
1007 {
1008  CBlockIndex* pindexSlow = blockIndex;
1009 
1010  LOCK(cs_main);
1011 
1012  if (!blockIndex) {
1013  CTransactionRef ptx = mempool.get(hash);
1014  if (ptx) {
1015  txOut = ptx;
1016  return true;
1017  }
1018 
1019  if (g_txindex) {
1020  return g_txindex->FindTx(hash, hashBlock, txOut);
1021  }
1022 
1023  if (fAllowSlow) { // use coin database to locate block that contains transaction, and scan it
1024  const Coin& coin = AccessByTxid(*pcoinsTip, hash);
1025  if (!coin.IsSpent()) pindexSlow = chainActive[coin.nHeight];
1026  }
1027  }
1028 
1029  if (pindexSlow) {
1030  CBlock block;
1031  if (ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pindexSlow, consensusParams)) {
1032  for (const auto& tx : block.vtx) {
1033  if (tx->GetHash() == hash) {
1034  txOut = tx;
1035  hashBlock = pindexSlow->GetBlockHash();
1036  return true;
1037  }
1038  }
1039  }
1040  }
1041 
1042  return false;
1043 }

1051 //
1052 // CBlock and CBlockIndex
1053 //
1054 
1055 static bool WriteBlockToDisk(const CBlock& block, CDiskBlockPos& pos, const CMessageHeader::MessageStartChars& messageStart)
1056 {
1057  // Open history file to append
1058  CAutoFile fileout(OpenBlockFile(pos), SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
1059  if (fileout.IsNull())
1060  return error("WriteBlockToDisk: OpenBlockFile failed");
1061 
1062  // Write index header
1063  unsigned int nSize = GetSerializeSize(fileout, block);
1064  fileout << messageStart << nSize;
1065 
1066  // Write block
1067  long fileOutPos = ftell(fileout.Get());
1068  if (fileOutPos < 0)
1069  return error("WriteBlockToDisk: ftell failed");
1070  pos.nPos = (unsigned int)fileOutPos;
1071  fileout << block;
1072 
1073  return true;
1074 }
1075 
1076 bool ReadBlockFromDisk(CBlock& block, const CDiskBlockPos& pos, const Consensus::Params& consensusParams)
1077 {
1078  block.SetNull();
1079 
1080  // Open history file to read
1081  CAutoFile filein(OpenBlockFile(pos, true), SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
1082  if (filein.IsNull())
1083  return error("ReadBlockFromDisk: OpenBlockFile failed for %s", pos.ToString());
1084 
1085  // Read block
1086  try {
1087  filein >> block;
1088  }
1089  catch (const std::exception& e) {
1090  return error("%s: Deserialize or I/O error - %s at %s", __func__, e.what(), pos.ToString());
1091  }
1092 
1093  // Check the header
1094  if (!CheckProofOfWork(block.GetHash(), block.nBits, consensusParams))
1095  return error("ReadBlockFromDisk: Errors in block header at %s", pos.ToString());
1096 
1097  return true;
1098 }
1099 
1100 bool ReadBlockFromDisk(CBlock& block, const CBlockIndex* pindex, const Consensus::Params& consensusParams)
1101 {
1102  CDiskBlockPos blockPos;
1103  {
1104  LOCK(cs_main);
1105  blockPos = pindex->GetBlockPos();
1106  }
1107 
1108  if (!ReadBlockFromDisk(block, blockPos, consensusParams))
1109  return false;
1110  if (block.GetHash() != pindex->GetBlockHash())
1111  return error("ReadBlockFromDisk(CBlock&, CBlockIndex*): GetHash() doesn't match index for %s at %s",
1112  pindex->ToString(), pindex->GetBlockPos().ToString());
1113  return true;
1114 }
1115 
1116 bool ReadRawBlockFromDisk(std::vector<uint8_t>& block, const CDiskBlockPos& pos, const CMessageHeader::MessageStartChars& message_start)
1117 {
1118  CDiskBlockPos hpos = pos;
1119  hpos.nPos -= 8; // Seek back 8 bytes for meta header
1120  CAutoFile filein(OpenBlockFile(hpos, true), SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
1121  if (filein.IsNull()) {
1122  return error("%s: OpenBlockFile failed for %s", __func__, pos.ToString());
1123  }
1124 
1125  try {
1126  CMessageHeader::MessageStartChars blk_start;
1127  unsigned int blk_size;
1128 
1129  filein >> blk_start >> blk_size;
1130 
1131  if (memcmp(blk_start, message_start, CMessageHeader::MESSAGE_START_SIZE)) {
1132  return error("%s: Block magic mismatch for %s: %s versus expected %s", __func__, pos.ToString(),
1133  HexStr(blk_start, blk_start + CMessageHeader::MESSAGE_START_SIZE),
1134  HexStr(message_start, message_start + CMessageHeader::MESSAGE_START_SIZE));
1135  }
1136 
1137  if (blk_size > MAX_SIZE) {
1138  return error("%s: Block data is larger than maximum deserialization size for %s: %s versus %s", __func__, pos.ToString(),
1139  blk_size, MAX_SIZE);
1140  }
1141 
1142  block.resize(blk_size); // Zeroing of memory is intentional here
1143  filein.read((char*)block.data(), blk_size);
1144  } catch(const std::exception& e) {
1145  return error("%s: Read from block file failed: %s for %s", __func__, e.what(), pos.ToString());
1146  }
1147 
1148  return true;
1149 }
1150 
1151 bool ReadRawBlockFromDisk(std::vector<uint8_t>& block, const CBlockIndex* pindex, const CMessageHeader::MessageStartChars& message_start)
1152 {
1153  CDiskBlockPos block_pos;
1154  {
1155  LOCK(cs_main);
1156  block_pos = pindex->GetBlockPos();
1157  }
1158 
1159  return ReadRawBlockFromDisk(block, block_pos, message_start);
1160 }
1161 
1162 CAmount GetBlockSubsidy(int nHeight, const Consensus::Params& consensusParams)
1163 {
1164  int halvings = nHeight / consensusParams.nSubsidyHalvingInterval;
1165  // Force block reward to zero when right shift is undefined.
1166  if (halvings >= 64)
1167  return 0;
1168 
1169  CAmount nSubsidy = 50 * COIN;
1170  // Subsidy is cut in half every 210,000 blocks which will occur approximately every 4 years.
1171  nSubsidy >>= halvings;
1172  return nSubsidy;
1173 }
1174 
1175 bool IsInitialBlockDownload()
1176 {
1177  // Once this function has returned false, it must remain false.
1178  static std::atomic<bool> latchToFalse{false};
1179  // Optimization: pre-test latch before taking the lock.
1180  if (latchToFalse.load(std::memory_order_relaxed))
1181  return false;
1182 
1183  LOCK(cs_main);
1184  if (latchToFalse.load(std::memory_order_relaxed))
1185  return false;
1186  if (fImporting || fReindex)
1187  return true;
1188  if (chainActive.Tip() == nullptr)
1189  return true;
1190  if (chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork < nMinimumChainWork)
1191  return true;
1192  if (chainActive.Tip()->GetBlockTime() < (GetTime() - nMaxTipAge))
1193  return true;
1194  LogPrintf("Leaving InitialBlockDownload (latching to false)\n");
1195  latchToFalse.store(true, std::memory_order_relaxed);
1196  return false;
1197 }
1198 
1199 CBlockIndex *pindexBestForkTip = nullptr, *pindexBestForkBase = nullptr;
1200 
1201 static void AlertNotify(const std::string& strMessage)
1202 {
1203  uiInterface.NotifyAlertChanged();
1204  std::string strCmd = gArgs.GetArg("-alertnotify", "");
1205  if (strCmd.empty()) return;
1206 
1207  // Alert text should be plain ascii coming from a trusted source, but to
1208  // be safe we first strip anything not in safeChars, then add single quotes around
1209  // the whole string before passing it to the shell:
1210  std::string singleQuote("'");
1211  std::string safeStatus = SanitizeString(strMessage);
1212  safeStatus = singleQuote+safeStatus+singleQuote;
1213  boost::replace_all(strCmd, "%s", safeStatus);
1214 
1215  std::thread t(runCommand, strCmd);
1216  t.detach(); // thread runs free
1217 }
1218 
1219 static void CheckForkWarningConditions() EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)
1220 {
1221  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
1222  // Before we get past initial download, we cannot reliably alert about forks
1223  // (we assume we don't get stuck on a fork before finishing our initial sync)
1224  if (IsInitialBlockDownload())
1225  return;
1226 
1227  // If our best fork is no longer within 72 blocks (+/- 12 hours if no one mines it)
1228  // of our head, drop it
1229  if (pindexBestForkTip && chainActive.Height() - pindexBestForkTip->nHeight >= 72)
1230  pindexBestForkTip = nullptr;
1231 
1232  if (pindexBestForkTip || (pindexBestInvalid && pindexBestInvalid->nChainWork > chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork + (GetBlockProof(*chainActive.Tip()) * 6)))
1233  {
1234  if (!GetfLargeWorkForkFound() && pindexBestForkBase)
1235  {
1236  std::string warning = std::string("'Warning: Large-work fork detected, forking after block ") +
1237  pindexBestForkBase->phashBlock->ToString() + std::string("'");
1238  AlertNotify(warning);
1239  }
1240  if (pindexBestForkTip && pindexBestForkBase)
1241  {
1242  LogPrintf("%s: Warning: Large valid fork found\n forking the chain at height %d (%s)\n lasting to height %d (%s).\nChain state database corruption likely.\n", __func__,
1243  pindexBestForkBase->nHeight, pindexBestForkBase->phashBlock->ToString(),
1244  pindexBestForkTip->nHeight, pindexBestForkTip->phashBlock->ToString());
1245  SetfLargeWorkForkFound(true);
1246  }
1247  else
1248  {
1249  LogPrintf("%s: Warning: Found invalid chain at least ~6 blocks longer than our best chain.\nChain state database corruption likely.\n", __func__);
1250  SetfLargeWorkInvalidChainFound(true);
1251  }
1252  }
1253  else
1254  {
1255  SetfLargeWorkForkFound(false);
1256  SetfLargeWorkInvalidChainFound(false);
1257  }
1258 }
1259 
1260 static void CheckForkWarningConditionsOnNewFork(CBlockIndex* pindexNewForkTip) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)
1261 {
1262  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
1263  // If we are on a fork that is sufficiently large, set a warning flag
1264  CBlockIndex* pfork = pindexNewForkTip;
1265  CBlockIndex* plonger = chainActive.Tip();
1266  while (pfork && pfork != plonger)
1267  {
1268  while (plonger && plonger->nHeight > pfork->nHeight)
1269  plonger = plonger->pprev;
1270  if (pfork == plonger)
1271  break;
1272  pfork = pfork->pprev;
1273  }
1274 
1275  // We define a condition where we should warn the user about as a fork of at least 7 blocks
1276  // with a tip within 72 blocks (+/- 12 hours if no one mines it) of ours
1277  // We use 7 blocks rather arbitrarily as it represents just under 10% of sustained network
1278  // hash rate operating on the fork.
1279  // or a chain that is entirely longer than ours and invalid (note that this should be detected by both)
1280  // We define it this way because it allows us to only store the highest fork tip (+ base) which meets
1281  // the 7-block condition and from this always have the most-likely-to-cause-warning fork
1282  if (pfork && (!pindexBestForkTip || pindexNewForkTip->nHeight > pindexBestForkTip->nHeight) &&
1283  pindexNewForkTip->nChainWork - pfork->nChainWork > (GetBlockProof(*pfork) * 7) &&
1284  chainActive.Height() - pindexNewForkTip->nHeight < 72)
1285  {
1286  pindexBestForkTip = pindexNewForkTip;
1287  pindexBestForkBase = pfork;
1288  }
1289 
1290  CheckForkWarningConditions();
1291 }
1292 
1293 void static InvalidChainFound(CBlockIndex* pindexNew) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)
1294 {
1295  if (!pindexBestInvalid || pindexNew->nChainWork > pindexBestInvalid->nChainWork)
1296  pindexBestInvalid = pindexNew;
1297 
1298  LogPrintf("%s: invalid block=%s height=%d log2_work=%.8g date=%s\n", __func__,
1299  pindexNew->GetBlockHash().ToString(), pindexNew->nHeight,
1300  log(pindexNew->nChainWork.getdouble())/log(2.0), FormatISO8601DateTime(pindexNew->GetBlockTime()));
1301  CBlockIndex *tip = chainActive.Tip();
1302  assert (tip);
1303  LogPrintf("%s: current best=%s height=%d log2_work=%.8g date=%s\n", __func__,
1304  tip->GetBlockHash().ToString(), chainActive.Height(), log(tip->nChainWork.getdouble())/log(2.0),
1305  FormatISO8601DateTime(tip->GetBlockTime()));
1306  CheckForkWarningConditions();
1307 }

1328  }
1329  }

1332 }

1354 static CuckooCache::cache<uint256, SignatureCacheHasher> scriptExecutionCache;
1355 static uint256 scriptExecutionCacheNonce(GetRandHash());
1356 
1357 void InitScriptExecutionCache() {
1358  // nMaxCacheSize is unsigned. If -maxsigcachesize is set to zero,
1359  // setup_bytes creates the minimum possible cache (2 elements).
1360  size_t nMaxCacheSize = std::min(std::max((int64_t)0, gArgs.GetArg("-maxsigcachesize", DEFAULT_MAX_SIG_CACHE_SIZE) / 2), MAX_MAX_SIG_CACHE_SIZE) * ((size_t) 1 << 20);
1361  size_t nElems = scriptExecutionCache.setup_bytes(nMaxCacheSize);
1362  LogPrintf("Using %zu MiB out of %zu/2 requested for script execution cache, able to store %zu elements\n",
1363  (nElems*sizeof(uint256)) >>20, (nMaxCacheSize*2)>>20, nElems);
1364 }
1365 
1380 bool CheckInputs(const CTransaction& tx, CValidationState &state, const CCoinsViewCache &inputs, bool fScriptChecks, unsigned int flags, bool cacheSigStore, bool cacheFullScriptStore, PrecomputedTransactionData& txdata, std::vector<CScriptCheck> *pvChecks) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)
1381 {
1382  if (!tx.IsCoinBase())
1383  {
1384  if (pvChecks)
1385  pvChecks->reserve(tx.vin.size());
1386 
1387  // The first loop above does all the inexpensive checks.
1388  // Only if ALL inputs pass do we perform expensive ECDSA signature checks.
1389  // Helps prevent CPU exhaustion attacks.
1390 
1391  // Skip script verification when connecting blocks under the
1392  // assumevalid block. Assuming the assumevalid block is valid this
1393  // is safe because block merkle hashes are still computed and checked,
1394  // Of course, if an assumed valid block is invalid due to false scriptSigs
1395  // this optimization would allow an invalid chain to be accepted.
1396  if (fScriptChecks) {
1397  // First check if script executions have been cached with the same
1398  // flags. Note that this assumes that the inputs provided are
1399  // correct (ie that the transaction hash which is in tx's prevouts
1400  // properly commits to the scriptPubKey in the inputs view of that
1401  // transaction).
1402  uint256 hashCacheEntry;
1403  // We only use the first 19 bytes of nonce to avoid a second SHA
1404  // round - giving us 19 + 32 + 4 = 55 bytes (+ 8 + 1 = 64)
1405  static_assert(55 - sizeof(flags) - 32 >= 128/8, "Want at least 128 bits of nonce for script execution cache");
1406  CSHA256().Write(scriptExecutionCacheNonce.begin(), 55 - sizeof(flags) - 32).Write(tx.GetWitnessHash().begin(), 32).Write((unsigned char*)&flags, sizeof(flags)).Finalize(hashCacheEntry.begin());
1407  AssertLockHeld(cs_main); //TODO: Remove this requirement by making CuckooCache not require external locks
1408  if (scriptExecutionCache.contains(hashCacheEntry, !cacheFullScriptStore)) {
1409  return true;
1410  }
1411 
1412  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vin.size(); i++) {
1413  const COutPoint &prevout = tx.vin[i].prevout;
1414  const Coin& coin = inputs.AccessCoin(prevout);
1415  assert(!coin.IsSpent());
1416 
1417  // We very carefully only pass in things to CScriptCheck which
1418  // are clearly committed to by tx' witness hash. This provides
1419  // a sanity check that our caching is not introducing consensus
1420  // failures through additional data in, eg, the coins being
1421  // spent being checked as a part of CScriptCheck.
1422 
1423  // Verify signature
1424  CScriptCheck check(coin.out, tx, i, flags, cacheSigStore, &txdata);
1425  if (pvChecks) {
1426  pvChecks->push_back(CScriptCheck());
1427  check.swap(pvChecks->back());
1428  } else if (!check()) {
1429  if (flags & STANDARD_NOT_MANDATORY_VERIFY_FLAGS) {
1430  // Check whether the failure was caused by a
1431  // non-mandatory script verification check, such as
1432  // non-standard DER encodings or non-null dummy
1433  // arguments; if so, don't trigger DoS protection to
1434  // avoid splitting the network between upgraded and
1435  // non-upgraded nodes.
1436  CScriptCheck check2(coin.out, tx, i,
1437  flags & ~STANDARD_NOT_MANDATORY_VERIFY_FLAGS, cacheSigStore, &txdata);
1438  if (check2())
1439  return state.Invalid(false, REJECT_NONSTANDARD, strprintf("non-mandatory-script-verify-flag (%s)", ScriptErrorString(check.GetScriptError())));
1440  }
1441  // Failures of other flags indicate a transaction that is
1442  // invalid in new blocks, e.g. an invalid P2SH. We DoS ban
1443  // such nodes as they are not following the protocol. That
1444  // said during an upgrade careful thought should be taken
1445  // as to the correct behavior - we may want to continue
1446  // peering with non-upgraded nodes even after soft-fork
1447  // super-majority signaling has occurred.
1448  return state.DoS(100,false, REJECT_INVALID, strprintf("mandatory-script-verify-flag-failed (%s)", ScriptErrorString(check.GetScriptError())));
1449  }
1450  }
1451 
1452  if (cacheFullScriptStore && !pvChecks) {
1453  // We executed all of the provided scripts, and were told to
1454  // cache the result. Do so now.
1455  scriptExecutionCache.insert(hashCacheEntry);
1456  }
1457  }
1458  }
1459 
1460  return true;
1461 }

1463 namespace {
1464 
1465 bool UndoWriteToDisk(const CBlockUndo& blockundo, CDiskBlockPos& pos, const uint256& hashBlock, const CMessageHeader::MessageStartChars& messageStart)
1466 {
1467  // Open history file to append
1468  CAutoFile fileout(OpenUndoFile(pos), SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
1469  if (fileout.IsNull())
1470  return error("%s: OpenUndoFile failed", __func__);
1471 
1472  // Write index header
1473  unsigned int nSize = GetSerializeSize(fileout, blockundo);
1474  fileout << messageStart << nSize;
1475 
1476  // Write undo data
1477  long fileOutPos = ftell(fileout.Get());
1478  if (fileOutPos < 0)
1479  return error("%s: ftell failed", __func__);
1480  pos.nPos = (unsigned int)fileOutPos;
1481  fileout << blockundo;
1482 
1483  // calculate & write checksum
1484  CHashWriter hasher(SER_GETHASH, PROTOCOL_VERSION);
1485  hasher << hashBlock;
1486  hasher << blockundo;
1487  fileout << hasher.GetHash();
1488 
1489  return true;
1490 }
1491 
1492 static bool UndoReadFromDisk(CBlockUndo& blockundo, const CBlockIndex *pindex)
1493 {
1494  CDiskBlockPos pos = pindex->GetUndoPos();
1495  if (pos.IsNull()) {
1496  return error("%s: no undo data available", __func__);
1497  }
1498 
1499  // Open history file to read
1500  CAutoFile filein(OpenUndoFile(pos, true), SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
1501  if (filein.IsNull())
1502  return error("%s: OpenUndoFile failed", __func__);
1503 
1504  // Read block
1505  uint256 hashChecksum;
1506  CHashVerifier<CAutoFile> verifier(&filein); // We need a CHashVerifier as reserializing may lose data
1507  try {
1508  verifier << pindex->pprev->GetBlockHash();
1509  verifier >> blockundo;
1510  filein >> hashChecksum;
1511  }
1512  catch (const std::exception& e) {
1513  return error("%s: Deserialize or I/O error - %s", __func__, e.what());
1514  }
1515 
1516  // Verify checksum
1517  if (hashChecksum != verifier.GetHash())
1518  return error("%s: Checksum mismatch", __func__);
1519 
1520  return true;
1521 }

1524 static bool AbortNode(const std::string& strMessage, const std::string& userMessage="")
1525 {
1526  SetMiscWarning(strMessage);
1527  LogPrintf("*** %s\n", strMessage);
1528  uiInterface.ThreadSafeMessageBox(
1529  userMessage.empty() ? _("Error: A fatal internal error occurred, see debug.log for details") : userMessage,
1530  "", CClientUIInterface::MSG_ERROR);
1531  StartShutdown();
1532  return false;
1533 }

1542 
1550 int ApplyTxInUndo(Coin&& undo, CCoinsViewCache& view, const COutPoint& out)
1551 {
1552  bool fClean = true;
1553 
1554  if (view.HaveCoin(out)) fClean = false; // overwriting transaction output
1555 
1556  if (undo.nHeight == 0) {
1557  // Missing undo metadata (height and coinbase). Older versions included this
1558  // information only in undo records for the last spend of a transactions'
1559  // outputs. This implies that it must be present for some other output of the same tx.
1560  const Coin& alternate = AccessByTxid(view, out.hash);
1561  if (!alternate.IsSpent()) {
1562  undo.nHeight = alternate.nHeight;
1563  undo.fCoinBase = alternate.fCoinBase;
1564  } else {
1565  return DISCONNECT_FAILED; // adding output for transaction without known metadata
1566  }
1567  }
1568  // The potential_overwrite parameter to AddCoin is only allowed to be false if we know for
1569  // sure that the coin did not already exist in the cache. As we have queried for that above
1570  // using HaveCoin, we don't need to guess. When fClean is false, a coin already existed and
1571  // it is an overwrite.
1572  view.AddCoin(out, std::move(undo), !fClean);
1573 
1574  return fClean ? DISCONNECT_OK : DISCONNECT_UNCLEAN;
1575 }
1576 
1579 DisconnectResult CChainState::DisconnectBlock(const CBlock& block, const CBlockIndex* pindex, CCoinsViewCache& view)
1580 {
1581  bool fClean = true;
1582 
1583  CBlockUndo blockUndo;
1584  if (!UndoReadFromDisk(blockUndo, pindex)) {
1585  error("DisconnectBlock(): failure reading undo data");
1586  return DISCONNECT_FAILED;
1587  }
1588 
1589  if (blockUndo.vtxundo.size() + 1 != block.vtx.size()) {
1590  error("DisconnectBlock(): block and undo data inconsistent");
1591  return DISCONNECT_FAILED;
1592  }
1593 
1594  // undo transactions in reverse order
1595  for (int i = block.vtx.size() - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
1596  const CTransaction &tx = *(block.vtx[i]);
1597  uint256 hash = tx.GetHash();
1598  bool is_coinbase = tx.IsCoinBase();
1599 
1600  // Check that all outputs are available and match the outputs in the block itself
1601  // exactly.
1602  for (size_t o = 0; o < tx.vout.size(); o++) {
1603  if (!tx.vout[o].scriptPubKey.IsUnspendable()) {
1604  COutPoint out(hash, o);
1605  Coin coin;
1606  bool is_spent = view.SpendCoin(out, &coin);
1607  if (!is_spent || tx.vout[o] != coin.out || pindex->nHeight != coin.nHeight || is_coinbase != coin.fCoinBase) {
1608  fClean = false; // transaction output mismatch
1609  }
1610  }
1611  }
1612 
1613  // restore inputs
1614  if (i > 0) { // not coinbases
1615  CTxUndo &txundo = blockUndo.vtxundo[i-1];
1616  if (txundo.vprevout.size() != tx.vin.size()) {
1617  error("DisconnectBlock(): transaction and undo data inconsistent");
1618  return DISCONNECT_FAILED;
1619  }
1620  for (unsigned int j = tx.vin.size(); j-- > 0;) {
1621  const COutPoint &out = tx.vin[j].prevout;
1622  int res = ApplyTxInUndo(std::move(txundo.vprevout[j]), view, out);
1623  if (res == DISCONNECT_FAILED) return DISCONNECT_FAILED;
1624  fClean = fClean && res != DISCONNECT_UNCLEAN;
1625  }
1626  // At this point, all of txundo.vprevout should have been moved out.
1627  }
1628  }
1629 
1630  // move best block pointer to prevout block
1631  view.SetBestBlock(pindex->pprev->GetBlockHash());
1632 
1633  return fClean ? DISCONNECT_OK : DISCONNECT_UNCLEAN;
1634 }
1635 
1636 void static FlushBlockFile(bool fFinalize = false)
1637 {
1638  LOCK(cs_LastBlockFile);
1639 
1640  CDiskBlockPos posOld(nLastBlockFile, 0);
1641  bool status = true;
1642 
1643  FILE *fileOld = OpenBlockFile(posOld);
1644  if (fileOld) {
1645  if (fFinalize)
1646  status &= TruncateFile(fileOld, vinfoBlockFile[nLastBlockFile].nSize);
1647  status &= FileCommit(fileOld);
1648  fclose(fileOld);
1649  }
1650 
1651  fileOld = OpenUndoFile(posOld);
1652  if (fileOld) {
1653  if (fFinalize)
1654  status &= TruncateFile(fileOld, vinfoBlockFile[nLastBlockFile].nUndoSize);
1655  status &= FileCommit(fileOld);
1656  fclose(fileOld);
1657  }
1658 
1659  if (!status) {
1660  AbortNode("Flushing block file to disk failed. This is likely the result of an I/O error.");
1661  }
1662 }

1664 static bool FindUndoPos(CValidationState &state, int nFile, CDiskBlockPos &pos, unsigned int nAddSize);
1665 
1666 static bool WriteUndoDataForBlock(const CBlockUndo& blockundo, CValidationState& state, CBlockIndex* pindex, const CChainParams& chainparams)
1667 {
1668  // Write undo information to disk
1669  if (pindex->GetUndoPos().IsNull()) {
1670  CDiskBlockPos _pos;
1671  if (!FindUndoPos(state, pindex->nFile, _pos, ::GetSerializeSize(blockundo, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION) + 40))
1672  return error("ConnectBlock(): FindUndoPos failed");
1673  if (!UndoWriteToDisk(blockundo, _pos, pindex->pprev->GetBlockHash(), chainparams.MessageStart()))
1674  return AbortNode(state, "Failed to write undo data");
1675 
1676  // update nUndoPos in block index
1677  pindex->nUndoPos = _pos.nPos;
1678  pindex->nStatus |= BLOCK_HAVE_UNDO;
1679  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindex);
1680  }
1681 
1682  return true;
1683 }
