1694 
1695 int32_t ComputeBlockVersion(const CBlockIndex* pindexPrev, const Consensus::Params& params)
1696 {
1697  LOCK(cs_main);
1698  int32_t nVersion = VERSIONBITS_TOP_BITS;
1699 
1700  for (int i = 0; i < (int)Consensus::MAX_VERSION_BITS_DEPLOYMENTS; i++) {
1701  ThresholdState state = VersionBitsState(pindexPrev, params, static_cast<Consensus::DeploymentPos>(i), versionbitscache);
1702  if (state == ThresholdState::LOCKED_IN || state == ThresholdState::STARTED) {
1703  nVersion |= VersionBitsMask(params, static_cast<Consensus::DeploymentPos>(i));
1704  }
1705  }
1706 
1707  return nVersion;
1708 }
1709 
1713 class WarningBitsConditionChecker : public AbstractThresholdConditionChecker
1714 {
1715 private:
1716  int bit;
1717 
1718 public:
1719  explicit WarningBitsConditionChecker(int bitIn) : bit(bitIn) {}
1720 
1721  int64_t BeginTime(const Consensus::Params& params) const override { return 0; }
1722  int64_t EndTime(const Consensus::Params& params) const override { return std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max(); }
1723  int Period(const Consensus::Params& params) const override { return params.nMinerConfirmationWindow; }
1724  int Threshold(const Consensus::Params& params) const override { return params.nRuleChangeActivationThreshold; }
1725 
1726  bool Condition(const CBlockIndex* pindex, const Consensus::Params& params) const override
1727  {
1728  return ((pindex->nVersion & VERSIONBITS_TOP_MASK) == VERSIONBITS_TOP_BITS) &&
1729  ((pindex->nVersion >> bit) & 1) != 0 &&
1730  ((ComputeBlockVersion(pindex->pprev, params) >> bit) & 1) == 0;
1731  }
1732 };
1733 
1734 // Protected by cs_main
1735 static ThresholdConditionCache warningcache[VERSIONBITS_NUM_BITS];
1736 
1737 // 0.13.0 was shipped with a segwit deployment defined for testnet, but not for
1738 // mainnet. We no longer need to support disabling the segwit deployment
1739 // except for testing purposes, due to limitations of the functional test
1740 // environment. See test/functional/p2p-segwit.py.
1741 static bool IsScriptWitnessEnabled(const Consensus::Params& params)
1742 {
1743  return params.vDeployments[Consensus::DEPLOYMENT_SEGWIT].nTimeout != 0;
1744 }
1745 
1746 static unsigned int GetBlockScriptFlags(const CBlockIndex* pindex, const Consensus::Params& consensusparams) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main) {
1747  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
1748 
1749  unsigned int flags = SCRIPT_VERIFY_NONE;
1750 
1751  // BIP16 didn't become active until Apr 1 2012 (on mainnet, and
1752  // retroactively applied to testnet)
1753  // However, only one historical block violated the P2SH rules (on both
1754  // mainnet and testnet), so for simplicity, always leave P2SH
1755  // on except for the one violating block.
1756  if (consensusparams.BIP16Exception.IsNull() || // no bip16 exception on this chain
1757  pindex->phashBlock == nullptr || // this is a new candidate block, eg from TestBlockValidity()
1758  *pindex->phashBlock != consensusparams.BIP16Exception) // this block isn't the historical exception
1759  {
1760  flags |= SCRIPT_VERIFY_P2SH;
1761  }
1762 
1763  // Enforce WITNESS rules whenever P2SH is in effect (and the segwit
1764  // deployment is defined).
1765  if (flags & SCRIPT_VERIFY_P2SH && IsScriptWitnessEnabled(consensusparams)) {
1766  flags |= SCRIPT_VERIFY_WITNESS;
1767  }
1768 
1769  // Start enforcing the DERSIG (BIP66) rule
1770  if (pindex->nHeight >= consensusparams.BIP66Height) {
1771  flags |= SCRIPT_VERIFY_DERSIG;
1772  }
1773 
1774  // Start enforcing CHECKLOCKTIMEVERIFY (BIP65) rule
1775  if (pindex->nHeight >= consensusparams.BIP65Height) {
1776  flags |= SCRIPT_VERIFY_CHECKLOCKTIMEVERIFY;
1777  }
1778 
1779  // Start enforcing BIP68 (sequence locks) and BIP112 (CHECKSEQUENCEVERIFY) using versionbits logic.
1780  if (VersionBitsState(pindex->pprev, consensusparams, Consensus::DEPLOYMENT_CSV, versionbitscache) == ThresholdState::ACTIVE) {
1781  flags |= SCRIPT_VERIFY_CHECKSEQUENCEVERIFY;
1782  }
1783 
1784  if (IsNullDummyEnabled(pindex->pprev, consensusparams)) {
1785  flags |= SCRIPT_VERIFY_NULLDUMMY;
1786  }
1787 
1788  return flags;
1789 }
1790 
1791 
1792 
1793 static int64_t nTimeCheck = 0;
1794 static int64_t nTimeForks = 0;
1795 static int64_t nTimeVerify = 0;
1796 static int64_t nTimeConnect = 0;
1797 static int64_t nTimeIndex = 0;
1798 static int64_t nTimeCallbacks = 0;
1799 static int64_t nTimeTotal = 0;
1800 static int64_t nBlocksTotal = 0;
1801 
1805 bool CChainState::ConnectBlock(const CBlock& block, CValidationState& state, CBlockIndex* pindex,
1806  CCoinsViewCache& view, const CChainParams& chainparams, bool fJustCheck)
1807 {
1808  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
1809  assert(pindex);
1810  assert(*pindex->phashBlock == block.GetHash());
1811  int64_t nTimeStart = GetTimeMicros();
1812 
1813  // Check it again in case a previous version let a bad block in
1814  // NOTE: We don't currently (re-)invoke ContextualCheckBlock() or
1815  // ContextualCheckBlockHeader() here. This means that if we add a new
1816  // consensus rule that is enforced in one of those two functions, then we
1817  // may have let in a block that violates the rule prior to updating the
1818  // software, and we would NOT be enforcing the rule here. Fully solving
1819  // upgrade from one software version to the next after a consensus rule
1820  // change is potentially tricky and issue-specific (see RewindBlockIndex()
1821  // for one general approach that was used for BIP 141 deployment).
1822  // Also, currently the rule against blocks more than 2 hours in the future
1823  // is enforced in ContextualCheckBlockHeader(); we wouldn't want to
1824  // re-enforce that rule here (at least until we make it impossible for
1825  // GetAdjustedTime() to go backward).
1826  if (!CheckBlock(block, state, chainparams.GetConsensus(), !fJustCheck, !fJustCheck)) {
1827  if (state.CorruptionPossible()) {
1828  // We don't write down blocks to disk if they may have been
1829  // corrupted, so this should be impossible unless we're having hardware
1830  // problems.
1831  return AbortNode(state, "Corrupt block found indicating potential hardware failure; shutting down");
1832  }
1833  return error("%s: Consensus::CheckBlock: %s", __func__, FormatStateMessage(state));
1834  }
1835 
1836  // verify that the view's current state corresponds to the previous block
1837  uint256 hashPrevBlock = pindex->pprev == nullptr ? uint256() : pindex->pprev->GetBlockHash();
1838  assert(hashPrevBlock == view.GetBestBlock());
1839 
1840  // Special case for the genesis block, skipping connection of its transactions
1841  // (its coinbase is unspendable)
1842  if (block.GetHash() == chainparams.GetConsensus().hashGenesisBlock) {
1843  if (!fJustCheck)
1844  view.SetBestBlock(pindex->GetBlockHash());
1845  return true;
1846  }
1847 
1848  nBlocksTotal++;
1849 
1850  bool fScriptChecks = true;
1851  if (!hashAssumeValid.IsNull()) {
1852  // We've been configured with the hash of a block which has been externally verified to have a valid history.
1853  // A suitable default value is included with the software and updated from time to time. Because validity
1854  // relative to a piece of software is an objective fact these defaults can be easily reviewed.
1855  // This setting doesn't force the selection of any particular chain but makes validating some faster by
1856  // effectively caching the result of part of the verification.
1857  BlockMap::const_iterator it = mapBlockIndex.find(hashAssumeValid);
1858  if (it != mapBlockIndex.end()) {
1859  if (it->second->GetAncestor(pindex->nHeight) == pindex &&
1860  pindexBestHeader->GetAncestor(pindex->nHeight) == pindex &&
1861  pindexBestHeader->nChainWork >= nMinimumChainWork) {
1862  // This block is a member of the assumed verified chain and an ancestor of the best header.
1863  // The equivalent time check discourages hash power from extorting the network via DOS attack
1864  // into accepting an invalid block through telling users they must manually set assumevalid.
1865  // Requiring a software change or burying the invalid block, regardless of the setting, makes
1866  // it hard to hide the implication of the demand. This also avoids having release candidates
1867  // that are hardly doing any signature verification at all in testing without having to
1868  // artificially set the default assumed verified block further back.
1869  // The test against nMinimumChainWork prevents the skipping when denied access to any chain at
1870  // least as good as the expected chain.
1871  fScriptChecks = (GetBlockProofEquivalentTime(*pindexBestHeader, *pindex, *pindexBestHeader, chainparams.GetConsensus()) <= 60 * 60 * 24 * 7 * 2);
1872  }
1873  }
1874  }
1875 
1876  int64_t nTime1 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeCheck += nTime1 - nTimeStart;
1877  LogPrint(BCLog::BENCH, " - Sanity checks: %.2fms [%.2fs (%.2fms/blk)]\n", MILLI * (nTime1 - nTimeStart), nTimeCheck * MICRO, nTimeCheck * MILLI / nBlocksTotal);
1878 
1879  // Do not allow blocks that contain transactions which 'overwrite' older transactions,
1880  // unless those are already completely spent.
1881  // If such overwrites are allowed, coinbases and transactions depending upon those
1882  // can be duplicated to remove the ability to spend the first instance -- even after
1883  // being sent to another address.
1884  // See BIP30 and http://r6.ca/blog/20120206T005236Z.html for more information.
1885  // This logic is not necessary for memory pool transactions, as AcceptToMemoryPool
1886  // already refuses previously-known transaction ids entirely.
1887  // This rule was originally applied to all blocks with a timestamp after March 15, 2012, 0:00 UTC.
1888  // Now that the whole chain is irreversibly beyond that time it is applied to all blocks except the
1889  // two in the chain that violate it. This prevents exploiting the issue against nodes during their
1890  // initial block download.
1891  bool fEnforceBIP30 = !((pindex->nHeight==91842 && pindex->GetBlockHash() == uint256S("0x00000000000a4d0a398161ffc163c503763b1f4360639393e0e4c8e300e0caec")) ||
1892  (pindex->nHeight==91880 && pindex->GetBlockHash() == uint256S("0x00000000000743f190a18c5577a3c2d2a1f610ae9601ac046a38084ccb7cd721")));
1893 
1894  // Once BIP34 activated it was not possible to create new duplicate coinbases and thus other than starting
1895  // with the 2 existing duplicate coinbase pairs, not possible to create overwriting txs. But by the
1896  // time BIP34 activated, in each of the existing pairs the duplicate coinbase had overwritten the first
1897  // before the first had been spent. Since those coinbases are sufficiently buried it's no longer possible to create further
1898  // duplicate transactions descending from the known pairs either.
1899  // If we're on the known chain at height greater than where BIP34 activated, we can save the db accesses needed for the BIP30 check.
1900 
1901  // BIP34 requires that a block at height X (block X) has its coinbase
1902  // scriptSig start with a CScriptNum of X (indicated height X). The above
1903  // logic of no longer requiring BIP30 once BIP34 activates is flawed in the
1904  // case that there is a block X before the BIP34 height of 227,931 which has
1905  // an indicated height Y where Y is greater than X. The coinbase for block
1906  // X would also be a valid coinbase for block Y, which could be a BIP30
1907  // violation. An exhaustive search of all mainnet coinbases before the
1908  // BIP34 height which have an indicated height greater than the block height
1909  // reveals many occurrences. The 3 lowest indicated heights found are
1910  // 209,921, 490,897, and 1,983,702 and thus coinbases for blocks at these 3
1911  // heights would be the first opportunity for BIP30 to be violated.
1912 
1913  // The search reveals a great many blocks which have an indicated height
1914  // greater than 1,983,702, so we simply remove the optimization to skip
1915  // BIP30 checking for blocks at height 1,983,702 or higher. Before we reach
1916  // that block in another 25 years or so, we should take advantage of a
1917  // future consensus change to do a new and improved version of BIP34 that
1918  // will actually prevent ever creating any duplicate coinbases in the
1919  // future.
1920  static constexpr int BIP34_IMPLIES_BIP30_LIMIT = 1983702;
1921 
1922  // There is no potential to create a duplicate coinbase at block 209,921
1923  // because this is still before the BIP34 height and so explicit BIP30
1924  // checking is still active.
1925 
1926  // The final case is block 176,684 which has an indicated height of
1927  // 490,897. Unfortunately, this issue was not discovered until about 2 weeks
1928  // before block 490,897 so there was not much opportunity to address this
1929  // case other than to carefully analyze it and determine it would not be a
1930  // problem. Block 490,897 was, in fact, mined with a different coinbase than
1931  // block 176,684, but it is important to note that even if it hadn't been or
1932  // is remined on an alternate fork with a duplicate coinbase, we would still
1933  // not run into a BIP30 violation. This is because the coinbase for 176,684
1934  // is spent in block 185,956 in transaction
1935  // d4f7fbbf92f4a3014a230b2dc70b8058d02eb36ac06b4a0736d9d60eaa9e8781. This
1936  // spending transaction can't be duplicated because it also spends coinbase
1937  // 0328dd85c331237f18e781d692c92de57649529bd5edf1d01036daea32ffde29. This
1938  // coinbase has an indicated height of over 4.2 billion, and wouldn't be
1939  // duplicatable until that height, and it's currently impossible to create a
1940  // chain that long. Nevertheless we may wish to consider a future soft fork
1941  // which retroactively prevents block 490,897 from creating a duplicate
1942  // coinbase. The two historical BIP30 violations often provide a confusing
1943  // edge case when manipulating the UTXO and it would be simpler not to have
1944  // another edge case to deal with.
1945 
1946  // testnet3 has no blocks before the BIP34 height with indicated heights
1947  // post BIP34 before approximately height 486,000,000 and presumably will
1948  // be reset before it reaches block 1,983,702 and starts doing unnecessary
1949  // BIP30 checking again.
1950  assert(pindex->pprev);
1951  CBlockIndex *pindexBIP34height = pindex->pprev->GetAncestor(chainparams.GetConsensus().BIP34Height);
1952  //Only continue to enforce if we're below BIP34 activation height or the block hash at that height doesn't correspond.
1953  fEnforceBIP30 = fEnforceBIP30 && (!pindexBIP34height || !(pindexBIP34height->GetBlockHash() == chainparams.GetConsensus().BIP34Hash));
1954 
1955  // TODO: Remove BIP30 checking from block height 1,983,702 on, once we have a
1956  // consensus change that ensures coinbases at those heights can not
1957  // duplicate earlier coinbases.
1958  if (fEnforceBIP30 || pindex->nHeight >= BIP34_IMPLIES_BIP30_LIMIT) {
1959  for (const auto& tx : block.vtx) {
1960  for (size_t o = 0; o < tx->vout.size(); o++) {
1961  if (view.HaveCoin(COutPoint(tx->GetHash(), o))) {
1962  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock(): tried to overwrite transaction"),
1963  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-BIP30");
1964  }
1965  }
1966  }
1967  }
1968 
1969  // Start enforcing BIP68 (sequence locks) and BIP112 (CHECKSEQUENCEVERIFY) using versionbits logic.
1970  int nLockTimeFlags = 0;
1971  if (VersionBitsState(pindex->pprev, chainparams.GetConsensus(), Consensus::DEPLOYMENT_CSV, versionbitscache) == ThresholdState::ACTIVE) {
1972  nLockTimeFlags |= LOCKTIME_VERIFY_SEQUENCE;
1973  }
1974 
1975  // Get the script flags for this block
1976  unsigned int flags = GetBlockScriptFlags(pindex, chainparams.GetConsensus());
1977 
1978  int64_t nTime2 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeForks += nTime2 - nTime1;
1979  LogPrint(BCLog::BENCH, " - Fork checks: %.2fms [%.2fs (%.2fms/blk)]\n", MILLI * (nTime2 - nTime1), nTimeForks * MICRO, nTimeForks * MILLI / nBlocksTotal);
1980 
1981  CBlockUndo blockundo;
1982 
1983  CCheckQueueControl<CScriptCheck> control(fScriptChecks && nScriptCheckThreads ? &scriptcheckqueue : nullptr);
1984 
1985  std::vector<int> prevheights;
1986  CAmount nFees = 0;
1987  int nInputs = 0;
1988  int64_t nSigOpsCost = 0;
1989  blockundo.vtxundo.reserve(block.vtx.size() - 1);
1990  std::vector<PrecomputedTransactionData> txdata;
1991  txdata.reserve(block.vtx.size()); // Required so that pointers to individual PrecomputedTransactionData don't get invalidated
1992  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < block.vtx.size(); i++)
1993  {
1994  const CTransaction &tx = *(block.vtx[i]);
1995 
1996  nInputs += tx.vin.size();
1997 
1998  if (!tx.IsCoinBase())
1999  {
2000  CAmount txfee = 0;
2001  if (!Consensus::CheckTxInputs(tx, state, view, pindex->nHeight, txfee)) {
2002  return error("%s: Consensus::CheckTxInputs: %s, %s", __func__, tx.GetHash().ToString(), FormatStateMessage(state));
2003  }
2004  nFees += txfee;
2005  if (!MoneyRange(nFees)) {
2006  return state.DoS(100, error("%s: accumulated fee in the block out of range.", __func__),
2007  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-accumulated-fee-outofrange");
2008  }
2009 
2010  // Check that transaction is BIP68 final
2011  // BIP68 lock checks (as opposed to nLockTime checks) must
2012  // be in ConnectBlock because they require the UTXO set
2013  prevheights.resize(tx.vin.size());
2014  for (size_t j = 0; j < tx.vin.size(); j++) {
2015  prevheights[j] = view.AccessCoin(tx.vin[j].prevout).nHeight;
2016  }
2017 
2018  if (!SequenceLocks(tx, nLockTimeFlags, &prevheights, *pindex)) {
2019  return state.DoS(100, error("%s: contains a non-BIP68-final transaction", __func__),
2020  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-nonfinal");
2021  }
2022  }
2023 
2024  // GetTransactionSigOpCost counts 3 types of sigops:
2025  // * legacy (always)
2026  // * p2sh (when P2SH enabled in flags and excludes coinbase)
2027  // * witness (when witness enabled in flags and excludes coinbase)
2028  nSigOpsCost += GetTransactionSigOpCost(tx, view, flags);
2029  if (nSigOpsCost > MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS_COST)
2030  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock(): too many sigops"),
2031  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-blk-sigops");
2032 
2033  txdata.emplace_back(tx);
2034  if (!tx.IsCoinBase())
2035  {
2036  std::vector<CScriptCheck> vChecks;
2037  bool fCacheResults = fJustCheck; /* Don't cache results if we're actually connecting blocks (still consult the cache, though) */
2038  if (!CheckInputs(tx, state, view, fScriptChecks, flags, fCacheResults, fCacheResults, txdata[i], nScriptCheckThreads ? &vChecks : nullptr))
2039  return error("ConnectBlock(): CheckInputs on %s failed with %s",
2040  tx.GetHash().ToString(), FormatStateMessage(state));
2041  control.Add(vChecks);
2042  }
2043 
2044  CTxUndo undoDummy;
2045  if (i > 0) {
2046  blockundo.vtxundo.push_back(CTxUndo());
2047  }
2048  UpdateCoins(tx, view, i == 0 ? undoDummy : blockundo.vtxundo.back(), pindex->nHeight);
2049  }
2050  int64_t nTime3 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeConnect += nTime3 - nTime2;
2051  LogPrint(BCLog::BENCH, " - Connect %u transactions: %.2fms (%.3fms/tx, %.3fms/txin) [%.2fs (%.2fms/blk)]\n", (unsigned)block.vtx.size(), MILLI * (nTime3 - nTime2), MILLI * (nTime3 - nTime2) / block.vtx.size(), nInputs <= 1 ? 0 : MILLI * (nTime3 - nTime2) / (nInputs-1), nTimeConnect * MICRO, nTimeConnect * MILLI / nBlocksTotal);
2052 
2053  CAmount blockReward = nFees + GetBlockSubsidy(pindex->nHeight, chainparams.GetConsensus());
2054  if (block.vtx[0]->GetValueOut() > blockReward)
2055  return state.DoS(100,
2056  error("ConnectBlock(): coinbase pays too much (actual=%d vs limit=%d)",
2057  block.vtx[0]->GetValueOut(), blockReward),
2058  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-cb-amount");
2059 
2060  if (!control.Wait())
2061  return state.DoS(100, error("%s: CheckQueue failed", __func__), REJECT_INVALID, "block-validation-failed");
2062  int64_t nTime4 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeVerify += nTime4 - nTime2;
2063  LogPrint(BCLog::BENCH, " - Verify %u txins: %.2fms (%.3fms/txin) [%.2fs (%.2fms/blk)]\n", nInputs - 1, MILLI * (nTime4 - nTime2), nInputs <= 1 ? 0 : MILLI * (nTime4 - nTime2) / (nInputs-1), nTimeVerify * MICRO, nTimeVerify * MILLI / nBlocksTotal);
2064 
2065  if (fJustCheck)
2066  return true;
2067 
2068  if (!WriteUndoDataForBlock(blockundo, state, pindex, chainparams))
2069  return false;
2070 
2071  if (!pindex->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_SCRIPTS)) {
2072  pindex->RaiseValidity(BLOCK_VALID_SCRIPTS);
2073  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindex);
2074  }
2075 
2076  assert(pindex->phashBlock);
2077  // add this block to the view's block chain
2078  view.SetBestBlock(pindex->GetBlockHash());
2079 
2080  int64_t nTime5 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeIndex += nTime5 - nTime4;
2081  LogPrint(BCLog::BENCH, " - Index writing: %.2fms [%.2fs (%.2fms/blk)]\n", MILLI * (nTime5 - nTime4), nTimeIndex * MICRO, nTimeIndex * MILLI / nBlocksTotal);
2082 
2083  int64_t nTime6 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeCallbacks += nTime6 - nTime5;
2084  LogPrint(BCLog::BENCH, " - Callbacks: %.2fms [%.2fs (%.2fms/blk)]\n", MILLI * (nTime6 - nTime5), nTimeCallbacks * MICRO, nTimeCallbacks * MILLI / nBlocksTotal);
2085 
2086  return true;
2087 }
2088 
2098 bool static FlushStateToDisk(const CChainParams& chainparams, CValidationState &state, FlushStateMode mode, int nManualPruneHeight) {
2099  int64_t nMempoolUsage = mempool.DynamicMemoryUsage();
2100  LOCK(cs_main);
2101  static int64_t nLastWrite = 0;
2102  static int64_t nLastFlush = 0;
2103  std::set<int> setFilesToPrune;
2104  bool full_flush_completed = false;
2105  try {
2106  {
2107  bool fFlushForPrune = false;
2108  bool fDoFullFlush = false;
2109  LOCK(cs_LastBlockFile);
2110  if (fPruneMode && (fCheckForPruning || nManualPruneHeight > 0) && !fReindex) {
2111  if (nManualPruneHeight > 0) {
2112  FindFilesToPruneManual(setFilesToPrune, nManualPruneHeight);
2113  } else {
2114  FindFilesToPrune(setFilesToPrune, chainparams.PruneAfterHeight());
2115  fCheckForPruning = false;
2116  }
2117  if (!setFilesToPrune.empty()) {
2118  fFlushForPrune = true;
2119  if (!fHavePruned) {
2120  pblocktree->WriteFlag("prunedblockfiles", true);
2121  fHavePruned = true;
2122  }
2123  }
2124  }
2125  int64_t nNow = GetTimeMicros();
2126  // Avoid writing/flushing immediately after startup.
2127  if (nLastWrite == 0) {
2128  nLastWrite = nNow;
2129  }
2130  if (nLastFlush == 0) {
2131  nLastFlush = nNow;
2132  }
2133  int64_t nMempoolSizeMax = gArgs.GetArg("-maxmempool", DEFAULT_MAX_MEMPOOL_SIZE) * 1000000;
2134  int64_t cacheSize = pcoinsTip->DynamicMemoryUsage();
2135  int64_t nTotalSpace = nCoinCacheUsage + std::max<int64_t>(nMempoolSizeMax - nMempoolUsage, 0);
2136  // The cache is large and we're within 10% and 10 MiB of the limit, but we have time now (not in the middle of a block processing).
2137  bool fCacheLarge = mode == FlushStateMode::PERIODIC && cacheSize > std::max((9 * nTotalSpace) / 10, nTotalSpace - MAX_BLOCK_COINSDB_USAGE * 1024 * 1024);
2138  // The cache is over the limit, we have to write now.
2139  bool fCacheCritical = mode == FlushStateMode::IF_NEEDED && cacheSize > nTotalSpace;
2140  // It's been a while since we wrote the block index to disk. Do this frequently, so we don't need to redownload after a crash.
2141  bool fPeriodicWrite = mode == FlushStateMode::PERIODIC && nNow > nLastWrite + (int64_t)DATABASE_WRITE_INTERVAL * 1000000;
2142  // It's been very long since we flushed the cache. Do this infrequently, to optimize cache usage.
2143  bool fPeriodicFlush = mode == FlushStateMode::PERIODIC && nNow > nLastFlush + (int64_t)DATABASE_FLUSH_INTERVAL * 1000000;
2144  // Combine all conditions that result in a full cache flush.
2145  fDoFullFlush = (mode == FlushStateMode::ALWAYS) || fCacheLarge || fCacheCritical || fPeriodicFlush || fFlushForPrune;
2146  // Write blocks and block index to disk.
2147  if (fDoFullFlush || fPeriodicWrite) {
2148  // Depend on nMinDiskSpace to ensure we can write block index
2149  if (!CheckDiskSpace(0, true))
2150  return state.Error("out of disk space");
2151  // First make sure all block and undo data is flushed to disk.
2152  FlushBlockFile();
2153  // Then update all block file information (which may refer to block and undo files).
2154  {
2155  std::vector<std::pair<int, const CBlockFileInfo*> > vFiles;
2156  vFiles.reserve(setDirtyFileInfo.size());
2157  for (std::set<int>::iterator it = setDirtyFileInfo.begin(); it != setDirtyFileInfo.end(); ) {
2158  vFiles.push_back(std::make_pair(*it, &vinfoBlockFile[*it]));
2159  setDirtyFileInfo.erase(it++);
2160  }
2161  std::vector<const CBlockIndex*> vBlocks;
2162  vBlocks.reserve(setDirtyBlockIndex.size());
2163  for (std::set<CBlockIndex*>::iterator it = setDirtyBlockIndex.begin(); it != setDirtyBlockIndex.end(); ) {
2164  vBlocks.push_back(*it);
2165  setDirtyBlockIndex.erase(it++);
2166  }
2167  if (!pblocktree->WriteBatchSync(vFiles, nLastBlockFile, vBlocks)) {
2168  return AbortNode(state, "Failed to write to block index database");
2169  }
2170  }
2171  // Finally remove any pruned files
2172  if (fFlushForPrune)
2173  UnlinkPrunedFiles(setFilesToPrune);
2174  nLastWrite = nNow;
2175  }
2176  // Flush best chain related state. This can only be done if the blocks / block index write was also done.
2177  if (fDoFullFlush && !pcoinsTip->GetBestBlock().IsNull()) {
2178  // Typical Coin structures on disk are around 48 bytes in size.
2179  // Pushing a new one to the database can cause it to be written
2180  // twice (once in the log, and once in the tables). This is already
2181  // an overestimation, as most will delete an existing entry or
2182  // overwrite one. Still, use a conservative safety factor of 2.
2183  if (!CheckDiskSpace(48 * 2 * 2 * pcoinsTip->GetCacheSize()))
2184  return state.Error("out of disk space");
2185  // Flush the chainstate (which may refer to block index entries).
2186  if (!pcoinsTip->Flush())
2187  return AbortNode(state, "Failed to write to coin database");
2188  nLastFlush = nNow;
2189  full_flush_completed = true;
2190  }
2191  }
2192  if (full_flush_completed) {
2193  // Update best block in wallet (so we can detect restored wallets).
2194  GetMainSignals().ChainStateFlushed(chainActive.GetLocator());
2195  }
2196  } catch (const std::runtime_error& e) {
2197  return AbortNode(state, std::string("System error while flushing: ") + e.what());
2198  }
2199  return true;
2200 }
2201 
2202 void FlushStateToDisk() {
2203  CValidationState state;
2204  const CChainParams& chainparams = Params();
2205  if (!FlushStateToDisk(chainparams, state, FlushStateMode::ALWAYS)) {
2206  LogPrintf("%s: failed to flush state (%s)\n", __func__, FormatStateMessage(state));
2207  }
2208 }
2209 
2210 void PruneAndFlush() {
2211  CValidationState state;
2212  fCheckForPruning = true;
2213  const CChainParams& chainparams = Params();
2214  if (!FlushStateToDisk(chainparams, state, FlushStateMode::NONE)) {
2215  LogPrintf("%s: failed to flush state (%s)\n", __func__, FormatStateMessage(state));
2216  }
2217 }

2219 static void DoWarning(const std::string& strWarning)
2220 {
2221  static bool fWarned = false;
2222  SetMiscWarning(strWarning);
2223  if (!fWarned) {
2224  AlertNotify(strWarning);
2225  fWarned = true;
2226  }
2227 }

2231 {
2232  if (!res.empty()) res += ", ";
2233  res += warn;
2234 }

2237 void static UpdateTip(const CBlockIndex *pindexNew, const CChainParams& chainParams) {
2238  // New best block
2239  mempool.AddTransactionsUpdated(1);
2240 
2241  {
2242  WaitableLock lock(g_best_block_mutex);
2243  g_best_block = pindexNew->GetBlockHash();
2244  g_best_block_cv.notify_all();
2245  }
2246 
2247  std::string warningMessages;
2248  if (!IsInitialBlockDownload())
2249  {
2250  int nUpgraded = 0;
2251  const CBlockIndex* pindex = pindexNew;
2252  for (int bit = 0; bit < VERSIONBITS_NUM_BITS; bit++) {
2253  WarningBitsConditionChecker checker(bit);
2254  ThresholdState state = checker.GetStateFor(pindex, chainParams.GetConsensus(), warningcache[bit]);
2255  if (state == ThresholdState::ACTIVE || state == ThresholdState::LOCKED_IN) {
2256  const std::string strWarning = strprintf(_("Warning: unknown new rules activated (versionbit %i)"), bit);
2257  if (state == ThresholdState::ACTIVE) {
2258  DoWarning(strWarning);
2259  } else {
2260  AppendWarning(warningMessages, strWarning);
2261  }
2262  }
2263  }
2264  // Check the version of the last 100 blocks to see if we need to upgrade:
2265  for (int i = 0; i < 100 && pindex != nullptr; i++)
2266  {
2267  int32_t nExpectedVersion = ComputeBlockVersion(pindex->pprev, chainParams.GetConsensus());
2268  if (pindex->nVersion > VERSIONBITS_LAST_OLD_BLOCK_VERSION && (pindex->nVersion & ~nExpectedVersion) != 0)
2269  ++nUpgraded;
2270  pindex = pindex->pprev;
2271  }
2272  if (nUpgraded > 0)
2273  AppendWarning(warningMessages, strprintf(_("%d of last 100 blocks have unexpected version"), nUpgraded));
2274  if (nUpgraded > 100/2)
2275  {
2276  std::string strWarning = _("Warning: Unknown block versions being mined! It's possible unknown rules are in effect");
2277  // notify GetWarnings(), called by Qt and the JSON-RPC code to warn the user:
2278  DoWarning(strWarning);
2279  }
2280  }
2281  LogPrintf("%s: new best=%s height=%d version=0x%08x log2_work=%.8g tx=%lu date='%s' progress=%f cache=%.1fMiB(%utxo)", __func__, /* Continued */
2282  pindexNew->GetBlockHash().ToString(), pindexNew->nHeight, pindexNew->nVersion,
2283  log(pindexNew->nChainWork.getdouble())/log(2.0), (unsigned long)pindexNew->nChainTx,
2284  FormatISO8601DateTime(pindexNew->GetBlockTime()),
2285  GuessVerificationProgress(chainParams.TxData(), pindexNew), pcoinsTip->DynamicMemoryUsage() * (1.0 / (1<<20)), pcoinsTip->GetCacheSize());
2286  if (!warningMessages.empty())
2287  LogPrintf(" warning='%s'", warningMessages); /* Continued */
2288  LogPrintf("\n");
2289 
2290 }
2291 
2302 bool CChainState::DisconnectTip(CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, DisconnectedBlockTransactions *disconnectpool)
2303 {
2304  CBlockIndex *pindexDelete = chainActive.Tip();
2305  assert(pindexDelete);
2306  // Read block from disk.
2307  std::shared_ptr<CBlock> pblock = std::make_shared<CBlock>();
2308  CBlock& block = *pblock;
2309  if (!ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pindexDelete, chainparams.GetConsensus()))
2310  return AbortNode(state, "Failed to read block");
2311  // Apply the block atomically to the chain state.
2312  int64_t nStart = GetTimeMicros();
2313  {
2314  CCoinsViewCache view(pcoinsTip.get());
2315  assert(view.GetBestBlock() == pindexDelete->GetBlockHash());
2316  if (DisconnectBlock(block, pindexDelete, view) != DISCONNECT_OK)
2317  return error("DisconnectTip(): DisconnectBlock %s failed", pindexDelete->GetBlockHash().ToString());
2318  bool flushed = view.Flush();
2319  assert(flushed);
2320  }
2321  LogPrint(BCLog::BENCH, "- Disconnect block: %.2fms\n", (GetTimeMicros() - nStart) * MILLI);
2322  // Write the chain state to disk, if necessary.
2323  if (!FlushStateToDisk(chainparams, state, FlushStateMode::IF_NEEDED))
2324  return false;
2325 
2326  if (disconnectpool) {
2327  // Save transactions to re-add to mempool at end of reorg
2328  for (auto it = block.vtx.rbegin(); it != block.vtx.rend(); ++it) {
2329  disconnectpool->addTransaction(*it);
2330  }
2331  while (disconnectpool->DynamicMemoryUsage() > MAX_DISCONNECTED_TX_POOL_SIZE * 1000) {
2332  // Drop the earliest entry, and remove its children from the mempool.
2333  auto it = disconnectpool->queuedTx.get<insertion_order>().begin();
2334  mempool.removeRecursive(**it, MemPoolRemovalReason::REORG);
2335  disconnectpool->removeEntry(it);
2336  }
2337  }
2338 
2339  chainActive.SetTip(pindexDelete->pprev);
2340 
2341  UpdateTip(pindexDelete->pprev, chainparams);
2342  // Let wallets know transactions went from 1-confirmed to
2343  // 0-confirmed or conflicted:
2344  GetMainSignals().BlockDisconnected(pblock);
2345  return true;
2346 }

2348 static int64_t nTimeReadFromDisk = 0;
2349 static int64_t nTimeConnectTotal = 0;
2350 static int64_t nTimeFlush = 0;
2351 static int64_t nTimeChainState = 0;
2352 static int64_t nTimePostConnect = 0;

2354 struct PerBlockConnectTrace {
2355  CBlockIndex* pindex = nullptr;
2356  std::shared_ptr<const CBlock> pblock;
2357  std::shared_ptr<std::vector<CTransactionRef>> conflictedTxs;
2358  PerBlockConnectTrace() : conflictedTxs(std::make_shared<std::vector<CTransactionRef>>()) {}
2359 };
2376 class ConnectTrace {
2377 private:
2378  std::vector<PerBlockConnectTrace> blocksConnected;
2379  CTxMemPool &pool;
2380 
2381 public:
2382  explicit ConnectTrace(CTxMemPool &_pool) : blocksConnected(1), pool(_pool) {
2383  pool.NotifyEntryRemoved.connect(boost::bind(&ConnectTrace::NotifyEntryRemoved, this, _1, _2));
2384  }
2385 
2386  ~ConnectTrace() {
2387  pool.NotifyEntryRemoved.disconnect(boost::bind(&ConnectTrace::NotifyEntryRemoved, this, _1, _2));
2388  }
2389 
2390  void BlockConnected(CBlockIndex* pindex, std::shared_ptr<const CBlock> pblock) {
2391  assert(!blocksConnected.back().pindex);
2392  assert(pindex);
2393  assert(pblock);
2394  blocksConnected.back().pindex = pindex;
2395  blocksConnected.back().pblock = std::move(pblock);
2396  blocksConnected.emplace_back();
2397  }
2398 
2399  std::vector<PerBlockConnectTrace>& GetBlocksConnected() {
2400  // We always keep one extra block at the end of our list because
2401  // blocks are added after all the conflicted transactions have
2402  // been filled in. Thus, the last entry should always be an empty
2403  // one waiting for the transactions from the next block. We pop
2404  // the last entry here to make sure the list we return is sane.
2405  assert(!blocksConnected.back().pindex);
2406  assert(blocksConnected.back().conflictedTxs->empty());
2407  blocksConnected.pop_back();
2408  return blocksConnected;
2409  }
2410 
2411  void NotifyEntryRemoved(CTransactionRef txRemoved, MemPoolRemovalReason reason) {
2412  assert(!blocksConnected.back().pindex);
2413  if (reason == MemPoolRemovalReason::CONFLICT) {
2414  blocksConnected.back().conflictedTxs->emplace_back(std::move(txRemoved));
2415  }
2416  }
2417 };

2425 bool CChainState::ConnectTip(CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, CBlockIndex* pindexNew, const std::shared_ptr<const CBlock>& pblock, ConnectTrace& connectTrace, DisconnectedBlockTransactions &disconnectpool)
2426 {
2427  assert(pindexNew->pprev == chainActive.Tip());
2428  // Read block from disk.
2429  int64_t nTime1 = GetTimeMicros();
2430  std::shared_ptr<const CBlock> pthisBlock;
2431  if (!pblock) {
2432  std::shared_ptr<CBlock> pblockNew = std::make_shared<CBlock>();
2433  if (!ReadBlockFromDisk(*pblockNew, pindexNew, chainparams.GetConsensus()))
2434  return AbortNode(state, "Failed to read block");
2435  pthisBlock = pblockNew;
2436  } else {
2437  pthisBlock = pblock;
2438  }
2439  const CBlock& blockConnecting = *pthisBlock;
2440  // Apply the block atomically to the chain state.
2441  int64_t nTime2 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeReadFromDisk += nTime2 - nTime1;
2442  int64_t nTime3;
2443  LogPrint(BCLog::BENCH, " - Load block from disk: %.2fms [%.2fs]\n", (nTime2 - nTime1) * MILLI, nTimeReadFromDisk * MICRO);
2444  {
2445  CCoinsViewCache view(pcoinsTip.get());
2446  bool rv = ConnectBlock(blockConnecting, state, pindexNew, view, chainparams);
2447  GetMainSignals().BlockChecked(blockConnecting, state);
2448  if (!rv) {
2449  if (state.IsInvalid())
2450  InvalidBlockFound(pindexNew, state);
2451  return error("ConnectTip(): ConnectBlock %s failed", pindexNew->GetBlockHash().ToString());
2452  }
2453  nTime3 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeConnectTotal += nTime3 - nTime2;
2454  LogPrint(BCLog::BENCH, " - Connect total: %.2fms [%.2fs (%.2fms/blk)]\n", (nTime3 - nTime2) * MILLI, nTimeConnectTotal * MICRO, nTimeConnectTotal * MILLI / nBlocksTotal);
2455  bool flushed = view.Flush();
2456  assert(flushed);
2457  }
2458  int64_t nTime4 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeFlush += nTime4 - nTime3;
2459  LogPrint(BCLog::BENCH, " - Flush: %.2fms [%.2fs (%.2fms/blk)]\n", (nTime4 - nTime3) * MILLI, nTimeFlush * MICRO, nTimeFlush * MILLI / nBlocksTotal);
2460  // Write the chain state to disk, if necessary.
2461  if (!FlushStateToDisk(chainparams, state, FlushStateMode::IF_NEEDED))
2462  return false;
2463  int64_t nTime5 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimeChainState += nTime5 - nTime4;
2464  LogPrint(BCLog::BENCH, " - Writing chainstate: %.2fms [%.2fs (%.2fms/blk)]\n", (nTime5 - nTime4) * MILLI, nTimeChainState * MICRO, nTimeChainState * MILLI / nBlocksTotal);
2465  // Remove conflicting transactions from the mempool.;
2466  mempool.removeForBlock(blockConnecting.vtx, pindexNew->nHeight);
2467  disconnectpool.removeForBlock(blockConnecting.vtx);
2468  // Update chainActive & related variables.
2469  chainActive.SetTip(pindexNew);
2470  UpdateTip(pindexNew, chainparams);
2471 
2472  int64_t nTime6 = GetTimeMicros(); nTimePostConnect += nTime6 - nTime5; nTimeTotal += nTime6 - nTime1;
2473  LogPrint(BCLog::BENCH, " - Connect postprocess: %.2fms [%.2fs (%.2fms/blk)]\n", (nTime6 - nTime5) * MILLI, nTimePostConnect * MICRO, nTimePostConnect * MILLI / nBlocksTotal);
2474  LogPrint(BCLog::BENCH, "- Connect block: %.2fms [%.2fs (%.2fms/blk)]\n", (nTime6 - nTime1) * MILLI, nTimeTotal * MICRO, nTimeTotal * MILLI / nBlocksTotal);
2475 
2476  connectTrace.BlockConnected(pindexNew, std::move(pthisBlock));
2477  return true;
2478 }
2479 
2484 CBlockIndex* CChainState::FindMostWorkChain() {
2485  do {
2486  CBlockIndex *pindexNew = nullptr;
2487 
2488  // Find the best candidate header.
2489  {
2490  std::set<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndexWorkComparator>::reverse_iterator it = setBlockIndexCandidates.rbegin();
2491  if (it == setBlockIndexCandidates.rend())
2492  return nullptr;
2493  pindexNew = *it;
2494  }
2495 
2496  // Check whether all blocks on the path between the currently active chain and the candidate are valid.
2497  // Just going until the active chain is an optimization, as we know all blocks in it are valid already.
2498  CBlockIndex *pindexTest = pindexNew;
2499  bool fInvalidAncestor = false;
2500  while (pindexTest && !chainActive.Contains(pindexTest)) {
2501  assert(pindexTest->nChainTx || pindexTest->nHeight == 0);
2502 
2503  // Pruned nodes may have entries in setBlockIndexCandidates for
2504  // which block files have been deleted. Remove those as candidates
2505  // for the most work chain if we come across them; we can't switch
2506  // to a chain unless we have all the non-active-chain parent blocks.
2507  bool fFailedChain = pindexTest->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_MASK;
2508  bool fMissingData = !(pindexTest->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA);
2509  if (fFailedChain || fMissingData) {
2510  // Candidate chain is not usable (either invalid or missing data)
2511  if (fFailedChain && (pindexBestInvalid == nullptr || pindexNew->nChainWork > pindexBestInvalid->nChainWork))
2512  pindexBestInvalid = pindexNew;
2513  CBlockIndex *pindexFailed = pindexNew;
2514  // Remove the entire chain from the set.
2515  while (pindexTest != pindexFailed) {
2516  if (fFailedChain) {
2517  pindexFailed->nStatus |= BLOCK_FAILED_CHILD;
2518  } else if (fMissingData) {
2519  // If we're missing data, then add back to mapBlocksUnlinked,
2520  // so that if the block arrives in the future we can try adding
2521  // to setBlockIndexCandidates again.
2522  mapBlocksUnlinked.insert(std::make_pair(pindexFailed->pprev, pindexFailed));
2523  }
2524  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(pindexFailed);
2525  pindexFailed = pindexFailed->pprev;
2526  }
2527  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(pindexTest);
2528  fInvalidAncestor = true;
2529  break;
2530  }
2531  pindexTest = pindexTest->pprev;
2532  }
2533  if (!fInvalidAncestor)
2534  return pindexNew;
2535  } while(true);
2536 }
2537 
2539 void CChainState::PruneBlockIndexCandidates() {
2540  // Note that we can't delete the current block itself, as we may need to return to it later in case a
2541  // reorganization to a better block fails.
2542  std::set<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndexWorkComparator>::iterator it = setBlockIndexCandidates.begin();
2543  while (it != setBlockIndexCandidates.end() && setBlockIndexCandidates.value_comp()(*it, chainActive.Tip())) {
2544  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(it++);
2545  }
2546  // Either the current tip or a successor of it we're working towards is left in setBlockIndexCandidates.
2547  assert(!setBlockIndexCandidates.empty());
2548 }
2549 
2554 bool CChainState::ActivateBestChainStep(CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, CBlockIndex* pindexMostWork, const std::shared_ptr<const CBlock>& pblock, bool& fInvalidFound, ConnectTrace& connectTrace)
2555 {
2556  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
2557 
2558  const CBlockIndex *pindexOldTip = chainActive.Tip();
2559  const CBlockIndex *pindexFork = chainActive.FindFork(pindexMostWork);
2560 
2561  // Disconnect active blocks which are no longer in the best chain.
2562  bool fBlocksDisconnected = false;
2563  DisconnectedBlockTransactions disconnectpool;
2564  while (chainActive.Tip() && chainActive.Tip() != pindexFork) {
2565  if (!DisconnectTip(state, chainparams, &disconnectpool)) {
2566  // This is likely a fatal error, but keep the mempool consistent,
2567  // just in case. Only remove from the mempool in this case.
2568  UpdateMempoolForReorg(disconnectpool, false);
2569  return false;
2570  }
2571  fBlocksDisconnected = true;
2572  }
2573 
2574  // Build list of new blocks to connect.
2575  std::vector<CBlockIndex*> vpindexToConnect;
2576  bool fContinue = true;
2577  int nHeight = pindexFork ? pindexFork->nHeight : -1;
2578  while (fContinue && nHeight != pindexMostWork->nHeight) {
2579  // Don't iterate the entire list of potential improvements toward the best tip, as we likely only need
2580  // a few blocks along the way.
2581  int nTargetHeight = std::min(nHeight + 32, pindexMostWork->nHeight);
2582  vpindexToConnect.clear();
2583  vpindexToConnect.reserve(nTargetHeight - nHeight);
2584  CBlockIndex *pindexIter = pindexMostWork->GetAncestor(nTargetHeight);
2585  while (pindexIter && pindexIter->nHeight != nHeight) {
2586  vpindexToConnect.push_back(pindexIter);
2587  pindexIter = pindexIter->pprev;
2588  }
2589  nHeight = nTargetHeight;
2590 
2591  // Connect new blocks.
2592  for (CBlockIndex *pindexConnect : reverse_iterate(vpindexToConnect)) {
2593  if (!ConnectTip(state, chainparams, pindexConnect, pindexConnect == pindexMostWork ? pblock : std::shared_ptr<const CBlock>(), connectTrace, disconnectpool)) {
2594  if (state.IsInvalid()) {
2595  // The block violates a consensus rule.
2596  if (!state.CorruptionPossible()) {
2597  InvalidChainFound(vpindexToConnect.front());
2598  }
2599  state = CValidationState();
2600  fInvalidFound = true;
2601  fContinue = false;
2602  break;
2603  } else {
2604  // A system error occurred (disk space, database error, ...).
2605  // Make the mempool consistent with the current tip, just in case
2606  // any observers try to use it before shutdown.
2607  UpdateMempoolForReorg(disconnectpool, false);
2608  return false;
2609  }
2610  } else {
2611  PruneBlockIndexCandidates();
2612  if (!pindexOldTip || chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork > pindexOldTip->nChainWork) {
2613  // We're in a better position than we were. Return temporarily to release the lock.
2614  fContinue = false;
2615  break;
2616  }
2617  }
2618  }
2619  }
2620 
2621  if (fBlocksDisconnected) {
2622  // If any blocks were disconnected, disconnectpool may be non empty. Add
2623  // any disconnected transactions back to the mempool.
2624  UpdateMempoolForReorg(disconnectpool, true);
2625  }
2626  mempool.check(pcoinsTip.get());
2627 
2628  // Callbacks/notifications for a new best chain.
2629  if (fInvalidFound)
2630  CheckForkWarningConditionsOnNewFork(vpindexToConnect.back());
2631  else
2632  CheckForkWarningConditions();
2633 
2634  return true;
2635 }

2637 static void NotifyHeaderTip() LOCKS_EXCLUDED(cs_main) {
2638  bool fNotify = false;
2639  bool fInitialBlockDownload = false;
2640  static CBlockIndex* pindexHeaderOld = nullptr;
2641  CBlockIndex* pindexHeader = nullptr;
2642  {
2643  LOCK(cs_main);
2644  pindexHeader = pindexBestHeader;
2645 
2646  if (pindexHeader != pindexHeaderOld) {
2647  fNotify = true;
2648  fInitialBlockDownload = IsInitialBlockDownload();
2649  pindexHeaderOld = pindexHeader;
2650  }
2651  }
2652  // Send block tip changed notifications without cs_main
2653  if (fNotify) {
2654  uiInterface.NotifyHeaderTip(fInitialBlockDownload, pindexHeader);
2655  }
2656 }
2657 
2667 bool CChainState::ActivateBestChain(CValidationState &state, const CChainParams& chainparams, std::shared_ptr<const CBlock> pblock) {
2668  // Note that while we're often called here from ProcessNewBlock, this is
2669  // far from a guarantee. Things in the P2P/RPC will often end up calling
2670  // us in the middle of ProcessNewBlock - do not assume pblock is set
2671  // sanely for performance or correctness!
2672  AssertLockNotHeld(cs_main);
2673 
2674  // ABC maintains a fair degree of expensive-to-calculate internal state
2675  // because this function periodically releases cs_main so that it does not lock up other threads for too long
2676  // during large connects - and to allow for e.g. the callback queue to drain
2677  // we use m_cs_chainstate to enforce mutual exclusion so that only one caller may execute this function at a time
2678  LOCK(m_cs_chainstate);
2679 
2680  CBlockIndex *pindexMostWork = nullptr;
2681  CBlockIndex *pindexNewTip = nullptr;
2682  int nStopAtHeight = gArgs.GetArg("-stopatheight", DEFAULT_STOPATHEIGHT);
2683  do {
2684  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
2685 
2686  if (GetMainSignals().CallbacksPending() > 10) {
2687  // Block until the validation queue drains. This should largely
2688  // never happen in normal operation, however may happen during
2689  // reindex, causing memory blowup if we run too far ahead.
2690  // Note that if a validationinterface callback ends up calling
2691  // ActivateBestChain this may lead to a deadlock! We should
2692  // probably have a DEBUG_LOCKORDER test for this in the future.
2693  SyncWithValidationInterfaceQueue();
2694  }
2695 
2696  {
2697  LOCK(cs_main);
2698  CBlockIndex* starting_tip = chainActive.Tip();
2699  bool blocks_connected = false;
2700  do {
2701  // We absolutely may not unlock cs_main until we've made forward progress
2702  // (with the exception of shutdown due to hardware issues, low disk space, etc).
2703  ConnectTrace connectTrace(mempool); // Destructed before cs_main is unlocked
2704 
2705  if (pindexMostWork == nullptr) {
2706  pindexMostWork = FindMostWorkChain();
2707  }
2708 
2709  // Whether we have anything to do at all.
2710  if (pindexMostWork == nullptr || pindexMostWork == chainActive.Tip()) {
2711  break;
2712  }
2713 
2714  bool fInvalidFound = false;
2715  std::shared_ptr<const CBlock> nullBlockPtr;
2716  if (!ActivateBestChainStep(state, chainparams, pindexMostWork, pblock && pblock->GetHash() == pindexMostWork->GetBlockHash() ? pblock : nullBlockPtr, fInvalidFound, connectTrace))
2717  return false;
2718  blocks_connected = true;
2719 
2720  if (fInvalidFound) {
2721  // Wipe cache, we may need another branch now.
2722  pindexMostWork = nullptr;
2723  }
2724  pindexNewTip = chainActive.Tip();
2725 
2726  for (const PerBlockConnectTrace& trace : connectTrace.GetBlocksConnected()) {
2727  assert(trace.pblock && trace.pindex);
2728  GetMainSignals().BlockConnected(trace.pblock, trace.pindex, trace.conflictedTxs);
2729  }
2730  } while (!chainActive.Tip() || (starting_tip && CBlockIndexWorkComparator()(chainActive.Tip(), starting_tip)));
2731  if (!blocks_connected) return true;
2732 
2733  const CBlockIndex* pindexFork = chainActive.FindFork(starting_tip);
2734  bool fInitialDownload = IsInitialBlockDownload();
2735 
2736  // Notify external listeners about the new tip.
2737  // Enqueue while holding cs_main to ensure that UpdatedBlockTip is called in the order in which blocks are connected
2738  if (pindexFork != pindexNewTip) {
2739  // Notify ValidationInterface subscribers
2740  GetMainSignals().UpdatedBlockTip(pindexNewTip, pindexFork, fInitialDownload);
2741 
2742  // Always notify the UI if a new block tip was connected
2743  uiInterface.NotifyBlockTip(fInitialDownload, pindexNewTip);
2744  }
2745  }
2746  // When we reach this point, we switched to a new tip (stored in pindexNewTip).
2747 
2748  if (nStopAtHeight && pindexNewTip && pindexNewTip->nHeight >= nStopAtHeight) StartShutdown();
2749 
2750  // We check shutdown only after giving ActivateBestChainStep a chance to run once so that we
2751  // never shutdown before connecting the genesis block during LoadChainTip(). Previously this
2752  // caused an assert() failure during shutdown in such cases as the UTXO DB flushing checks
2753  // that the best block hash is non-null.
2754  if (ShutdownRequested())
2755  break;
2756  } while (pindexNewTip != pindexMostWork);
2757  CheckBlockIndex(chainparams.GetConsensus());
2758 
2759  // Write changes periodically to disk, after relay.
2760  if (!FlushStateToDisk(chainparams, state, FlushStateMode::PERIODIC)) {
2761  return false;
2762  }
2763 
2764  return true;
2765 }
2766 
2767 bool ActivateBestChain(CValidationState &state, const CChainParams& chainparams, std::shared_ptr<const CBlock> pblock) {
2768  return g_chainstate.ActivateBestChain(state, chainparams, std::move(pblock));
2769 }

2771 bool CChainState::PreciousBlock(CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& params, CBlockIndex *pindex)
2772 {
2773  {
2774  LOCK(cs_main);
2775  if (pindex->nChainWork < chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork) {
2776  // Nothing to do, this block is not at the tip.
2777  return true;
2778  }
2779  if (chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork > nLastPreciousChainwork) {
2780  // The chain has been extended since the last call, reset the counter.
2781  nBlockReverseSequenceId = -1;
2782  }
2783  nLastPreciousChainwork = chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork;
2784  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(pindex);
2785  pindex->nSequenceId = nBlockReverseSequenceId;
2786  if (nBlockReverseSequenceId > std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::min()) {
2787  // We can't keep reducing the counter if somebody really wants to
2788  // call preciousblock 2**31-1 times on the same set of tips...
2789  nBlockReverseSequenceId--;
2790  }
2791  if (pindex->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS) && pindex->nChainTx) {
2792  setBlockIndexCandidates.insert(pindex);
2793  PruneBlockIndexCandidates();
2794  }
2795  }
2796 
2797  return ActivateBestChain(state, params, std::shared_ptr<const CBlock>());
2798 }

2802 
2803 bool CChainState::InvalidateBlock(CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, CBlockIndex *pindex)
2804 {
2805  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
2806 
2807  // We first disconnect backwards and then mark the blocks as invalid.
2808  // This prevents a case where pruned nodes may fail to invalidateblock
2809  // and be left unable to start as they have no tip candidates (as there
2810  // are no blocks that meet the "have data and are not invalid per
2811  // nStatus" criteria for inclusion in setBlockIndexCandidates).
2812 
2813  bool pindex_was_in_chain = false;
2814  CBlockIndex *invalid_walk_tip = chainActive.Tip();
2815 
2816  DisconnectedBlockTransactions disconnectpool;
2817  while (chainActive.Contains(pindex)) {
2818  pindex_was_in_chain = true;
2819  // ActivateBestChain considers blocks already in chainActive
2820  // unconditionally valid already, so force disconnect away from it.
2821  if (!DisconnectTip(state, chainparams, &disconnectpool)) {
2822  // It's probably hopeless to try to make the mempool consistent
2823  // here if DisconnectTip failed, but we can try.
2824  UpdateMempoolForReorg(disconnectpool, false);
2825  return false;
2826  }
2827  }
2828 
2829  // Now mark the blocks we just disconnected as descendants invalid
2830  // (note this may not be all descendants).
2831  while (pindex_was_in_chain && invalid_walk_tip != pindex) {
2832  invalid_walk_tip->nStatus |= BLOCK_FAILED_CHILD;
2833  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(invalid_walk_tip);
2834  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(invalid_walk_tip);
2835  invalid_walk_tip = invalid_walk_tip->pprev;
2836  }
2837 
2838  // Mark the block itself as invalid.
2839  pindex->nStatus |= BLOCK_FAILED_VALID;
2840  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindex);
2841  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(pindex);
2842  m_failed_blocks.insert(pindex);
2843 
2844  // DisconnectTip will add transactions to disconnectpool; try to add these
2845  // back to the mempool.
2846  UpdateMempoolForReorg(disconnectpool, true);
2847 
2848  // The resulting new best tip may not be in setBlockIndexCandidates anymore, so
2849  // add it again.
2850  BlockMap::iterator it = mapBlockIndex.begin();
2851  while (it != mapBlockIndex.end()) {
2852  if (it->second->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS) && it->second->nChainTx && !setBlockIndexCandidates.value_comp()(it->second, chainActive.Tip())) {
2853  setBlockIndexCandidates.insert(it->second);
2854  }
2855  it++;
2856  }
2857 
2858  InvalidChainFound(pindex);
2859 
2860  // Only notify about a new block tip if the active chain was modified.
2861  if (pindex_was_in_chain) {
2862  uiInterface.NotifyBlockTip(IsInitialBlockDownload(), pindex->pprev);
2863  }
2864  return true;
2865 }

2867 bool InvalidateBlock(CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, CBlockIndex *pindex) {
2868  return g_chainstate.InvalidateBlock(state, chainparams, pindex);
2869 }

2871 void CChainState::ResetBlockFailureFlags(CBlockIndex *pindex) {
2872  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
2873 
2874  int nHeight = pindex->nHeight;
2875 
2876  // Remove the invalidity flag from this block and all its descendants.
2877  BlockMap::iterator it = mapBlockIndex.begin();
2878  while (it != mapBlockIndex.end()) {
2879  if (!it->second->IsValid() && it->second->GetAncestor(nHeight) == pindex) {
2880  it->second->nStatus &= ~BLOCK_FAILED_MASK;
2881  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(it->second);
2882  if (it->second->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS) && it->second->nChainTx && setBlockIndexCandidates.value_comp()(chainActive.Tip(), it->second)) {
2883  setBlockIndexCandidates.insert(it->second);
2884  }
2885  if (it->second == pindexBestInvalid) {
2886  // Reset invalid block marker if it was pointing to one of those.
2887  pindexBestInvalid = nullptr;
2888  }
2889  m_failed_blocks.erase(it->second);
2890  }
2891  it++;
2892  }
2893 
2894  // Remove the invalidity flag from all ancestors too.
2895  while (pindex != nullptr) {
2896  if (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_MASK) {
2897  pindex->nStatus &= ~BLOCK_FAILED_MASK;
2898  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindex);
2899  m_failed_blocks.erase(pindex);
2900  }
2901  pindex = pindex->pprev;
2902  }
2903 }

2906  return g_chainstate.ResetBlockFailureFlags(pindex);
2907 }

2909 CBlockIndex* CChainState::AddToBlockIndex(const CBlockHeader& block)
2910 {
2911  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
2912 
2913  // Check for duplicate
2914  uint256 hash = block.GetHash();
2915  BlockMap::iterator it = mapBlockIndex.find(hash);
2916  if (it != mapBlockIndex.end())
2917  return it->second;
2918 
2919  // Construct new block index object
2920  CBlockIndex* pindexNew = new CBlockIndex(block);
2921  // We assign the sequence id to blocks only when the full data is available,
2922  // to avoid miners withholding blocks but broadcasting headers, to get a
2923  // competitive advantage.
2924  pindexNew->nSequenceId = 0;
2925  BlockMap::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.insert(std::make_pair(hash, pindexNew)).first;
2926  pindexNew->phashBlock = &((*mi).first);
2927  BlockMap::iterator miPrev = mapBlockIndex.find(block.hashPrevBlock);
2928  if (miPrev != mapBlockIndex.end())
2929  {
2930  pindexNew->pprev = (*miPrev).second;
2931  pindexNew->nHeight = pindexNew->pprev->nHeight + 1;
2932  pindexNew->BuildSkip();
2933  }
2934  pindexNew->nTimeMax = (pindexNew->pprev ? std::max(pindexNew->pprev->nTimeMax, pindexNew->nTime) : pindexNew->nTime);
2935  pindexNew->nChainWork = (pindexNew->pprev ? pindexNew->pprev->nChainWork : 0) + GetBlockProof(*pindexNew);
2936  pindexNew->RaiseValidity(BLOCK_VALID_TREE);
2937  if (pindexBestHeader == nullptr || pindexBestHeader->nChainWork < pindexNew->nChainWork)
2938  pindexBestHeader = pindexNew;
2939 
2940  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindexNew);
2941 
2942  return pindexNew;
2943 }

2946 void CChainState::ReceivedBlockTransactions(const CBlock& block, CBlockIndex* pindexNew, const CDiskBlockPos& pos, const Consensus::Params& consensusParams)
2947 {
2948  pindexNew->nTx = block.vtx.size();
2949  pindexNew->nChainTx = 0;
2950  pindexNew->nFile = pos.nFile;
2951  pindexNew->nDataPos = pos.nPos;
2952  pindexNew->nUndoPos = 0;
2953  pindexNew->nStatus |= BLOCK_HAVE_DATA;
2954  if (IsWitnessEnabled(pindexNew->pprev, consensusParams)) {
2955  pindexNew->nStatus |= BLOCK_OPT_WITNESS;
2956  }
2957  pindexNew->RaiseValidity(BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS);
2958  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindexNew);
2959 
2960  if (pindexNew->pprev == nullptr || pindexNew->pprev->nChainTx) {
2961  // If pindexNew is the genesis block or all parents are BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS.
2962  std::deque<CBlockIndex*> queue;
2963  queue.push_back(pindexNew);
2964 
2965  // Recursively process any descendant blocks that now may be eligible to be connected.
2966  while (!queue.empty()) {
2967  CBlockIndex *pindex = queue.front();
2968  queue.pop_front();
2969  pindex->nChainTx = (pindex->pprev ? pindex->pprev->nChainTx : 0) + pindex->nTx;
2970  {
2971  LOCK(cs_nBlockSequenceId);
2972  pindex->nSequenceId = nBlockSequenceId++;
2973  }
2974  if (chainActive.Tip() == nullptr || !setBlockIndexCandidates.value_comp()(pindex, chainActive.Tip())) {
2975  setBlockIndexCandidates.insert(pindex);
2976  }
2977  std::pair<std::multimap<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndex*>::iterator, std::multimap<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndex*>::iterator> range = mapBlocksUnlinked.equal_range(pindex);
2978  while (range.first != range.second) {
2979  std::multimap<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndex*>::iterator it = range.first;
2980  queue.push_back(it->second);
2981  range.first++;
2982  mapBlocksUnlinked.erase(it);
2983  }
2984  }
2985  } else {
2986  if (pindexNew->pprev && pindexNew->pprev->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_TREE)) {
2987  mapBlocksUnlinked.insert(std::make_pair(pindexNew->pprev, pindexNew));
2988  }
2989  }
2990 }

2992 static bool FindBlockPos(CDiskBlockPos &pos, unsigned int nAddSize, unsigned int nHeight, uint64_t nTime, bool fKnown = false)
2993 {
2994  LOCK(cs_LastBlockFile);
2995 
2996  unsigned int nFile = fKnown ? pos.nFile : nLastBlockFile;
2997  if (vinfoBlockFile.size() <= nFile) {
2998  vinfoBlockFile.resize(nFile + 1);
2999  }
3000 
3001  if (!fKnown) {
3002  while (vinfoBlockFile[nFile].nSize + nAddSize >= MAX_BLOCKFILE_SIZE) {
3003  nFile++;
3004  if (vinfoBlockFile.size() <= nFile) {
3005  vinfoBlockFile.resize(nFile + 1);
3006  }
3007  }
3008  pos.nFile = nFile;
3009  pos.nPos = vinfoBlockFile[nFile].nSize;
3010  }
3011 
3012  if ((int)nFile != nLastBlockFile) {
3013  if (!fKnown) {
3014  LogPrintf("Leaving block file %i: %s\n", nLastBlockFile, vinfoBlockFile[nLastBlockFile].ToString());
3015  }
3016  FlushBlockFile(!fKnown);
3017  nLastBlockFile = nFile;
3018  }
3019 
3020  vinfoBlockFile[nFile].AddBlock(nHeight, nTime);
3021  if (fKnown)
3022  vinfoBlockFile[nFile].nSize = std::max(pos.nPos + nAddSize, vinfoBlockFile[nFile].nSize);
3023  else
3024  vinfoBlockFile[nFile].nSize += nAddSize;
3025 
3026  if (!fKnown) {
3027  unsigned int nOldChunks = (pos.nPos + BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - 1) / BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE;
3028  unsigned int nNewChunks = (vinfoBlockFile[nFile].nSize + BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - 1) / BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE;
3029  if (nNewChunks > nOldChunks) {
3030  if (fPruneMode)
3031  fCheckForPruning = true;
3032  if (CheckDiskSpace(nNewChunks * BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - pos.nPos, true)) {
3033  FILE *file = OpenBlockFile(pos);
3034  if (file) {
3035  LogPrintf("Pre-allocating up to position 0x%x in blk%05u.dat\n", nNewChunks * BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE, pos.nFile);
3036  AllocateFileRange(file, pos.nPos, nNewChunks * BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE - pos.nPos);
3037  fclose(file);
3038  }
3039  }
3040  else
3041  return error("out of disk space");
3042  }
3043  }
3044 
3045  setDirtyFileInfo.insert(nFile);
3046  return true;
3047 }

3089 bool CheckBlock(const CBlock& block, CValidationState& state, const Consensus::Params& consensusParams, bool fCheckPOW, bool fCheckMerkleRoot)
3090 {
3091  // These are checks that are independent of context.
3092 
3093  if (block.fChecked)
3094  return true;
3095 
3096  // Check that the header is valid (particularly PoW). This is mostly
3097  // redundant with the call in AcceptBlockHeader.
3098  if (!CheckBlockHeader(block, state, consensusParams, fCheckPOW))
3099  return false;
3100 
3101  // Check the merkle root.
3102  if (fCheckMerkleRoot) {
3103  bool mutated;
3104  uint256 hashMerkleRoot2 = BlockMerkleRoot(block, &mutated);
3105  if (block.hashMerkleRoot != hashMerkleRoot2)
3106  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txnmrklroot", true, "hashMerkleRoot mismatch");
3107 
3108  // Check for merkle tree malleability (CVE-2012-2459): repeating sequences
3109  // of transactions in a block without affecting the merkle root of a block,
3110  // while still invalidating it.
3111  if (mutated)
3112  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-duplicate", true, "duplicate transaction");
3113  }
3114 
3115  // All potential-corruption validation must be done before we do any
3116  // transaction validation, as otherwise we may mark the header as invalid
3117  // because we receive the wrong transactions for it.
3118  // Note that witness malleability is checked in ContextualCheckBlock, so no
3119  // checks that use witness data may be performed here.
3120 
3121  // Size limits
3122  if (block.vtx.empty() || block.vtx.size() * WITNESS_SCALE_FACTOR > MAX_BLOCK_WEIGHT || ::GetSerializeSize(block, SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION | SERIALIZE_TRANSACTION_NO_WITNESS) * WITNESS_SCALE_FACTOR > MAX_BLOCK_WEIGHT)
3123  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-blk-length", false, "size limits failed");
3124 
3125  // First transaction must be coinbase, the rest must not be
3126  if (block.vtx.empty() || !block.vtx[0]->IsCoinBase())
3127  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-cb-missing", false, "first tx is not coinbase");
3128  for (unsigned int i = 1; i < block.vtx.size(); i++)
3129  if (block.vtx[i]->IsCoinBase())
3130  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-cb-multiple", false, "more than one coinbase");
3131 
3132  // Check transactions
3133  for (const auto& tx : block.vtx)
3134  if (!CheckTransaction(*tx, state, false))
3135  return state.Invalid(false, state.GetRejectCode(), state.GetRejectReason(),
3136  strprintf("Transaction check failed (tx hash %s) %s", tx->GetHash().ToString(), state.GetDebugMessage()));
3137 
3138  unsigned int nSigOps = 0;
3139  for (const auto& tx : block.vtx)
3140  {
3141  nSigOps += GetLegacySigOpCount(*tx);
3142  }
3143  if (nSigOps * WITNESS_SCALE_FACTOR > MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS_COST)
3144  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-blk-sigops", false, "out-of-bounds SigOpCount");
3145 
3146  if (fCheckPOW && fCheckMerkleRoot)
3147  block.fChecked = true;
3148 
3149  return true;
3150 }

3164 // Compute at which vout of the block's coinbase transaction the witness
3165 // commitment occurs, or -1 if not found.
3166 static int GetWitnessCommitmentIndex(const CBlock& block)
3167 {
3168  int commitpos = -1;
3169  if (!block.vtx.empty()) {
3170  for (size_t o = 0; o < block.vtx[0]->vout.size(); o++) {
3171  if (block.vtx[0]->vout[o].scriptPubKey.size() >= 38 && block.vtx[0]->vout[o].scriptPubKey[0] == OP_RETURN && block.vtx[0]->vout[o].scriptPubKey[1] == 0x24 && block.vtx[0]->vout[o].scriptPubKey[2] == 0xaa && block.vtx[0]->vout[o].scriptPubKey[3] == 0x21 && block.vtx[0]->vout[o].scriptPubKey[4] == 0xa9 && block.vtx[0]->vout[o].scriptPubKey[5] == 0xed) {
3172  commitpos = o;
3173  }
3174  }
3175  }
3176  return commitpos;
3177 }

3179 void UpdateUncommittedBlockStructures(CBlock& block, const CBlockIndex* pindexPrev, const Consensus::Params& consensusParams)
3180 {
3181  int commitpos = GetWitnessCommitmentIndex(block);
3182  static const std::vector<unsigned char> nonce(32, 0x00);
3183  if (commitpos != -1 && IsWitnessEnabled(pindexPrev, consensusParams) && !block.vtx[0]->HasWitness()) {
3184  CMutableTransaction tx(*block.vtx[0]);
3185  tx.vin[0].scriptWitness.stack.resize(1);
3186  tx.vin[0].scriptWitness.stack[0] = nonce;
3187  block.vtx[0] = MakeTransactionRef(std::move(tx));
3188  }
3189 }

3191 std::vector<unsigned char> GenerateCoinbaseCommitment(CBlock& block, const CBlockIndex* pindexPrev, const Consensus::Params& consensusParams)
3192 {
3193  std::vector<unsigned char> commitment;
3194  int commitpos = GetWitnessCommitmentIndex(block);
3195  std::vector<unsigned char> ret(32, 0x00);
3196  if (consensusParams.vDeployments[Consensus::DEPLOYMENT_SEGWIT].nTimeout != 0) {
3197  if (commitpos == -1) {
3198  uint256 witnessroot = BlockWitnessMerkleRoot(block, nullptr);
3199  CHash256().Write(witnessroot.begin(), 32).Write(ret.data(), 32).Finalize(witnessroot.begin());
3200  CTxOut out;
3201  out.nValue = 0;
3202  out.scriptPubKey.resize(38);
3203  out.scriptPubKey[0] = OP_RETURN;
3204  out.scriptPubKey[1] = 0x24;
3205  out.scriptPubKey[2] = 0xaa;
3206  out.scriptPubKey[3] = 0x21;
3207  out.scriptPubKey[4] = 0xa9;
3208  out.scriptPubKey[5] = 0xed;
3209  memcpy(&out.scriptPubKey[6], witnessroot.begin(), 32);
3210  commitment = std::vector<unsigned char>(out.scriptPubKey.begin(), out.scriptPubKey.end());
3211  CMutableTransaction tx(*block.vtx[0]);
3212  tx.vout.push_back(out);
3213  block.vtx[0] = MakeTransactionRef(std::move(tx));
3214  }
3215  }
3216  UpdateUncommittedBlockStructures(block, pindexPrev, consensusParams);
3217  return commitment;
3218 }

3229 static bool ContextualCheckBlockHeader(const CBlockHeader& block, CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& params, const CBlockIndex* pindexPrev, int64_t nAdjustedTime)
3230 {
3231  assert(pindexPrev != nullptr);
3232  const int nHeight = pindexPrev->nHeight + 1;
3233 
3234  // Check proof of work
3235  const Consensus::Params& consensusParams = params.GetConsensus();
3236  if (block.nBits != GetNextWorkRequired(pindexPrev, &block, consensusParams))
3237  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-diffbits", false, "incorrect proof of work");
3238 
3239  // Check against checkpoints
3240  if (fCheckpointsEnabled) {
3241  // Don't accept any forks from the main chain prior to last checkpoint.
3242  // GetLastCheckpoint finds the last checkpoint in MapCheckpoints that's in our
3243  // MapBlockIndex.
3244  CBlockIndex* pcheckpoint = Checkpoints::GetLastCheckpoint(params.Checkpoints());
3245  if (pcheckpoint && nHeight < pcheckpoint->nHeight)
3246  return state.DoS(100, error("%s: forked chain older than last checkpoint (height %d)", __func__, nHeight), REJECT_CHECKPOINT, "bad-fork-prior-to-checkpoint");
3247  }
3248 
3249  // Check timestamp against prev
3250  if (block.GetBlockTime() <= pindexPrev->GetMedianTimePast())
3251  return state.Invalid(false, REJECT_INVALID, "time-too-old", "block's timestamp is too early");
3252 
3253  // Check timestamp
3254  if (block.GetBlockTime() > nAdjustedTime + MAX_FUTURE_BLOCK_TIME)
3255  return state.Invalid(false, REJECT_INVALID, "time-too-new", "block timestamp too far in the future");
3256 
3257  // Reject outdated version blocks when 95% (75% on testnet) of the network has upgraded:
3258  // check for version 2, 3 and 4 upgrades
3259  if((block.nVersion < 2 && nHeight >= consensusParams.BIP34Height) ||
3260  (block.nVersion < 3 && nHeight >= consensusParams.BIP66Height) ||
3261  (block.nVersion < 4 && nHeight >= consensusParams.BIP65Height))
3262  return state.Invalid(false, REJECT_OBSOLETE, strprintf("bad-version(0x%08x)", block.nVersion),
3263  strprintf("rejected nVersion=0x%08x block", block.nVersion));
3264 
3265  return true;
3266 }
3267 
3274 static bool ContextualCheckBlock(const CBlock& block, CValidationState& state, const Consensus::Params& consensusParams, const CBlockIndex* pindexPrev)
3275 {
3276  const int nHeight = pindexPrev == nullptr ? 0 : pindexPrev->nHeight + 1;
3277 
3278  // Start enforcing BIP113 (Median Time Past) using versionbits logic.
3279  int nLockTimeFlags = 0;
3280  if (VersionBitsState(pindexPrev, consensusParams, Consensus::DEPLOYMENT_CSV, versionbitscache) == ThresholdState::ACTIVE) {
3281  nLockTimeFlags |= LOCKTIME_MEDIAN_TIME_PAST;
3282  }
3283 
3284  int64_t nLockTimeCutoff = (nLockTimeFlags & LOCKTIME_MEDIAN_TIME_PAST)
3285  ? pindexPrev->GetMedianTimePast()
3286  : block.GetBlockTime();
3287 
3288  // Check that all transactions are finalized
3289  for (const auto& tx : block.vtx) {
3290  if (!IsFinalTx(*tx, nHeight, nLockTimeCutoff)) {
3291  return state.DoS(10, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-nonfinal", false, "non-final transaction");
3292  }
3293  }
3294 
3295  // Enforce rule that the coinbase starts with serialized block height
3296  if (nHeight >= consensusParams.BIP34Height)
3297  {
3298  CScript expect = CScript() << nHeight;
3299  if (block.vtx[0]->vin[0].scriptSig.size() < expect.size() ||
3300  !std::equal(expect.begin(), expect.end(), block.vtx[0]->vin[0].scriptSig.begin())) {
3301  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-cb-height", false, "block height mismatch in coinbase");
3302  }
3303  }
3304 
3305  // Validation for witness commitments.
3306  // * We compute the witness hash (which is the hash including witnesses) of all the block's transactions, except the
3307  // coinbase (where 0x0000....0000 is used instead).
3308  // * The coinbase scriptWitness is a stack of a single 32-byte vector, containing a witness reserved value (unconstrained).
3309  // * We build a merkle tree with all those witness hashes as leaves (similar to the hashMerkleRoot in the block header).
3310  // * There must be at least one output whose scriptPubKey is a single 36-byte push, the first 4 bytes of which are
3311  // {0xaa, 0x21, 0xa9, 0xed}, and the following 32 bytes are SHA256^2(witness root, witness reserved value). In case there are
3312  // multiple, the last one is used.
3313  bool fHaveWitness = false;
3314  if (VersionBitsState(pindexPrev, consensusParams, Consensus::DEPLOYMENT_SEGWIT, versionbitscache) == ThresholdState::ACTIVE) {
3315  int commitpos = GetWitnessCommitmentIndex(block);
3316  if (commitpos != -1) {
3317  bool malleated = false;
3318  uint256 hashWitness = BlockWitnessMerkleRoot(block, &malleated);
3319  // The malleation check is ignored; as the transaction tree itself
3320  // already does not permit it, it is impossible to trigger in the
3321  // witness tree.
3322  if (block.vtx[0]->vin[0].scriptWitness.stack.size() != 1 || block.vtx[0]->vin[0].scriptWitness.stack[0].size() != 32) {
3323  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-witness-nonce-size", true, strprintf("%s : invalid witness reserved value size", __func__));
3324  }
3325  CHash256().Write(hashWitness.begin(), 32).Write(&block.vtx[0]->vin[0].scriptWitness.stack[0][0], 32).Finalize(hashWitness.begin());
3326  if (memcmp(hashWitness.begin(), &block.vtx[0]->vout[commitpos].scriptPubKey[6], 32)) {
3327  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-witness-merkle-match", true, strprintf("%s : witness merkle commitment mismatch", __func__));
3328  }
3329  fHaveWitness = true;
3330  }
3331  }
3332 
3333  // No witness data is allowed in blocks that don't commit to witness data, as this would otherwise leave room for spam
3334  if (!fHaveWitness) {
3335  for (const auto& tx : block.vtx) {
3336  if (tx->HasWitness()) {
3337  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "unexpected-witness", true, strprintf("%s : unexpected witness data found", __func__));
3338  }
3339  }
3340  }
3341 
3342  // After the coinbase witness reserved value and commitment are verified,
3343  // we can check if the block weight passes (before we've checked the
3344  // coinbase witness, it would be possible for the weight to be too
3345  // large by filling up the coinbase witness, which doesn't change
3346  // the block hash, so we couldn't mark the block as permanently
3347  // failed).
3348  if (GetBlockWeight(block) > MAX_BLOCK_WEIGHT) {
3349  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, "bad-blk-weight", false, strprintf("%s : weight limit failed", __func__));
3350  }
3351 
3352  return true;
3353 }
3354 
3355 bool CChainState::AcceptBlockHeader(const CBlockHeader& block, CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, CBlockIndex** ppindex)
3356 {
3357  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
3358  // Check for duplicate
3359  uint256 hash = block.GetHash();
3360  BlockMap::iterator miSelf = mapBlockIndex.find(hash);
3361  CBlockIndex *pindex = nullptr;
3362  if (hash != chainparams.GetConsensus().hashGenesisBlock) {
3363  if (miSelf != mapBlockIndex.end()) {
3364  // Block header is already known.
3365  pindex = miSelf->second;
3366  if (ppindex)
3367  *ppindex = pindex;
3368  if (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_MASK)
3369  return state.Invalid(error("%s: block %s is marked invalid", __func__, hash.ToString()), 0, "duplicate");
3370  return true;
3371  }
3372 
3373  if (!CheckBlockHeader(block, state, chainparams.GetConsensus()))
3374  return error("%s: Consensus::CheckBlockHeader: %s, %s", __func__, hash.ToString(), FormatStateMessage(state));
3375 
3376  // Get prev block index
3377  CBlockIndex* pindexPrev = nullptr;
3378  BlockMap::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(block.hashPrevBlock);
3379  if (mi == mapBlockIndex.end())
3380  return state.DoS(10, error("%s: prev block not found", __func__), 0, "prev-blk-not-found");
3381  pindexPrev = (*mi).second;
3382  if (pindexPrev->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_MASK)
3383  return state.DoS(100, error("%s: prev block invalid", __func__), REJECT_INVALID, "bad-prevblk");
3384  if (!ContextualCheckBlockHeader(block, state, chainparams, pindexPrev, GetAdjustedTime()))
3385  return error("%s: Consensus::ContextualCheckBlockHeader: %s, %s", __func__, hash.ToString(), FormatStateMessage(state));
3386 
3387  // If the previous block index isn't valid, determine if it descends from any block which
3388  // has been found invalid (m_failed_blocks), then mark pindexPrev and any blocks
3389  // between them as failed.
3390  if (!pindexPrev->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_SCRIPTS)) {
3391  for (const CBlockIndex* failedit : m_failed_blocks) {
3392  if (pindexPrev->GetAncestor(failedit->nHeight) == failedit) {
3393  assert(failedit->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_VALID);
3394  CBlockIndex* invalid_walk = pindexPrev;
3395  while (invalid_walk != failedit) {
3396  invalid_walk->nStatus |= BLOCK_FAILED_CHILD;
3397  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(invalid_walk);
3398  invalid_walk = invalid_walk->pprev;
3399  }
3400  return state.DoS(100, error("%s: prev block invalid", __func__), REJECT_INVALID, "bad-prevblk");
3401  }
3402  }
3403  }
3404  }
3405  if (pindex == nullptr)
3406  pindex = AddToBlockIndex(block);
3407 
3408  if (ppindex)
3409  *ppindex = pindex;
3410 
3411  CheckBlockIndex(chainparams.GetConsensus());
3412 
3413  return true;
3414 }
3415 
3416 // Exposed wrapper for AcceptBlockHeader
3417 bool ProcessNewBlockHeaders(const std::vector<CBlockHeader>& headers, CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, const CBlockIndex** ppindex, CBlockHeader *first_invalid)
3418 {
3419  if (first_invalid != nullptr) first_invalid->SetNull();
3420  {
3421  LOCK(cs_main);
3422  for (const CBlockHeader& header : headers) {
3423  CBlockIndex *pindex = nullptr; // Use a temp pindex instead of ppindex to avoid a const_cast
3424  if (!g_chainstate.AcceptBlockHeader(header, state, chainparams, &pindex)) {
3425  if (first_invalid) *first_invalid = header;
3426  return false;
3427  }
3428  if (ppindex) {
3429  *ppindex = pindex;
3430  }
3431  }
3432  }
3433  NotifyHeaderTip();
3434  return true;
3435 }
