3438 static CDiskBlockPos SaveBlockToDisk(const CBlock& block, int nHeight, const CChainParams& chainparams, const CDiskBlockPos* dbp) {
3439  unsigned int nBlockSize = ::GetSerializeSize(block, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
3440  CDiskBlockPos blockPos;
3441  if (dbp != nullptr)
3442  blockPos = *dbp;
3443  if (!FindBlockPos(blockPos, nBlockSize+8, nHeight, block.GetBlockTime(), dbp != nullptr)) {
3444  error("%s: FindBlockPos failed", __func__);
3445  return CDiskBlockPos();
3446  }
3447  if (dbp == nullptr) {
3448  if (!WriteBlockToDisk(block, blockPos, chainparams.MessageStart())) {
3449  AbortNode("Failed to write block");
3450  return CDiskBlockPos();
3451  }
3452  }
3453  return blockPos;
3454 }
3455 
3457 bool CChainState::AcceptBlock(const std::shared_ptr<const CBlock>& pblock, CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, CBlockIndex** ppindex, bool fRequested, const CDiskBlockPos* dbp, bool* fNewBlock)
3458 {
3459  const CBlock& block = *pblock;
3460 
3461  if (fNewBlock) *fNewBlock = false;
3462  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
3463 
3464  CBlockIndex *pindexDummy = nullptr;
3465  CBlockIndex *&pindex = ppindex ? *ppindex : pindexDummy;
3466 
3467  if (!AcceptBlockHeader(block, state, chainparams, &pindex))
3468  return false;
3469 
3470  // Try to process all requested blocks that we don't have, but only
3471  // process an unrequested block if it's new and has enough work to
3472  // advance our tip, and isn't too many blocks ahead.
3473  bool fAlreadyHave = pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA;
3474  bool fHasMoreOrSameWork = (chainActive.Tip() ? pindex->nChainWork >= chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork : true);
3475  // Blocks that are too out-of-order needlessly limit the effectiveness of
3476  // pruning, because pruning will not delete block files that contain any
3477  // blocks which are too close in height to the tip. Apply this test
3478  // regardless of whether pruning is enabled; it should generally be safe to
3479  // not process unrequested blocks.
3480  bool fTooFarAhead = (pindex->nHeight > int(chainActive.Height() + MIN_BLOCKS_TO_KEEP));
3481 
3482  // TODO: Decouple this function from the block download logic by removing fRequested
3483  // This requires some new chain data structure to efficiently look up if a
3484  // block is in a chain leading to a candidate for best tip, despite not
3485  // being such a candidate itself.
3486 
3487  // TODO: deal better with return value and error conditions for duplicate
3488  // and unrequested blocks.
3489  if (fAlreadyHave) return true;
3490  if (!fRequested) { // If we didn't ask for it:
3491  if (pindex->nTx != 0) return true; // This is a previously-processed block that was pruned
3492  if (!fHasMoreOrSameWork) return true; // Don't process less-work chains
3493  if (fTooFarAhead) return true; // Block height is too high
3494 
3495  // Protect against DoS attacks from low-work chains.
3496  // If our tip is behind, a peer could try to send us
3497  // low-work blocks on a fake chain that we would never
3498  // request; don't process these.
3499  if (pindex->nChainWork < nMinimumChainWork) return true;
3500  }
3501 
3502  if (!CheckBlock(block, state, chainparams.GetConsensus()) ||
3503  !ContextualCheckBlock(block, state, chainparams.GetConsensus(), pindex->pprev)) {
3504  if (state.IsInvalid() && !state.CorruptionPossible()) {
3505  pindex->nStatus |= BLOCK_FAILED_VALID;
3506  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindex);
3507  }
3508  return error("%s: %s", __func__, FormatStateMessage(state));
3509  }
3510 
3511  // Header is valid/has work, merkle tree and segwit merkle tree are good...RELAY NOW
3512  // (but if it does not build on our best tip, let the SendMessages loop relay it)
3513  if (!IsInitialBlockDownload() && chainActive.Tip() == pindex->pprev)
3514  GetMainSignals().NewPoWValidBlock(pindex, pblock);
3515 
3516  // Write block to history file
3517  if (fNewBlock) *fNewBlock = true;
3518  try {
3519  CDiskBlockPos blockPos = SaveBlockToDisk(block, pindex->nHeight, chainparams, dbp);
3520  if (blockPos.IsNull()) {
3521  state.Error(strprintf("%s: Failed to find position to write new block to disk", __func__));
3522  return false;
3523  }
3524  ReceivedBlockTransactions(block, pindex, blockPos, chainparams.GetConsensus());
3525  } catch (const std::runtime_error& e) {
3526  return AbortNode(state, std::string("System error: ") + e.what());
3527  }
3528 
3529  FlushStateToDisk(chainparams, state, FlushStateMode::NONE);
3530 
3531  CheckBlockIndex(chainparams.GetConsensus());
3532 
3533  return true;
3534 }
3535 
3536 bool ProcessNewBlock(const CChainParams& chainparams, const std::shared_ptr<const CBlock> pblock, bool fForceProcessing, bool *fNewBlock)
3537 {
3538  AssertLockNotHeld(cs_main);
3539 
3540  {
3541  CBlockIndex *pindex = nullptr;
3542  if (fNewBlock) *fNewBlock = false;
3543  CValidationState state;
3544  // Ensure that CheckBlock() passes before calling AcceptBlock, as
3545  // belt-and-suspenders.
3546  bool ret = CheckBlock(*pblock, state, chainparams.GetConsensus());
3547 
3548  LOCK(cs_main);
3549 
3550  if (ret) {
3551  // Store to disk
3552  ret = g_chainstate.AcceptBlock(pblock, state, chainparams, &pindex, fForceProcessing, nullptr, fNewBlock);
3553  }
3554  if (!ret) {
3555  GetMainSignals().BlockChecked(*pblock, state);
3556  return error("%s: AcceptBlock FAILED (%s)", __func__, FormatStateMessage(state));
3557  }
3558  }
3559 
3560  NotifyHeaderTip();
3561 
3562  CValidationState state; // Only used to report errors, not invalidity - ignore it
3563  if (!g_chainstate.ActivateBestChain(state, chainparams, pblock))
3564  return error("%s: ActivateBestChain failed (%s)", __func__, FormatStateMessage(state));
3565 
3566  return true;
3567 }

3569 bool TestBlockValidity(CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, const CBlock& block, CBlockIndex* pindexPrev, bool fCheckPOW, bool fCheckMerkleRoot)
3570 {
3571  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
3572  assert(pindexPrev && pindexPrev == chainActive.Tip());
3573  CCoinsViewCache viewNew(pcoinsTip.get());
3574  uint256 block_hash(block.GetHash());
3575  CBlockIndex indexDummy(block);
3576  indexDummy.pprev = pindexPrev;
3577  indexDummy.nHeight = pindexPrev->nHeight + 1;
3578  indexDummy.phashBlock = &block_hash;
3579 
3580  // NOTE: CheckBlockHeader is called by CheckBlock
3581  if (!ContextualCheckBlockHeader(block, state, chainparams, pindexPrev, GetAdjustedTime()))
3582  return error("%s: Consensus::ContextualCheckBlockHeader: %s", __func__, FormatStateMessage(state));
3583  if (!CheckBlock(block, state, chainparams.GetConsensus(), fCheckPOW, fCheckMerkleRoot))
3584  return error("%s: Consensus::CheckBlock: %s", __func__, FormatStateMessage(state));
3585  if (!ContextualCheckBlock(block, state, chainparams.GetConsensus(), pindexPrev))
3586  return error("%s: Consensus::ContextualCheckBlock: %s", __func__, FormatStateMessage(state));
3587  if (!g_chainstate.ConnectBlock(block, state, &indexDummy, viewNew, chainparams, true))
3588  return false;
3589  assert(state.IsValid());
3590 
3591  return true;
3592 }

3598 /* Calculate the amount of disk space the block & undo files currently use */
3599 uint64_t CalculateCurrentUsage()
3600 {
3601  LOCK(cs_LastBlockFile);
3602 
3603  uint64_t retval = 0;
3604  for (const CBlockFileInfo &file : vinfoBlockFile) {
3605  retval += file.nSize + file.nUndoSize;
3606  }

3610 /* Prune a block file (modify associated database entries)*/
3611 void PruneOneBlockFile(const int fileNumber)
3612 {
3613  LOCK(cs_LastBlockFile);
3614 
3615  for (const auto& entry : mapBlockIndex) {
3616  CBlockIndex* pindex = entry.second;
3617  if (pindex->nFile == fileNumber) {
3618  pindex->nStatus &= ~BLOCK_HAVE_DATA;
3619  pindex->nStatus &= ~BLOCK_HAVE_UNDO;
3620  pindex->nFile = 0;
3621  pindex->nDataPos = 0;
3622  pindex->nUndoPos = 0;
3623  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindex);
3624 
3625  // Prune from mapBlocksUnlinked -- any block we prune would have
3626  // to be downloaded again in order to consider its chain, at which
3627  // point it would be considered as a candidate for
3628  // mapBlocksUnlinked or setBlockIndexCandidates.
3629  std::pair<std::multimap<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndex*>::iterator, std::multimap<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndex*>::iterator> range = mapBlocksUnlinked.equal_range(pindex->pprev);
3630  while (range.first != range.second) {
3631  std::multimap<CBlockIndex *, CBlockIndex *>::iterator _it = range.first;
3632  range.first++;
3633  if (_it->second == pindex) {
3634  mapBlocksUnlinked.erase(_it);
3635  }
3636  }
3637  }
3638  }
3639 
3640  vinfoBlockFile[fileNumber].SetNull();
3641  setDirtyFileInfo.insert(fileNumber);
3642 }

3645 void UnlinkPrunedFiles(const std::set<int>& setFilesToPrune)
3646 {
3647  for (std::set<int>::iterator it = setFilesToPrune.begin(); it != setFilesToPrune.end(); ++it) {
3648  CDiskBlockPos pos(*it, 0);
3649  fs::remove(GetBlockPosFilename(pos, "blk"));
3650  fs::remove(GetBlockPosFilename(pos, "rev"));
3651  LogPrintf("Prune: %s deleted blk/rev (%05u)\n", __func__, *it);
3652  }
3653 }

3655 /* Calculate the block/rev files to delete based on height specified by user with RPC command pruneblockchain */
3656 static void FindFilesToPruneManual(std::set<int>& setFilesToPrune, int nManualPruneHeight)
3657 {
3658  assert(fPruneMode && nManualPruneHeight > 0);
3659 
3660  LOCK2(cs_main, cs_LastBlockFile);
3661  if (chainActive.Tip() == nullptr)
3662  return;
3663 
3664  // last block to prune is the lesser of (user-specified height, MIN_BLOCKS_TO_KEEP from the tip)
3665  unsigned int nLastBlockWeCanPrune = std::min((unsigned)nManualPruneHeight, chainActive.Tip()->nHeight - MIN_BLOCKS_TO_KEEP);
3666  int count=0;
3667  for (int fileNumber = 0; fileNumber < nLastBlockFile; fileNumber++) {
3668  if (vinfoBlockFile[fileNumber].nSize == 0 || vinfoBlockFile[fileNumber].nHeightLast > nLastBlockWeCanPrune)
3669  continue;
3670  PruneOneBlockFile(fileNumber);
3671  setFilesToPrune.insert(fileNumber);
3672  count++;
3673  }
3674  LogPrintf("Prune (Manual): prune_height=%d removed %d blk/rev pairs\n", nLastBlockWeCanPrune, count);
3675 }

3686 
3702 static void FindFilesToPrune(std::set<int>& setFilesToPrune, uint64_t nPruneAfterHeight)
3703 {
3704  LOCK2(cs_main, cs_LastBlockFile);
3705  if (chainActive.Tip() == nullptr || nPruneTarget == 0) {
3706  return;
3707  }
3708  if ((uint64_t)chainActive.Tip()->nHeight <= nPruneAfterHeight) {
3709  return;
3710  }
3711 
3712  unsigned int nLastBlockWeCanPrune = chainActive.Tip()->nHeight - MIN_BLOCKS_TO_KEEP;
3713  uint64_t nCurrentUsage = CalculateCurrentUsage();
3714  // We don't check to prune until after we've allocated new space for files
3715  // So we should leave a buffer under our target to account for another allocation
3716  // before the next pruning.
3717  uint64_t nBuffer = BLOCKFILE_CHUNK_SIZE + UNDOFILE_CHUNK_SIZE;
3718  uint64_t nBytesToPrune;
3719  int count=0;
3720 
3721  if (nCurrentUsage + nBuffer >= nPruneTarget) {
3722  // On a prune event, the chainstate DB is flushed.
3723  // To avoid excessive prune events negating the benefit of high dbcache
3724  // values, we should not prune too rapidly.
3725  // So when pruning in IBD, increase the buffer a bit to avoid a re-prune too soon.
3726  if (IsInitialBlockDownload()) {
3727  // Since this is only relevant during IBD, we use a fixed 10%
3728  nBuffer += nPruneTarget / 10;
3729  }
3730 
3731  for (int fileNumber = 0; fileNumber < nLastBlockFile; fileNumber++) {
3732  nBytesToPrune = vinfoBlockFile[fileNumber].nSize + vinfoBlockFile[fileNumber].nUndoSize;
3733 
3734  if (vinfoBlockFile[fileNumber].nSize == 0)
3735  continue;
3736 
3737  if (nCurrentUsage + nBuffer < nPruneTarget) // are we below our target?
3738  break;
3739 
3740  // don't prune files that could have a block within MIN_BLOCKS_TO_KEEP of the main chain's tip but keep scanning
3741  if (vinfoBlockFile[fileNumber].nHeightLast > nLastBlockWeCanPrune)
3742  continue;
3743 
3744  PruneOneBlockFile(fileNumber);
3745  // Queue up the files for removal
3746  setFilesToPrune.insert(fileNumber);
3747  nCurrentUsage -= nBytesToPrune;
3748  count++;
3749  }
3750  }
3751 
3752  LogPrint(BCLog::PRUNE, "Prune: target=%dMiB actual=%dMiB diff=%dMiB max_prune_height=%d removed %d blk/rev pairs\n",
3753  nPruneTarget/1024/1024, nCurrentUsage/1024/1024,
3754  ((int64_t)nPruneTarget - (int64_t)nCurrentUsage)/1024/1024,
3755  nLastBlockWeCanPrune, count);
3756 }
3757 
3758 bool CheckDiskSpace(uint64_t nAdditionalBytes, bool blocks_dir)
3759 {
3760  uint64_t nFreeBytesAvailable = fs::space(blocks_dir ? GetBlocksDir() : GetDataDir()).available;
3761 
3762  // Check for nMinDiskSpace bytes (currently 50MB)
3763  if (nFreeBytesAvailable < nMinDiskSpace + nAdditionalBytes)
3764  return AbortNode("Disk space is low!", _("Error: Disk space is low!"));
3765 
3766  return true;
3767 }

3769 static FILE* OpenDiskFile(const CDiskBlockPos &pos, const char *prefix, bool fReadOnly)
3770 {
3771  if (pos.IsNull())
3772  return nullptr;
3773  fs::path path = GetBlockPosFilename(pos, prefix);
3774  fs::create_directories(path.parent_path());
3775  FILE* file = fsbridge::fopen(path, fReadOnly ? "rb": "rb+");
3776  if (!file && !fReadOnly)
3777  file = fsbridge::fopen(path, "wb+");
3778  if (!file) {
3779  LogPrintf("Unable to open file %s\n", path.string());
3780  return nullptr;
3781  }
3782  if (pos.nPos) {
3783  if (fseek(file, pos.nPos, SEEK_SET)) {
3784  LogPrintf("Unable to seek to position %u of %s\n", pos.nPos, path.string());
3785  fclose(file);
3786  return nullptr;
3787  }
3788  }
3789  return file;
3790 }

3793  return OpenDiskFile(pos, "blk", fReadOnly);
3794 }

3798  return OpenDiskFile(pos, "rev", fReadOnly);

3802 {

3806 CBlockIndex * CChainState::InsertBlockIndex(const uint256& hash)
3807 {
3808  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
3809 
3810  if (hash.IsNull())
3811  return nullptr;
3812 
3813  // Return existing
3814  BlockMap::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(hash);
3815  if (mi != mapBlockIndex.end())
3816  return (*mi).second;
3817 
3818  // Create new
3819  CBlockIndex* pindexNew = new CBlockIndex();
3820  mi = mapBlockIndex.insert(std::make_pair(hash, pindexNew)).first;
3821  pindexNew->phashBlock = &((*mi).first);
3822 
3823  return pindexNew;
3824 }
3825 
3826 bool CChainState::LoadBlockIndex(const Consensus::Params& consensus_params, CBlockTreeDB& blocktree)
3827 {
3828  if (!blocktree.LoadBlockIndexGuts(consensus_params, [this](const uint256& hash) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main) { return this->InsertBlockIndex(hash); }))
3829  return false;
3830 
3831  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
3832 
3833  // Calculate nChainWork
3834  std::vector<std::pair<int, CBlockIndex*> > vSortedByHeight;
3835  vSortedByHeight.reserve(mapBlockIndex.size());
3836  for (const std::pair<const uint256, CBlockIndex*>& item : mapBlockIndex)
3837  {
3838  CBlockIndex* pindex = item.second;
3839  vSortedByHeight.push_back(std::make_pair(pindex->nHeight, pindex));
3840  }
3841  sort(vSortedByHeight.begin(), vSortedByHeight.end());
3842  for (const std::pair<int, CBlockIndex*>& item : vSortedByHeight)
3843  {
3844  CBlockIndex* pindex = item.second;
3845  pindex->nChainWork = (pindex->pprev ? pindex->pprev->nChainWork : 0) + GetBlockProof(*pindex);
3846  pindex->nTimeMax = (pindex->pprev ? std::max(pindex->pprev->nTimeMax, pindex->nTime) : pindex->nTime);
3847  // We can link the chain of blocks for which we've received transactions at some point.
3848  // Pruned nodes may have deleted the block.
3849  if (pindex->nTx > 0) {
3850  if (pindex->pprev) {
3851  if (pindex->pprev->nChainTx) {
3852  pindex->nChainTx = pindex->pprev->nChainTx + pindex->nTx;
3853  } else {
3854  pindex->nChainTx = 0;
3855  mapBlocksUnlinked.insert(std::make_pair(pindex->pprev, pindex));
3856  }
3857  } else {
3858  pindex->nChainTx = pindex->nTx;
3859  }
3860  }
3861  if (!(pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_MASK) && pindex->pprev && (pindex->pprev->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_MASK)) {
3862  pindex->nStatus |= BLOCK_FAILED_CHILD;
3863  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindex);
3864  }
3865  if (pindex->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS) && (pindex->nChainTx || pindex->pprev == nullptr))
3866  setBlockIndexCandidates.insert(pindex);
3867  if (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_MASK && (!pindexBestInvalid || pindex->nChainWork > pindexBestInvalid->nChainWork))
3868  pindexBestInvalid = pindex;
3869  if (pindex->pprev)
3870  pindex->BuildSkip();
3871  if (pindex->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_TREE) && (pindexBestHeader == nullptr || CBlockIndexWorkComparator()(pindexBestHeader, pindex)))
3872  pindexBestHeader = pindex;
3873  }
3874 
3875  return true;
3876 }

3878 bool static LoadBlockIndexDB(const CChainParams& chainparams) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)
3879 {
3880  if (!g_chainstate.LoadBlockIndex(chainparams.GetConsensus(), *pblocktree))
3881  return false;
3882 
3883  // Load block file info
3884  pblocktree->ReadLastBlockFile(nLastBlockFile);
3885  vinfoBlockFile.resize(nLastBlockFile + 1);
3886  LogPrintf("%s: last block file = %i\n", __func__, nLastBlockFile);
3887  for (int nFile = 0; nFile <= nLastBlockFile; nFile++) {
3888  pblocktree->ReadBlockFileInfo(nFile, vinfoBlockFile[nFile]);
3889  }
3890  LogPrintf("%s: last block file info: %s\n", __func__, vinfoBlockFile[nLastBlockFile].ToString());
3891  for (int nFile = nLastBlockFile + 1; true; nFile++) {
3892  CBlockFileInfo info;
3893  if (pblocktree->ReadBlockFileInfo(nFile, info)) {
3894  vinfoBlockFile.push_back(info);
3895  } else {
3896  break;
3897  }
3898  }
3899 
3900  // Check presence of blk files
3901  LogPrintf("Checking all blk files are present...\n");
3902  std::set<int> setBlkDataFiles;
3903  for (const std::pair<const uint256, CBlockIndex*>& item : mapBlockIndex)
3904  {
3905  CBlockIndex* pindex = item.second;
3906  if (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA) {
3907  setBlkDataFiles.insert(pindex->nFile);
3908  }
3909  }
3910  for (std::set<int>::iterator it = setBlkDataFiles.begin(); it != setBlkDataFiles.end(); it++)
3911  {
3912  CDiskBlockPos pos(*it, 0);
3913  if (CAutoFile(OpenBlockFile(pos, true), SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION).IsNull()) {
3914  return false;
3915  }
3916  }
3917 
3918  // Check whether we have ever pruned block & undo files
3919  pblocktree->ReadFlag("prunedblockfiles", fHavePruned);
3920  if (fHavePruned)
3921  LogPrintf("LoadBlockIndexDB(): Block files have previously been pruned\n");
3922 
3923  // Check whether we need to continue reindexing
3924  bool fReindexing = false;
3925  pblocktree->ReadReindexing(fReindexing);
3926  if(fReindexing) fReindex = true;
3927 
3928  return true;
3929 }

3931 bool LoadChainTip(const CChainParams& chainparams)
3932 {
3933  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
3934 
3935  if (chainActive.Tip() && chainActive.Tip()->GetBlockHash() == pcoinsTip->GetBestBlock()) return true;
3936 
3937  if (pcoinsTip->GetBestBlock().IsNull() && mapBlockIndex.size() == 1) {
3938  // In case we just added the genesis block, connect it now, so
3939  // that we always have a chainActive.Tip() when we return.
3940  LogPrintf("%s: Connecting genesis block...\n", __func__);
3941  CValidationState state;
3942  if (!ActivateBestChain(state, chainparams)) {
3943  LogPrintf("%s: failed to activate chain (%s)\n", __func__, FormatStateMessage(state));
3944  return false;
3945  }
3946  }
3947 
3948  // Load pointer to end of best chain
3949  CBlockIndex* pindex = LookupBlockIndex(pcoinsTip->GetBestBlock());
3950  if (!pindex) {
3951  return false;
3952  }
3953  chainActive.SetTip(pindex);
3954 
3955  g_chainstate.PruneBlockIndexCandidates();
3956 
3957  LogPrintf("Loaded best chain: hashBestChain=%s height=%d date=%s progress=%f\n",
3958  chainActive.Tip()->GetBlockHash().ToString(), chainActive.Height(),
3959  FormatISO8601DateTime(chainActive.Tip()->GetBlockTime()),
3960  GuessVerificationProgress(chainparams.TxData(), chainActive.Tip()));
3961  return true;
3962 }

3974 bool CVerifyDB::VerifyDB(const CChainParams& chainparams, CCoinsView *coinsview, int nCheckLevel, int nCheckDepth)
3975 {
3976  LOCK(cs_main);
3977  if (chainActive.Tip() == nullptr || chainActive.Tip()->pprev == nullptr)
3978  return true;
3979 
3980  // Verify blocks in the best chain
3981  if (nCheckDepth <= 0 || nCheckDepth > chainActive.Height())
3982  nCheckDepth = chainActive.Height();
3983  nCheckLevel = std::max(0, std::min(4, nCheckLevel));
3984  LogPrintf("Verifying last %i blocks at level %i\n", nCheckDepth, nCheckLevel);
3985  CCoinsViewCache coins(coinsview);
3986  CBlockIndex* pindex;
3987  CBlockIndex* pindexFailure = nullptr;
3988  int nGoodTransactions = 0;
3989  CValidationState state;
3990  int reportDone = 0;
3991  LogPrintf("[0%%]..."); /* Continued */
3992  for (pindex = chainActive.Tip(); pindex && pindex->pprev; pindex = pindex->pprev) {
3993  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
3994  int percentageDone = std::max(1, std::min(99, (int)(((double)(chainActive.Height() - pindex->nHeight)) / (double)nCheckDepth * (nCheckLevel >= 4 ? 50 : 100))));
3995  if (reportDone < percentageDone/10) {
3996  // report every 10% step
3997  LogPrintf("[%d%%]...", percentageDone); /* Continued */
3998  reportDone = percentageDone/10;
3999  }
4000  uiInterface.ShowProgress(_("Verifying blocks..."), percentageDone, false);
4001  if (pindex->nHeight <= chainActive.Height()-nCheckDepth)
4002  break;
4003  if (fPruneMode && !(pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA)) {
4004  // If pruning, only go back as far as we have data.
4005  LogPrintf("VerifyDB(): block verification stopping at height %d (pruning, no data)\n", pindex->nHeight);
4006  break;
4007  }
4008  CBlock block;
4009  // check level 0: read from disk
4010  if (!ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pindex, chainparams.GetConsensus()))
4011  return error("VerifyDB(): *** ReadBlockFromDisk failed at %d, hash=%s", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString());
4012  // check level 1: verify block validity
4013  if (nCheckLevel >= 1 && !CheckBlock(block, state, chainparams.GetConsensus()))
4014  return error("%s: *** found bad block at %d, hash=%s (%s)\n", __func__,
4015  pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString(), FormatStateMessage(state));
4016  // check level 2: verify undo validity
4017  if (nCheckLevel >= 2 && pindex) {
4018  CBlockUndo undo;
4019  if (!pindex->GetUndoPos().IsNull()) {
4020  if (!UndoReadFromDisk(undo, pindex)) {
4021  return error("VerifyDB(): *** found bad undo data at %d, hash=%s\n", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString());
4022  }
4023  }
4024  }
4025  // check level 3: check for inconsistencies during memory-only disconnect of tip blocks
4026  if (nCheckLevel >= 3 && (coins.DynamicMemoryUsage() + pcoinsTip->DynamicMemoryUsage()) <= nCoinCacheUsage) {
4027  assert(coins.GetBestBlock() == pindex->GetBlockHash());
4028  DisconnectResult res = g_chainstate.DisconnectBlock(block, pindex, coins);
4029  if (res == DISCONNECT_FAILED) {
4030  return error("VerifyDB(): *** irrecoverable inconsistency in block data at %d, hash=%s", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString());
4031  }
4032  if (res == DISCONNECT_UNCLEAN) {
4033  nGoodTransactions = 0;
4034  pindexFailure = pindex;
4035  } else {
4036  nGoodTransactions += block.vtx.size();
4037  }
4038  }
4039  if (ShutdownRequested())
4040  return true;
4041  }
4042  if (pindexFailure)
4043  return error("VerifyDB(): *** coin database inconsistencies found (last %i blocks, %i good transactions before that)\n", chainActive.Height() - pindexFailure->nHeight + 1, nGoodTransactions);
4044 
4045  // store block count as we move pindex at check level >= 4
4046  int block_count = chainActive.Height() - pindex->nHeight;
4047 
4048  // check level 4: try reconnecting blocks
4049  if (nCheckLevel >= 4) {
4050  while (pindex != chainActive.Tip()) {
4051  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
4052  uiInterface.ShowProgress(_("Verifying blocks..."), std::max(1, std::min(99, 100 - (int)(((double)(chainActive.Height() - pindex->nHeight)) / (double)nCheckDepth * 50))), false);
4053  pindex = chainActive.Next(pindex);
4054  CBlock block;
4055  if (!ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pindex, chainparams.GetConsensus()))
4056  return error("VerifyDB(): *** ReadBlockFromDisk failed at %d, hash=%s", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString());
4057  if (!g_chainstate.ConnectBlock(block, state, pindex, coins, chainparams))
4058  return error("VerifyDB(): *** found unconnectable block at %d, hash=%s (%s)", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString(), FormatStateMessage(state));
4059  }
4060  }
4061 
4062  LogPrintf("[DONE].\n");
4063  LogPrintf("No coin database inconsistencies in last %i blocks (%i transactions)\n", block_count, nGoodTransactions);
4064 
4065  return true;
4066 }
4067 
4069 bool CChainState::RollforwardBlock(const CBlockIndex* pindex, CCoinsViewCache& inputs, const CChainParams& params)
4070 {
4071  // TODO: merge with ConnectBlock
4072  CBlock block;
4073  if (!ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pindex, params.GetConsensus())) {
4074  return error("ReplayBlock(): ReadBlockFromDisk failed at %d, hash=%s", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString());
4075  }
4076 
4077  for (const CTransactionRef& tx : block.vtx) {
4078  if (!tx->IsCoinBase()) {
4079  for (const CTxIn &txin : tx->vin) {
4080  inputs.SpendCoin(txin.prevout);
4081  }
4082  }
4083  // Pass check = true as every addition may be an overwrite.
4084  AddCoins(inputs, *tx, pindex->nHeight, true);
4085  }
4086  return true;
4087 }
4088 
4089 bool CChainState::ReplayBlocks(const CChainParams& params, CCoinsView* view)
4090 {
4091  LOCK(cs_main);
4092 
4093  CCoinsViewCache cache(view);
4094 
4095  std::vector<uint256> hashHeads = view->GetHeadBlocks();
4096  if (hashHeads.empty()) return true; // We're already in a consistent state.
4097  if (hashHeads.size() != 2) return error("ReplayBlocks(): unknown inconsistent state");
4098 
4099  uiInterface.ShowProgress(_("Replaying blocks..."), 0, false);
4100  LogPrintf("Replaying blocks\n");
4101 
4102  const CBlockIndex* pindexOld = nullptr; // Old tip during the interrupted flush.
4103  const CBlockIndex* pindexNew; // New tip during the interrupted flush.
4104  const CBlockIndex* pindexFork = nullptr; // Latest block common to both the old and the new tip.
4105 
4106  if (mapBlockIndex.count(hashHeads[0]) == 0) {
4107  return error("ReplayBlocks(): reorganization to unknown block requested");
4108  }
4109  pindexNew = mapBlockIndex[hashHeads[0]];
4110 
4111  if (!hashHeads[1].IsNull()) { // The old tip is allowed to be 0, indicating it's the first flush.
4112  if (mapBlockIndex.count(hashHeads[1]) == 0) {
4113  return error("ReplayBlocks(): reorganization from unknown block requested");
4114  }
4115  pindexOld = mapBlockIndex[hashHeads[1]];
4116  pindexFork = LastCommonAncestor(pindexOld, pindexNew);
4117  assert(pindexFork != nullptr);
4118  }
4119 
4120  // Rollback along the old branch.
4121  while (pindexOld != pindexFork) {
4122  if (pindexOld->nHeight > 0) { // Never disconnect the genesis block.
4123  CBlock block;
4124  if (!ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pindexOld, params.GetConsensus())) {
4125  return error("RollbackBlock(): ReadBlockFromDisk() failed at %d, hash=%s", pindexOld->nHeight, pindexOld->GetBlockHash().ToString());
4126  }
4127  LogPrintf("Rolling back %s (%i)\n", pindexOld->GetBlockHash().ToString(), pindexOld->nHeight);
4128  DisconnectResult res = DisconnectBlock(block, pindexOld, cache);
4129  if (res == DISCONNECT_FAILED) {
4130  return error("RollbackBlock(): DisconnectBlock failed at %d, hash=%s", pindexOld->nHeight, pindexOld->GetBlockHash().ToString());
4131  }
4132  // If DISCONNECT_UNCLEAN is returned, it means a non-existing UTXO was deleted, or an existing UTXO was
4133  // overwritten. It corresponds to cases where the block-to-be-disconnect never had all its operations
4134  // applied to the UTXO set. However, as both writing a UTXO and deleting a UTXO are idempotent operations,
4135  // the result is still a version of the UTXO set with the effects of that block undone.
4136  }
4137  pindexOld = pindexOld->pprev;
4138  }
4139 
4140  // Roll forward from the forking point to the new tip.
4141  int nForkHeight = pindexFork ? pindexFork->nHeight : 0;
4142  for (int nHeight = nForkHeight + 1; nHeight <= pindexNew->nHeight; ++nHeight) {
4143  const CBlockIndex* pindex = pindexNew->GetAncestor(nHeight);
4144  LogPrintf("Rolling forward %s (%i)\n", pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString(), nHeight);
4145  if (!RollforwardBlock(pindex, cache, params)) return false;
4146  }
4147 
4148  cache.SetBestBlock(pindexNew->GetBlockHash());
4149  cache.Flush();
4150  uiInterface.ShowProgress("", 100, false);
4151  return true;
4152 }
4153 
4154 bool ReplayBlocks(const CChainParams& params, CCoinsView* view) {
4155  return g_chainstate.ReplayBlocks(params, view);
4156 }
4157 
4158 bool CChainState::RewindBlockIndex(const CChainParams& params)
4159 {
4160  LOCK(cs_main);
4161 
4162  // Note that during -reindex-chainstate we are called with an empty chainActive!
4163 
4164  int nHeight = 1;
4165  while (nHeight <= chainActive.Height()) {
4166  // Although SCRIPT_VERIFY_WITNESS is now generally enforced on all
4167  // blocks in ConnectBlock, we don't need to go back and
4168  // re-download/re-verify blocks from before segwit actually activated.
4169  if (IsWitnessEnabled(chainActive[nHeight - 1], params.GetConsensus()) && !(chainActive[nHeight]->nStatus & BLOCK_OPT_WITNESS)) {
4170  break;
4171  }
4172  nHeight++;
4173  }
4174 
4175  // nHeight is now the height of the first insufficiently-validated block, or tipheight + 1
4176  CValidationState state;
4177  CBlockIndex* pindex = chainActive.Tip();
4178  while (chainActive.Height() >= nHeight) {
4179  if (fPruneMode && !(chainActive.Tip()->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA)) {
4180  // If pruning, don't try rewinding past the HAVE_DATA point;
4181  // since older blocks can't be served anyway, there's
4182  // no need to walk further, and trying to DisconnectTip()
4183  // will fail (and require a needless reindex/redownload
4184  // of the blockchain).
4185  break;
4186  }
4187  if (!DisconnectTip(state, params, nullptr)) {
4188  return error("RewindBlockIndex: unable to disconnect block at height %i (%s)", pindex->nHeight, FormatStateMessage(state));
4189  }
4190  // Occasionally flush state to disk.
4191  if (!FlushStateToDisk(params, state, FlushStateMode::PERIODIC)) {
4192  LogPrintf("RewindBlockIndex: unable to flush state to disk (%s)\n", FormatStateMessage(state));
4193  return false;
4194  }
4195  }
4196 
4197  // Reduce validity flag and have-data flags.
4198  // We do this after actual disconnecting, otherwise we'll end up writing the lack of data
4199  // to disk before writing the chainstate, resulting in a failure to continue if interrupted.
4200  for (const auto& entry : mapBlockIndex) {
4201  CBlockIndex* pindexIter = entry.second;
4202 
4203  // Note: If we encounter an insufficiently validated block that
4204  // is on chainActive, it must be because we are a pruning node, and
4205  // this block or some successor doesn't HAVE_DATA, so we were unable to
4206  // rewind all the way. Blocks remaining on chainActive at this point
4207  // must not have their validity reduced.
4208  if (IsWitnessEnabled(pindexIter->pprev, params.GetConsensus()) && !(pindexIter->nStatus & BLOCK_OPT_WITNESS) && !chainActive.Contains(pindexIter)) {
4209  // Reduce validity
4210  pindexIter->nStatus = std::min<unsigned int>(pindexIter->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK, BLOCK_VALID_TREE) | (pindexIter->nStatus & ~BLOCK_VALID_MASK);
4211  // Remove have-data flags.
4212  pindexIter->nStatus &= ~(BLOCK_HAVE_DATA | BLOCK_HAVE_UNDO);
4213  // Remove storage location.
4214  pindexIter->nFile = 0;
4215  pindexIter->nDataPos = 0;
4216  pindexIter->nUndoPos = 0;
4217  // Remove various other things
4218  pindexIter->nTx = 0;
4219  pindexIter->nChainTx = 0;
4220  pindexIter->nSequenceId = 0;
4221  // Make sure it gets written.
4222  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindexIter);
4223  // Update indexes
4224  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(pindexIter);
4225  std::pair<std::multimap<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndex*>::iterator, std::multimap<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndex*>::iterator> ret = mapBlocksUnlinked.equal_range(pindexIter->pprev);
4226  while (ret.first != ret.second) {
4227  if (ret.first->second == pindexIter) {
4228  mapBlocksUnlinked.erase(ret.first++);
4229  } else {
4230  ++ret.first;
4231  }
4232  }
4233  } else if (pindexIter->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS) && pindexIter->nChainTx) {
4234  setBlockIndexCandidates.insert(pindexIter);
4235  }
4236  }
4237 
4238  if (chainActive.Tip() != nullptr) {
4239  // We can't prune block index candidates based on our tip if we have
4240  // no tip due to chainActive being empty!
4241  PruneBlockIndexCandidates();
4242 
4243  CheckBlockIndex(params.GetConsensus());
4244  }
4245 
4246  return true;
4247 }
4248 
4249 bool RewindBlockIndex(const CChainParams& params) {
4250  if (!g_chainstate.RewindBlockIndex(params)) {
4251  return false;
4252  }
4253 
4254  if (chainActive.Tip() != nullptr) {
4255  // FlushStateToDisk can possibly read chainActive. Be conservative
4256  // and skip it here, we're about to -reindex-chainstate anyway, so
4257  // it'll get called a bunch real soon.
4258  CValidationState state;
4259  if (!FlushStateToDisk(params, state, FlushStateMode::ALWAYS)) {
4260  LogPrintf("RewindBlockIndex: unable to flush state to disk (%s)\n", FormatStateMessage(state));
4261  return false;
4262  }
4263  }
4264 
4265  return true;
4266 }
4267 
4268 void CChainState::UnloadBlockIndex() {
4269  nBlockSequenceId = 1;
4270  m_failed_blocks.clear();
4271  setBlockIndexCandidates.clear();
4272 }
4273 
4274 // May NOT be used after any connections are up as much
4275 // of the peer-processing logic assumes a consistent
4276 // block index state
4277 void UnloadBlockIndex()
4278 {
4279  LOCK(cs_main);
4280  chainActive.SetTip(nullptr);
4281  pindexBestInvalid = nullptr;
4282  pindexBestHeader = nullptr;
4283  mempool.clear();
4284  mapBlocksUnlinked.clear();
4285  vinfoBlockFile.clear();
4286  nLastBlockFile = 0;
4287  setDirtyBlockIndex.clear();
4288  setDirtyFileInfo.clear();
4289  versionbitscache.Clear();
4290  for (int b = 0; b < VERSIONBITS_NUM_BITS; b++) {
4291  warningcache[b].clear();
4292  }
4293 
4294  for (BlockMap::value_type& entry : mapBlockIndex) {
4295  delete entry.second;
4296  }
4297  mapBlockIndex.clear();
4298  fHavePruned = false;
4299 
4300  g_chainstate.UnloadBlockIndex();
4301 }
4302 
4303 bool LoadBlockIndex(const CChainParams& chainparams)
4304 {
4305  // Load block index from databases
4306  bool needs_init = fReindex;
4307  if (!fReindex) {
4308  bool ret = LoadBlockIndexDB(chainparams);
4309  if (!ret) return false;
4310  needs_init = mapBlockIndex.empty();
4311  }
4312 
4313  if (needs_init) {
4314  // Everything here is for *new* reindex/DBs. Thus, though
4315  // LoadBlockIndexDB may have set fReindex if we shut down
4316  // mid-reindex previously, we don't check fReindex and
4317  // instead only check it prior to LoadBlockIndexDB to set
4318  // needs_init.
4319 
4320  LogPrintf("Initializing databases...\n");
4321  }
4322  return true;
4323 }
4324 
4325 bool CChainState::LoadGenesisBlock(const CChainParams& chainparams)
4326 {
4327  LOCK(cs_main);
4328 
4329  // Check whether we're already initialized by checking for genesis in
4330  // mapBlockIndex. Note that we can't use chainActive here, since it is
4331  // set based on the coins db, not the block index db, which is the only
4332  // thing loaded at this point.
4333  if (mapBlockIndex.count(chainparams.GenesisBlock().GetHash()))
4334  return true;
4335 
4336  try {
4337  CBlock &block = const_cast<CBlock&>(chainparams.GenesisBlock());
4338  CDiskBlockPos blockPos = SaveBlockToDisk(block, 0, chainparams, nullptr);
4339  if (blockPos.IsNull())
4340  return error("%s: writing genesis block to disk failed", __func__);
4341  CBlockIndex *pindex = AddToBlockIndex(block);
4342  ReceivedBlockTransactions(block, pindex, blockPos, chainparams.GetConsensus());
4343  } catch (const std::runtime_error& e) {
4344  return error("%s: failed to write genesis block: %s", __func__, e.what());
4345  }
4346 
4347  return true;
4348 }
4349 
4350 bool LoadGenesisBlock(const CChainParams& chainparams)
4351 {
4352  return g_chainstate.LoadGenesisBlock(chainparams);
4353 }
4354 
4355 bool LoadExternalBlockFile(const CChainParams& chainparams, FILE* fileIn, CDiskBlockPos *dbp)
4356 {
4357  // Map of disk positions for blocks with unknown parent (only used for reindex)
4358  static std::multimap<uint256, CDiskBlockPos> mapBlocksUnknownParent;
4359  int64_t nStart = GetTimeMillis();
4360 
4361  int nLoaded = 0;
4362  try {
4363  // This takes over fileIn and calls fclose() on it in the CBufferedFile destructor
4364  CBufferedFile blkdat(fileIn, 2*MAX_BLOCK_SERIALIZED_SIZE, MAX_BLOCK_SERIALIZED_SIZE+8, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
4365  uint64_t nRewind = blkdat.GetPos();
4366  while (!blkdat.eof()) {
4367  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
4368 
4369  blkdat.SetPos(nRewind);
4370  nRewind++; // start one byte further next time, in case of failure
4371  blkdat.SetLimit(); // remove former limit
4372  unsigned int nSize = 0;
4373  try {
4374  // locate a header
4375  unsigned char buf[CMessageHeader::MESSAGE_START_SIZE];
4376  blkdat.FindByte(chainparams.MessageStart()[0]);
4377  nRewind = blkdat.GetPos()+1;
4378  blkdat >> buf;
4379  if (memcmp(buf, chainparams.MessageStart(), CMessageHeader::MESSAGE_START_SIZE))
4380  continue;
4381  // read size
4382  blkdat >> nSize;
4383  if (nSize < 80 || nSize > MAX_BLOCK_SERIALIZED_SIZE)
4384  continue;
4385  } catch (const std::exception&) {
4386  // no valid block header found; don't complain
4387  break;
4388  }
4389  try {
4390  // read block
4391  uint64_t nBlockPos = blkdat.GetPos();
4392  if (dbp)
4393  dbp->nPos = nBlockPos;
4394  blkdat.SetLimit(nBlockPos + nSize);
4395  blkdat.SetPos(nBlockPos);
4396  std::shared_ptr<CBlock> pblock = std::make_shared<CBlock>();
4397  CBlock& block = *pblock;
4398  blkdat >> block;
4399  nRewind = blkdat.GetPos();
4400 
4401  uint256 hash = block.GetHash();
4402  {
4403  LOCK(cs_main);
4404  // detect out of order blocks, and store them for later
4405  if (hash != chainparams.GetConsensus().hashGenesisBlock && !LookupBlockIndex(block.hashPrevBlock)) {
4406  LogPrint(BCLog::REINDEX, "%s: Out of order block %s, parent %s not known\n", __func__, hash.ToString(),
4407  block.hashPrevBlock.ToString());
4408  if (dbp)
4409  mapBlocksUnknownParent.insert(std::make_pair(block.hashPrevBlock, *dbp));
4410  continue;
4411  }
4412 
4413  // process in case the block isn't known yet
4414  CBlockIndex* pindex = LookupBlockIndex(hash);
4415  if (!pindex || (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA) == 0) {
4416  CValidationState state;
4417  if (g_chainstate.AcceptBlock(pblock, state, chainparams, nullptr, true, dbp, nullptr)) {
4418  nLoaded++;
4419  }
4420  if (state.IsError()) {
4421  break;
4422  }
4423  } else if (hash != chainparams.GetConsensus().hashGenesisBlock && pindex->nHeight % 1000 == 0) {
4424  LogPrint(BCLog::REINDEX, "Block Import: already had block %s at height %d\n", hash.ToString(), pindex->nHeight);
4425  }
4426  }
4427 
4428  // Activate the genesis block so normal node progress can continue
4429  if (hash == chainparams.GetConsensus().hashGenesisBlock) {
4430  CValidationState state;
4431  if (!ActivateBestChain(state, chainparams)) {
4432  break;
4433  }
4434  }
4435 
4436  NotifyHeaderTip();
4437 
4438  // Recursively process earlier encountered successors of this block
4439  std::deque<uint256> queue;
4440  queue.push_back(hash);
4441  while (!queue.empty()) {
4442  uint256 head = queue.front();
4443  queue.pop_front();
4444  std::pair<std::multimap<uint256, CDiskBlockPos>::iterator, std::multimap<uint256, CDiskBlockPos>::iterator> range = mapBlocksUnknownParent.equal_range(head);
4445  while (range.first != range.second) {
4446  std::multimap<uint256, CDiskBlockPos>::iterator it = range.first;
4447  std::shared_ptr<CBlock> pblockrecursive = std::make_shared<CBlock>();
4448  if (ReadBlockFromDisk(*pblockrecursive, it->second, chainparams.GetConsensus()))
4449  {
4450  LogPrint(BCLog::REINDEX, "%s: Processing out of order child %s of %s\n", __func__, pblockrecursive->GetHash().ToString(),
4451  head.ToString());
4452  LOCK(cs_main);
4453  CValidationState dummy;
4454  if (g_chainstate.AcceptBlock(pblockrecursive, dummy, chainparams, nullptr, true, &it->second, nullptr))
4455  {
4456  nLoaded++;
4457  queue.push_back(pblockrecursive->GetHash());
4458  }
4459  }
4460  range.first++;
4461  mapBlocksUnknownParent.erase(it);
4462  NotifyHeaderTip();
4463  }
4464  }
4465  } catch (const std::exception& e) {
4466  LogPrintf("%s: Deserialize or I/O error - %s\n", __func__, e.what());
4467  }
4468  }
4469  } catch (const std::runtime_error& e) {
4470  AbortNode(std::string("System error: ") + e.what());
4471  }
4472  if (nLoaded > 0)
4473  LogPrintf("Loaded %i blocks from external file in %dms\n", nLoaded, GetTimeMillis() - nStart);
4474  return nLoaded > 0;
4475 }
4476 
4477 void CChainState::CheckBlockIndex(const Consensus::Params& consensusParams)
4478 {
4479  if (!fCheckBlockIndex) {
4480  return;
4481  }
4482 
4483  LOCK(cs_main);
4484 
4485  // During a reindex, we read the genesis block and call CheckBlockIndex before ActivateBestChain,
4486  // so we have the genesis block in mapBlockIndex but no active chain. (A few of the tests when
4487  // iterating the block tree require that chainActive has been initialized.)
4488  if (chainActive.Height() < 0) {
4489  assert(mapBlockIndex.size() <= 1);
4490  return;
4491  }
4492 
4493  // Build forward-pointing map of the entire block tree.
4494  std::multimap<CBlockIndex*,CBlockIndex*> forward;
4495  for (auto& entry : mapBlockIndex) {
4496  forward.insert(std::make_pair(entry.second->pprev, entry.second));
4497  }
4498 
4499  assert(forward.size() == mapBlockIndex.size());
4500 
4501  std::pair<std::multimap<CBlockIndex*,CBlockIndex*>::iterator,std::multimap<CBlockIndex*,CBlockIndex*>::iterator> rangeGenesis = forward.equal_range(nullptr);
4502  CBlockIndex *pindex = rangeGenesis.first->second;
4503  rangeGenesis.first++;
4504  assert(rangeGenesis.first == rangeGenesis.second); // There is only one index entry with parent nullptr.
4505 
4506  // Iterate over the entire block tree, using depth-first search.
4507  // Along the way, remember whether there are blocks on the path from genesis
4508  // block being explored which are the first to have certain properties.
4509  size_t nNodes = 0;
4510  int nHeight = 0;
4511  CBlockIndex* pindexFirstInvalid = nullptr; // Oldest ancestor of pindex which is invalid.
4512  CBlockIndex* pindexFirstMissing = nullptr; // Oldest ancestor of pindex which does not have BLOCK_HAVE_DATA.
4513  CBlockIndex* pindexFirstNeverProcessed = nullptr; // Oldest ancestor of pindex for which nTx == 0.
4514  CBlockIndex* pindexFirstNotTreeValid = nullptr; // Oldest ancestor of pindex which does not have BLOCK_VALID_TREE (regardless of being valid or not).
4515  CBlockIndex* pindexFirstNotTransactionsValid = nullptr; // Oldest ancestor of pindex which does not have BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS (regardless of being valid or not).
4516  CBlockIndex* pindexFirstNotChainValid = nullptr; // Oldest ancestor of pindex which does not have BLOCK_VALID_CHAIN (regardless of being valid or not).
4517  CBlockIndex* pindexFirstNotScriptsValid = nullptr; // Oldest ancestor of pindex which does not have BLOCK_VALID_SCRIPTS (regardless of being valid or not).
4518  while (pindex != nullptr) {
4519  nNodes++;
4520  if (pindexFirstInvalid == nullptr && pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_VALID) pindexFirstInvalid = pindex;
4521  if (pindexFirstMissing == nullptr && !(pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA)) pindexFirstMissing = pindex;
4522  if (pindexFirstNeverProcessed == nullptr && pindex->nTx == 0) pindexFirstNeverProcessed = pindex;
4523  if (pindex->pprev != nullptr && pindexFirstNotTreeValid == nullptr && (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK) < BLOCK_VALID_TREE) pindexFirstNotTreeValid = pindex;
4524  if (pindex->pprev != nullptr && pindexFirstNotTransactionsValid == nullptr && (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK) < BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS) pindexFirstNotTransactionsValid = pindex;
4525  if (pindex->pprev != nullptr && pindexFirstNotChainValid == nullptr && (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK) < BLOCK_VALID_CHAIN) pindexFirstNotChainValid = pindex;
4526  if (pindex->pprev != nullptr && pindexFirstNotScriptsValid == nullptr && (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK) < BLOCK_VALID_SCRIPTS) pindexFirstNotScriptsValid = pindex;
4527 
4528  // Begin: actual consistency checks.
4529  if (pindex->pprev == nullptr) {
4530  // Genesis block checks.
4531  assert(pindex->GetBlockHash() == consensusParams.hashGenesisBlock); // Genesis block's hash must match.
4532  assert(pindex == chainActive.Genesis()); // The current active chain's genesis block must be this block.
4533  }
4534  if (pindex->nChainTx == 0) assert(pindex->nSequenceId <= 0); // nSequenceId can't be set positive for blocks that aren't linked (negative is used for preciousblock)
4535  // VALID_TRANSACTIONS is equivalent to nTx > 0 for all nodes (whether or not pruning has occurred).
4536  // HAVE_DATA is only equivalent to nTx > 0 (or VALID_TRANSACTIONS) if no pruning has occurred.
4537  if (!fHavePruned) {
4538  // If we've never pruned, then HAVE_DATA should be equivalent to nTx > 0
4539  assert(!(pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA) == (pindex->nTx == 0));
4540  assert(pindexFirstMissing == pindexFirstNeverProcessed);
4541  } else {
4542  // If we have pruned, then we can only say that HAVE_DATA implies nTx > 0
4543  if (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA) assert(pindex->nTx > 0);
4544  }
4545  if (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_UNDO) assert(pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA);
4546  assert(((pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK) >= BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS) == (pindex->nTx > 0)); // This is pruning-independent.
4547  // All parents having had data (at some point) is equivalent to all parents being VALID_TRANSACTIONS, which is equivalent to nChainTx being set.
4548  assert((pindexFirstNeverProcessed != nullptr) == (pindex->nChainTx == 0)); // nChainTx != 0 is used to signal that all parent blocks have been processed (but may have been pruned).
4549  assert((pindexFirstNotTransactionsValid != nullptr) == (pindex->nChainTx == 0));
4550  assert(pindex->nHeight == nHeight); // nHeight must be consistent.
4551  assert(pindex->pprev == nullptr || pindex->nChainWork >= pindex->pprev->nChainWork); // For every block except the genesis block, the chainwork must be larger than the parent's.
4552  assert(nHeight < 2 || (pindex->pskip && (pindex->pskip->nHeight < nHeight))); // The pskip pointer must point back for all but the first 2 blocks.
4553  assert(pindexFirstNotTreeValid == nullptr); // All mapBlockIndex entries must at least be TREE valid
4554  if ((pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK) >= BLOCK_VALID_TREE) assert(pindexFirstNotTreeValid == nullptr); // TREE valid implies all parents are TREE valid
4555  if ((pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK) >= BLOCK_VALID_CHAIN) assert(pindexFirstNotChainValid == nullptr); // CHAIN valid implies all parents are CHAIN valid
4556  if ((pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_VALID_MASK) >= BLOCK_VALID_SCRIPTS) assert(pindexFirstNotScriptsValid == nullptr); // SCRIPTS valid implies all parents are SCRIPTS valid
4557  if (pindexFirstInvalid == nullptr) {
4558  // Checks for not-invalid blocks.
4559  assert((pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_MASK) == 0); // The failed mask cannot be set for blocks without invalid parents.
4560  }
4561  if (!CBlockIndexWorkComparator()(pindex, chainActive.Tip()) && pindexFirstNeverProcessed == nullptr) {
4562  if (pindexFirstInvalid == nullptr) {
4563  // If this block sorts at least as good as the current tip and
4564  // is valid and we have all data for its parents, it must be in
4565  // setBlockIndexCandidates. chainActive.Tip() must also be there
4566  // even if some data has been pruned.
4567  if (pindexFirstMissing == nullptr || pindex == chainActive.Tip()) {
4568  assert(setBlockIndexCandidates.count(pindex));
4569  }
4570  // If some parent is missing, then it could be that this block was in
4571  // setBlockIndexCandidates but had to be removed because of the missing data.
4572  // In this case it must be in mapBlocksUnlinked -- see test below.
4573  }
4574  } else { // If this block sorts worse than the current tip or some ancestor's block has never been seen, it cannot be in setBlockIndexCandidates.
4575  assert(setBlockIndexCandidates.count(pindex) == 0);
4576  }
4577  // Check whether this block is in mapBlocksUnlinked.
4578  std::pair<std::multimap<CBlockIndex*,CBlockIndex*>::iterator,std::multimap<CBlockIndex*,CBlockIndex*>::iterator> rangeUnlinked = mapBlocksUnlinked.equal_range(pindex->pprev);
4579  bool foundInUnlinked = false;
4580  while (rangeUnlinked.first != rangeUnlinked.second) {
4581  assert(rangeUnlinked.first->first == pindex->pprev);
4582  if (rangeUnlinked.first->second == pindex) {
4583  foundInUnlinked = true;
4584  break;
4585  }
4586  rangeUnlinked.first++;
4587  }
4588  if (pindex->pprev && (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA) && pindexFirstNeverProcessed != nullptr && pindexFirstInvalid == nullptr) {
4589  // If this block has block data available, some parent was never received, and has no invalid parents, it must be in mapBlocksUnlinked.
4590  assert(foundInUnlinked);
4591  }
4592  if (!(pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA)) assert(!foundInUnlinked); // Can't be in mapBlocksUnlinked if we don't HAVE_DATA
4593  if (pindexFirstMissing == nullptr) assert(!foundInUnlinked); // We aren't missing data for any parent -- cannot be in mapBlocksUnlinked.
4594  if (pindex->pprev && (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA) && pindexFirstNeverProcessed == nullptr && pindexFirstMissing != nullptr) {
4595  // We HAVE_DATA for this block, have received data for all parents at some point, but we're currently missing data for some parent.
4596  assert(fHavePruned); // We must have pruned.
4597  // This block may have entered mapBlocksUnlinked if:
4598  // - it has a descendant that at some point had more work than the
4599  // tip, and
4600  // - we tried switching to that descendant but were missing
4601  // data for some intermediate block between chainActive and the
4602  // tip.
4603  // So if this block is itself better than chainActive.Tip() and it wasn't in
4604  // setBlockIndexCandidates, then it must be in mapBlocksUnlinked.
4605  if (!CBlockIndexWorkComparator()(pindex, chainActive.Tip()) && setBlockIndexCandidates.count(pindex) == 0) {
4606  if (pindexFirstInvalid == nullptr) {
4607  assert(foundInUnlinked);
4608  }
4609  }
4610  }
4611  // assert(pindex->GetBlockHash() == pindex->GetBlockHeader().GetHash()); // Perhaps too slow
4612  // End: actual consistency checks.
4613 
4614  // Try descending into the first subnode.
4615  std::pair<std::multimap<CBlockIndex*,CBlockIndex*>::iterator,std::multimap<CBlockIndex*,CBlockIndex*>::iterator> range = forward.equal_range(pindex);
4616  if (range.first != range.second) {
4617  // A subnode was found.
4618  pindex = range.first->second;
4619  nHeight++;
4620  continue;
4621  }
4622  // This is a leaf node.
4623  // Move upwards until we reach a node of which we have not yet visited the last child.
4624  while (pindex) {
4625  // We are going to either move to a parent or a sibling of pindex.
4626  // If pindex was the first with a certain property, unset the corresponding variable.
4627  if (pindex == pindexFirstInvalid) pindexFirstInvalid = nullptr;
4628  if (pindex == pindexFirstMissing) pindexFirstMissing = nullptr;
4629  if (pindex == pindexFirstNeverProcessed) pindexFirstNeverProcessed = nullptr;
4630  if (pindex == pindexFirstNotTreeValid) pindexFirstNotTreeValid = nullptr;
4631  if (pindex == pindexFirstNotTransactionsValid) pindexFirstNotTransactionsValid = nullptr;
4632  if (pindex == pindexFirstNotChainValid) pindexFirstNotChainValid = nullptr;
4633  if (pindex == pindexFirstNotScriptsValid) pindexFirstNotScriptsValid = nullptr;
4634  // Find our parent.
4635  CBlockIndex* pindexPar = pindex->pprev;
4636  // Find which child we just visited.
4637  std::pair<std::multimap<CBlockIndex*,CBlockIndex*>::iterator,std::multimap<CBlockIndex*,CBlockIndex*>::iterator> rangePar = forward.equal_range(pindexPar);
4638  while (rangePar.first->second != pindex) {
4639  assert(rangePar.first != rangePar.second); // Our parent must have at least the node we're coming from as child.
4640  rangePar.first++;
4641  }
4642  // Proceed to the next one.
4643  rangePar.first++;
4644  if (rangePar.first != rangePar.second) {
4645  // Move to the sibling.
4646  pindex = rangePar.first->second;
4647  break;
4648  } else {
4649  // Move up further.
4650  pindex = pindexPar;
4651  nHeight--;
4652  continue;
4653  }
4654  }
4655  }
4656 
4657  // Check that we actually traversed the entire map.
4658  assert(nNodes == forward.size());
4659 }

4690 
4691 static const uint64_t MEMPOOL_DUMP_VERSION = 1;
4692 
4693 bool LoadMempool(void)
4694 {
4695  const CChainParams& chainparams = Params();
4696  int64_t nExpiryTimeout = gArgs.GetArg("-mempoolexpiry", DEFAULT_MEMPOOL_EXPIRY) * 60 * 60;
4697  FILE* filestr = fsbridge::fopen(GetDataDir() / "mempool.dat", "rb");
4698  CAutoFile file(filestr, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
4699  if (file.IsNull()) {
4700  LogPrintf("Failed to open mempool file from disk. Continuing anyway.\n");
4701  return false;
4702  }
4703 
4704  int64_t count = 0;
4705  int64_t expired = 0;
4706  int64_t failed = 0;
4707  int64_t already_there = 0;
4708  int64_t nNow = GetTime();
4709 
4710  try {
4711  uint64_t version;
4712  file >> version;
4713  if (version != MEMPOOL_DUMP_VERSION) {
4714  return false;
4715  }
4716  uint64_t num;
4717  file >> num;
4718  while (num--) {
4719  CTransactionRef tx;
4720  int64_t nTime;
4721  int64_t nFeeDelta;
4722  file >> tx;
4723  file >> nTime;
4724  file >> nFeeDelta;
4725 
4726  CAmount amountdelta = nFeeDelta;
4727  if (amountdelta) {
4728  mempool.PrioritiseTransaction(tx->GetHash(), amountdelta);
4729  }
4730  CValidationState state;
4731  if (nTime + nExpiryTimeout > nNow) {
4732  LOCK(cs_main);
4733  AcceptToMemoryPoolWithTime(chainparams, mempool, state, tx, nullptr /* pfMissingInputs */, nTime,
4734  nullptr /* plTxnReplaced */, false /* bypass_limits */, 0 /* nAbsurdFee */,
4735  false /* test_accept */);
4736  if (state.IsValid()) {
4737  ++count;
4738  } else {
4739  // mempool may contain the transaction already, e.g. from
4740  // wallet(s) having loaded it while we were processing
4741  // mempool transactions; consider these as valid, instead of
4742  // failed, but mark them as 'already there'
4743  if (mempool.exists(tx->GetHash())) {
4744  ++already_there;
4745  } else {
4746  ++failed;
4747  }
4748  }
4749  } else {
4750  ++expired;
4751  }
4752  if (ShutdownRequested())
4753  return false;
4754  }
4755  std::map<uint256, CAmount> mapDeltas;
4756  file >> mapDeltas;
4757 
4758  for (const auto& i : mapDeltas) {
4759  mempool.PrioritiseTransaction(i.first, i.second);
4760  }
4761  } catch (const std::exception& e) {
4762  LogPrintf("Failed to deserialize mempool data on disk: %s. Continuing anyway.\n", e.what());
4763  return false;
4764  }
4765 
4766  LogPrintf("Imported mempool transactions from disk: %i succeeded, %i failed, %i expired, %i already there\n", count, failed, expired, already_there);
4767  return true;
4768 }
4769 
4770 bool DumpMempool(void)
4771 {
4772  int64_t start = GetTimeMicros();
4773 
4774  std::map<uint256, CAmount> mapDeltas;
4775  std::vector<TxMempoolInfo> vinfo;
4776 
4777  {
4778  LOCK(mempool.cs);
4779  for (const auto &i : mempool.mapDeltas) {
4780  mapDeltas[i.first] = i.second;
4781  }
4782  vinfo = mempool.infoAll();
4783  }
4784 
4785  int64_t mid = GetTimeMicros();
4786 
4787  try {
4788  FILE* filestr = fsbridge::fopen(GetDataDir() / "mempool.dat.new", "wb");
4789  if (!filestr) {
4790  return false;
4791  }
4792 
4793  CAutoFile file(filestr, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
4794 
4795  uint64_t version = MEMPOOL_DUMP_VERSION;
4796  file << version;
4797 
4798  file << (uint64_t)vinfo.size();
4799  for (const auto& i : vinfo) {
4800  file << *(i.tx);
4801  file << (int64_t)i.nTime;
4802  file << (int64_t)i.nFeeDelta;
4803  mapDeltas.erase(i.tx->GetHash());
4804  }
4805 
4806  file << mapDeltas;
4807  if (!FileCommit(file.Get()))
4808  throw std::runtime_error("FileCommit failed");
4809  file.fclose();
4810  RenameOver(GetDataDir() / "mempool.dat.new", GetDataDir() / "mempool.dat");
4811  int64_t last = GetTimeMicros();
4812  LogPrintf("Dumped mempool: %gs to copy, %gs to dump\n", (mid-start)*MICRO, (last-mid)*MICRO);
4813  } catch (const std::exception& e) {
4814  LogPrintf("Failed to dump mempool: %s. Continuing anyway.\n", e.what());
4815  return false;
4816  }
4817  return true;
4818 }
4819 
4822 double GuessVerificationProgress(const ChainTxData& data, const CBlockIndex *pindex) {
4823  if (pindex == nullptr)
4824  return 0.0;
4825 
4826  int64_t nNow = time(nullptr);
4827 
4828  double fTxTotal;
4829 
4830  if (pindex->nChainTx <= data.nTxCount) {
4831  fTxTotal = data.nTxCount + (nNow - data.nTime) * data.dTxRate;
4832  } else {
4833  fTxTotal = pindex->nChainTx + (nNow - pindex->GetBlockTime()) * data.dTxRate;
4834  }
4835 
4836  return pindex->nChainTx / fTxTotal;
4837 }
4838 
4839 class CMainCleanup
4840 {
4841 public:
4842  CMainCleanup() {}
4843  ~CMainCleanup() {
4844  // block headers
4845  BlockMap::iterator it1 = mapBlockIndex.begin();
4846  for (; it1 != mapBlockIndex.end(); it1++)
4847  delete (*it1).second;
4848  mapBlockIndex.clear();
4849  }
4850 } instance_of_cmaincleanup;
